Ainsi avec cette nouvelle acquisition, il pourra bien répondre à la demande de ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of photocopiers and toners for copying/office supplies business

loans.name: Muhammad Arif

texts.en: Muhammad Arif, son of A. J., is a 50-year-old man. Muhammad Arif returned to his home country, Afghanistan, several months ago, and he is currently living in the district of Sorkhrood in the Ningarhar province. There are 6 people in his family, yet he is the family member who must support the entire family. Therefore, he opened a retail food shop in the Sorkhrood bazaar. Nevertheless, he wants to improve this business by buying more materials for his shop. Accordingly, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 30,000 Afghanis ($625) through AFSG to achieve his goals with respect to his shop.

loans.use: To improve and expand his shop's operations by purchasing additional materials

loans.name: Kafe Semiria Group

texts.en: Amidu C. is the Kafe Semiria group leader and is married with 7 children. Fifty years old, Amidu sells second-hand clothes in Magburaka town. With his previous loan, he increased his stock by 3 bails of clothes and generated more income. His business is the major source of income for the family, and he was able to meet his children's educational expenses. He would like to increase his inventory and use the income/profit to invest in agricultural production. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 2,800,00 (Le. 700,000 each) to expand their various businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more bails of used clothes and generate more income

loans.name: Sann

texts.en:
Sann S., 34, sells and collects recyclable materials in Kampong Cham. She typically makes US $7 each day, while her husband, Leang Chhun Heng, works alongside her. They have just recently begun this recycling business, and they are already looking to expand their business to increase profits.

They have four young children in their home, three of whom are students, who require money to support their education. Inflation has been very difficult in Cambodia over the past year and many people are seeking to increase their income to support their families.

Sann S. has asked for a loan of US $600 to purchase a large quantity of recyclable materials to resell for a larger profit. She believes this investment will be a great opportunity for her family and she looks forward to the stability that it can provide for her family.

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity of recyclable materials

loans.name: Thi Mai's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi Mai (ID Number 09050095), 36 years old, lives with her husband and her two small children. Everyday, she cooks rice wine and takes care of the pigs, while her husband works as a construction project bidder. Therefore, her family's income is frequent and stable. The average daily income is about 120,000VND (8USD) to 150,000VND (10USD). This time, she would like to borrow 3,186,000VND to purchase more pigs to breed. Her group also consists of:
  • Nguyen Thi Trinh (ID Number 09050096), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pig feeds and duck feeds.
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi Hien(ID Number 09050097), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase silk worms.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Ha (ID Number 09050098), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pigs to breed.
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi Hien (ID Number 09050099), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pigs to breed.
  • Mrs. C. Thi Thom (ID Number 09050100), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pigs and silk worms.
  • Ngo Thi Lien (ID Number 09050101), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase animal feeds.
  • The total amount requested is 1,375.00USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    chị Ngô thị Mai năm nay 36 tuổi MS 09050095 chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ.Hằng ngày chị nấu rượu, chăn nuôi nhiều lợn, chồng chị là chủ thầu xây dựng. vì vậy gia đình chị thu nhập khá thường xuyên và ổn định, mức thu nhập bình quân mỗi ngày từ 120.000 VND đến 150.000 VND/ ngày. Lần này chị đăng ký tham gia ở mức 3.186.000 VND để bổ sung vốn mua lợn giống. các thành viên trong nhóm Chị như sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Trình MS 09050096 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn, cám vịt
  • chị Ngô thị Hiền MS 09050097 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để làm tơ kén
  • chị Nguyễn thị Hà MS 09050098 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • chị Ngô thị Hiển MS 09050099 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • chị C. thị Thơm MS 09050100 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua lợn, làm tơ kén
  • chị Ngô thi Liên MS 09050101 vay mức 3.186.000 VND dể mua thức ăn chăn nuôi

loans.use: Breeding pigs

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina inició el negocio ya que deseaba percibir un mayor ingreso ya que trabajaba como empleada doméstica y lo que ganaba no era suficiente para solventar las necesidades familiares y el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente y gracias a su deseo de mejorar encontró en las ventas una forma distinta pero efectiva para obtener un ingreso ya que por haber trabajado en varios empresas conoce a mucho gente a la que le ha ofrecido zapatos que es lo que vende y le han respondido muy bien, comenzó en el mes de Marzo de 1998primero ayudandole a una vecina a vender zapatos y ella le daba una comisión por cada venta. Poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes y por lo mismo su vecina ya no podía surtirle a tiempo por lo que decidío independizarse y hacer ella la venta directamente para lo cual junto un poco de capital y así pudo iniciar su propio negocio, al mismo tiempo que las ganancias eran totalmente para ella.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y surtir los pedidos de sus clientes lo cual le permitirá seguir conservárlos y que sus ganancias no disminuyan.
texts.en:
Cristina started her business because she wanted to increase her income; she already had a job as a housekeeper, but what she and her husband earned wasn't enough to cover the costs for her family's needs. Thanks to her desire to get ahead, she discovered that getting involved in sales would be a different but effective way to earn additional income. She has worked in various businesses and knows a lot of people that she has been able to turn into clients for her new business selling shoes. Many people have been interested in her products; she started in March 1998 by helping a neighbor sell shoes. Cristina received a commission for each sale, and she slowly increased the number of clients. Eventually, her neighbor couldn't supply all of the customers, so Cristina decided to start her own independent business. She raised a small amount of money to start the business and now makes her own income selling shoes.

Cristina needs a $400 loan, which she will repay in 6 months. She is seeking the loan in order to purchase merchandise and fill her customers' orders. This will ensure that she doesn't lose clients or her income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Bùi Thị Bộ tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003. Trước kia khi chưa tham gia vào Quỹ đời sống kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn, đến nay kinh tế gia đình đã ổn định hơn trước khi vào Quỹ rất nhiều, các con được học hành chu đáo hơn, gia đình chị có 3 người con hiện 1 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 1 con đã đi làm cho thu nhập bình quân 1.200.000đ/ tháng, 1 con hiện đang đi học, các vòng vốn vay gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Từ việc đầu vốn có hiệu quả gia đình chị  đã sửa sang được công trình phụ và mua sắm được một số đồ dùng trang thiết bị trong nhà. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ.
Thu nhập bình quân. 4000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bùi Thị Bộ joined the TYM Fund in 2003. Before her participation in the fund, her family experienced financial difficulties because they lacked the capital for business ventures. Today, her family's financial situation is much better than before participation in the fund. All of her children have been able to focus more on their academics. She has three children - one is grown and has left the household, one is employed with an average income of 1,200,000 VND per month, and one is attending school. Her family has used each loan to invest into the rearing of pigs and chicken. Ever since the first loan, her family has had good results allowing them to create a savings and purchase various household items. For this loan cycle, her family wants to borrow 9,000,000 VND. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing pigs and chicken

loans.name: Anzurat

texts.en: Anzurat has a small business – cooking all kinds of cakes and selling them at the market. Her husband is a simple worker and doesn’t earn that much. So to help her husband she started cooking cakes and selling them at the markets. But her cakes were so tasty that clients started to order cakes right in her house. She wants to take a loan for purchasing good cooking equipment and thus produce more cakes.

loans.use: Purchasing equipment for cooking.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 49 años, es divorciada, vive con sus cuatro hijos menores de edad. Ella es agricultora, cultiva cítricos por más de 30 años, ya que es la actividad que le ayudó a  mantener su hogar. Ella comenta que  dentro de su trabajo lo que más le gusta es  cosechar, por lo divertido que le parece  el treparse a los árboles y  sacar los frutos, estos son los más rentables por la identificación de la zona selva con ellos. Sin embargo lo difícil es tener que limpiar  sus  árboles de naranja  y protegerlos de los  insectos. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Rosa comprará  insecticidas y abonos para sus plantaciones con el dinero que solicita.
texts.en:
49-year old Rosa is divorced and lives with her four children. She is a farmer and has grown citrus fruit for more than 30 years. The income from this business has helped her support her family. She says that the most pleasing part of her work is the harvest—she enjoys climbing up the trees to gather the fruit. The fruit is very profitable--people like it as it comes from the jungle. On the other hand, the most difficult part of her work is keeping her orange trees disease-free and protecting them from insects. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money she plans to buy insecticide and fertilizer for the trees.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: Mr. Chet C. is a villager in Krodas Khor village in Kampong Cham province. He is a palm juice collector who gathers it to process into palm sugar and wine. His wife, Mrs. Choeun Yuth, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a small problem because her field has infertile soil which affects her crop. In order to solve this problem, Mr. Chet C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the field to make his crop more productive. He is 28 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school. His wife is also presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the field to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce S. is 40 years old. She is a divorced woman with four kids. Her first-born has completed senior high school and she is hoping to enter nursing school. Joyce lives with her family at Agogo, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. For the past seven years, all that Joyce has been doing to support her household is baking bread. She says that though it was difficult in the beginning, now she sees changes in her business growth.

Joyce bakes bread and retails it. She says, she gives best value for money by making sure that her food quality meets her customers' expectations. Her customers book their orders in advance and before they come it is ready. She also retails to individuals for their morning breakfast. She says the price of commodities is increasing which is making it difficult for her to buy more raw materials from the market. And the daily demand for bread is high. She says she bakes at most 800 loaves of bread in a day.

Joyce needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk, and firewood, etc. She said your assistance would be most welcome.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth K., 43, and her husband, Mr. Vun Kuch, 42, live along national road number one about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children: two sons and two daughters, all of whom are in school.

Sareth and her husband have been selling flowers and bananas for the past twenty-seven years. The couple does farming as well; they grow vegetables and rice. Harvest season is coming soon, and Sareth needs to find a proper place to keep rice, which she can’t keep in the open-air space on the ground floor of her house.

Therefore, Sareth is asking for a loan of $1,200 to concrete her house foundation and build a concrete room under her wooden house to store her produce. In the past, she rented her relative’s house to keep her rice produce but it is not convenient.

loans.use: To build a storage space under her house to store rice

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
She works hard, and faithfully helps her husband with earning the family income. Mrs. Jenefer C. is 31years old and resides at Cawa-Cawa, Dapitan City. The couple is blessed with two children and are very conscious of the children's future. They borrowed money to different lending institutions and started their business; motorcycle parts supply. 

On March 18, 2008, Jenefer turned to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and became a member. She likes the insurance and other benefits that she enjoys with the Cooperative. She has borrowed twice already and recently applied for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of motorcycle parts. She wishes to continue and operate her business successfully and she expects to pay her loans with no default.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for motorcycle parts

loans.name: Jenny Agustina

texts.es: La señora Jenny tiene 45 años de edad, casada, residen ene. Bo la fuente, tiene dos hijos  de 18 y 12 años de edad, los dos estudiantes, su esposo se desempeña en docente de secundaria y ella también es docente de secundaria con veinticinco años de experiencia, con esta solicitud de crédito va invertir en infraestructura en el cambio sistema eléctrico que le ha estado dando problema. Lo cual quiere prevenir y proteger a su familia. Sus planes  es poder seguir estudiando el magisterio para ser una profesional y poder dar una buena educación a sus hijos, también poder seguir haciendo mejora a su casa
texts.en:
Jenny is 45 years old and is married. She lives in Bo la Fuente, and has two children, aged 18 and 12 years old, both of whom are students. Her husband is a high school teacher. She is also a high school teacher with 25 years' experience. With this loan request she will invest in the repair of the electrical system that has recently been problematic. She wants to protect and provide for her family. Her plans are to be able to keep her Master's degree studies to become a professional and to give her children a good education, and to be able to keep making improvements to their home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase electrical wiring to repair their home.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria vive en la  calle “Bolivar” de la zona de Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Ella, es soltera vive junto a su cuñada y sus sobrinos.

Posee una  pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de consumo al por menor, ubicada en la puerta del mismo domicilio.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías (pan, sodas, dulces, leche, etc.) para su negocio y así incrementar sus ventas
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Victoria lives on "Bolivar Street" in the Rio Seco area of the city El Alto. She is single, but lives with her brother-in-law and her nephews. Victoria owns a little grocery store, located in the doorway of her own house, from which she sells consumer goods at retail. She will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise (bread, sodas, sweets, milk, etc.) for her business, and by doing so she will increase her sales. This is her first loan with Impro, whose evaluation of Victoria classifies her as fit to be granted a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de pan, sodas, dulces, leche, arroz, etc., para su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.name: Madougou

texts.fr:
Madougou Sangaré est une veuve de 62 ans qui réside avec sa coépouse et leurs enfants chez leur défunt époux  à Mancourani II, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle  s’initia aux activités de petit commerce, d’achat-vente des pagnes wax et des tissus brodés il y a plus de trente ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits. Elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes des localités environnantes.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ sept  ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, il est a son huitième prêt individuel et tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 37 complets de tissus brodés et 23 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako ensuite elle les revend de façon ambulante à Sikasso et souvent dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Madougou Sangaré is a widow of 62 who lives with her co-spouse and their children in the house of their late husband in Mancourani II, in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Not having had a chance to go to school for socio-economic reasons, she began petty trading, buying and selling lengths of high-quality colorful African cloth and embroidered fabrics, 30 years ago. She is much in demand with a clientele (composed essentially of women) drawn by the high quality of her merchandise. She gets lots of orders from the surrounding areas.

With the desire to better satisfy her ever growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about 7 years ago. After several solidarity loans (group loans) with an association of women from her neighborhood, she is on her 8th individual loan and all her preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

With this loan she intends to buy 37 outfits made of embroidered cloth and 23 lengths of high quality (wax) African print cloth. She does her buying in Bamako and then sells her merchandise door-to-door in Sikasso and frequently in the localities surrounding Sikasso. She expects to make, with this loan, a monthly profit of 150,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to grow her working capital, contribute to family expenses, pay the interest on her loan, and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of African print cloth and embroidered fabrics

loans.name: Khudoykul

texts.ru:
Худойкул Исмоилов  1960 года рождения. Занимается животноводством 15 лет. Дома имее 8 голов крупнорогатого скота. В откорме скота Худойкулу помогают его сыновья Назир и Насим.
Жена Худойкула и его 3 дочерей перерабатывают молоко полученное от дойной коровы. Даже самая младшая дочка Худойкула, которой исполнилось 6 лет, уже умеет доить корову, и без страха подходит к ней.
 Наш клиент просит сумму в размере 1500 сомони сроком на 6 меясцев, так как хочет купить баранов.
 Дополнительный доход в его семью приносит занятие нашего клиента сельским хозяйством. Он выращивает кукурузу.
texts.en:
Khudoykul I. was born in 1960. He has been in the animal husbandry for fifteen years. He has eight heads of large cattle. Khudoykul's sons Nazir and Nasim are helping him in feeding of the cattle. Khudoykul's wife and his three daughters process milk from the milk cow. Even his youngest daughter who just turned six already can milk a cow and approaches it without fear. Our client is asking for a loan for 1500 somoni (US$375) and wants to buy sheep. Khudoykul's family has additional income from his agriculture business, he grows corn.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Bờ Nguyễn Thị (727020918) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has two school-aged children.

Bờ owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling herbs and spices in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, Bờ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Bờ is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 41 year old. She is married and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children. Currently all her children are attending school in junior and primary level. She has been a local manufacturer of soaps five years. Georgina combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil in the making of her soaps. She is not able to produce soap in larger quantities due to lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up her production. She hopes to improved her income to support her children's education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and would be grateful for that support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil etc.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús C. B. reside en el departamento de La Paz. Teresa tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien es jornalero y obtiene ingresos de 80$ mensuales y Teresa posee un negocio donde se dedica a la venta  de pollo y cerdo con 4 años de experiencia la Sra. Teresa cuenta con gran demanda en pollo y cerdos los cuales no puede cubrir por falta de dinero es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de pollo y cerdos para luego ser vendidos y obtener un margen de ganancia por los mismo, es importante mencionar que Teresa ya ha manejado créditos anteriormente los cuales tiene cancelados y fue muy puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús C. B. lives in the department of La Paz. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband who is a day laborer and makes about $80 a month. Teresa has a business where she sells chickens and pigs. She has been doing this for four years and while there is great demand for her chicken and pigs, it does not make up for their lack of income.

For this reason she is asking for a loan in order to buy more chicken and pigs to be sold later to obtain a profit by it. It is important to mention that Teresa has handled loans before which have all been paid off and she is punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 43-years old, divorced and has three children who are currently in school. She has been responsible for her children since her husband left. Stella lives with her children in a family house.

Stella trades in various soft drinks and, for the past 12 years, has worked as a hair dresser. She is currently training four apprentices in her road side shop. At present, she buys her working materials, such as artificial hair, shampoo, pomades, creams, lotions, etc., from Accra central market. She is asking for a loan to buy these materials in bulk in order to be able to render quality services to her cherished clients. She aspires to grow her business and improve her family welfare.

loans.use: To buy products for a beauty salon

loans.name: Vida Group

texts.en:
Sira M. is an associate of Esperanza International living in Boca Chica, Dominican Republic. She lives in a cement house with her husband and six children and has access to occasional running water and electricity. From her hom, she runs a small restaurant that sells juice and typical Dominican cuisine.

Currently her eldest daughter runs the restaurant while she works in a nearby hotel in order to make ends meet. With the loan she will buy a toaster, a blender, and more stock supplies (sugar, rice, beans) to be able to produce more food and earn more money. She is hoping to expand her business enough for it to become her primary source of income, which will allow her to be her own boss and finish her roof. She hopes that this money will help her children get a better education. Sira also aspires to one day be a loan officer with Esperanza. She is very grateful for all of your support.

Sira is part of a loan group, and this loan will be distributed amongst the members.

loans.use: To support member business which include purchasing foodstock for a restaurant

loans.name: Nohemí

texts.es:
En el mercado central de León, la señora Nohemí O. tiene su propio establecimiento de pulpería donde oferta los productos de granos básicos, comestibles, productos, personales, entre otros.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy entusiasta y esforzada debido a que ha logrado mejorar su situación en el negocio poco a poco a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo. Por esta razón espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito para así utilizarlo directamente en la compra de los productos como aceite, granos básicos, productos personales y otros para ofertarlos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Nohemí O. operates her own general store in León's central market, where she offers products such as bulk grains, groceries, and personal care items, among others. She stands out as a very enthusiastic and hardworking person, since she has gradually been able to improve the situation of her business over time. She hopes, therefore, that Ceprodel will provide her with a loan so that she can use it right away to purchase merchandise such as cooking oil, grains, personal care items, and other products to be offered to customers in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na L. lives in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she makes cake to sell to earn income. She is 49 years old widow with two children, one of whom is employed while the other is attending the local school. Now Mrs. Na L. is requesting a loan to buy five piglets and pig food for breeding pigs business. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy five piglets and pig food for breeding pigs business.

loans.name: Puriza

texts.en:
Motorcycle transport is the primary source of income of Puriza and her husband Crispin in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. Aside from the transport business, Crispin is also engaged in farming, while Puriza sometimes sells bamboo shoots in their village to earn extra income. 

For the continuous development of their transport business, Puriza is again requesting a loan amounting to PHP7,000 from lenders. She hopes that her loan will again be approved to enable her retail business to grow and earn more profit. 

Puriza & Crispin's three elder children have already graduated from college while the youngest is presently enrolled in college getting a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. The couple hope that their youngest child will also receive a college degree.

loans.use: To buy some materials for their transport business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 54 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, D. los cuales, 2 D. ellos viven en su casa. Con mucha destreza y habilidad en sus manos, Gladys elabora mantas, frazadas D. lanas y hermosas mantas con matices muy atractivos y D. colores joviales. Realizar este trabajo no le causa dificultad, puesto que lo aprendió D. pequeña; aparentemente no le presta atención a lo que hace, pues mientras va conversando sus manos van trabajando. 
Gladys prefiere tejer desD. las 3 hasta la 5 D. la mañana, y el resto del día lo dedica a las labores domesticas; y por las tardes cose las mochilas D. artesanía con las telas D. bonitos colores.
Posteriormente, cada domingo tiene que entregar los pedidos en la ciudad, mientras que su esposo es quien lleva las frazadas a otra ciudad aledaña. D. este modo es la vida D. una artesana como Gladys.  

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, durante el tiempo D. permanencia en su banco comunal ha demostrado compromiso y puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo va invertir en la compra D. lana D. cordero y otras lanas sintéticas para matizar sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 54 years old, married, and has 3 children of whom 2 still live at home. With great skill and manual dexterity, Gladys makes brightly colored blankets and shawls. She does not find the work difficult since she learned this skill at a young age. Gladys can have a conversation without paying attention to what she is doing because her hands automatically do all the work. She likes to weave between 3-5am so that she can devote the rest of the day to her household chores. In the evenings, she makes satchels in beautiful colors. Subsequently, she travels to the city every Sunday to deliver her orders. Meanwhile her husband travels to another nearby city to deliver blankets. For Gladys, this is the life of an artisan.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. As a member of her Communal Bank, she has demonstrated commitment and punctuality with her payments. Gladys will use the money she requested to buy natural and synthetic wool for producing various items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Galhuu

texts.en: Galhuu is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of his sons, 17 and 10, attend a local secondary school while Galhuu and his wife operate a raw materials business. He sells goat and sheep skins, which he purchases from the countryside and transports to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He began his business in 2000, and since then he has developed relationships with customers and suppliers that he trusts. He says, “Hard work is the one thing that makes a person’s life better.” Galhuu is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more skins so that he can increase his sales and profits. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more skins and raw material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Reyneria

texts.es: Reyneria de 58 años, es casada y vive con sus dos hijos mayores, quienes trabajan y la ayudan; también con  su esposo, quien se dedica a la compra y venta  de madera, en su acogedora casa que  es propia.Ella vende gran diversidad de ropa para todos los gustos, tanto para adultos y niños; esta mercadería  la vende por las distintas calles donde vive, y semanalmente comercializa  por los caseríos cercanos o por la carretera, en esta actividad se desempeña ya  6 meses y le va muy bien ya que no tiene mucha carga familiar y solo se encarga de sus gastos y los de su esposo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y se relaciona intercambiando ideas con sus clientes. Le es muy rentable porque sus productos salen a diario, y solo trabaja con pedidos. Posteriormente quiere alquilar un local en donde podrá aperturar su tienda de ropa.Es la segunda  vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque siente que existe compañerismo y sobre todo porque todos los integrantes son responsables.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo  en la compra  de mayor cantidad de ropa  para seguir vendiendo y además mandará a construir un pequeño kiosco para poner otro tipo de negocio (venta de bebidas heladas: gaseosas y cervezas).
texts.en:
Reyneria is 58 years old, married, and lives with her two adult children who work and support her. Her husband buys and sells wood from their cramped home. Reyneria offers a wide variety of clothing for adults and children that everyone likes. She sells her merchandise on different streets near where she lives and travels weekly to nearby villages or along the highway. Reyneria has already been in this business for six months and has done very well because she does not many family responsibilities and only assumes the expenses for herself and her husband. What she enjoys most about her work is traveling to different places and the social interaction with her customers. Her business is very profitable because her products are sold every day and she only works based on the orders she receives. Sometime later she wants to rent a space where she can open a clothing store.

This is her second loan with MFP. Reyneria likes her Communal Bank because there is a feeling of camaraderie and all the members are responsible. She plans to use the proceeds of the loan to buy a large quantity of clothing to keep her business going. In addition, she plans to build a small kiosk for selling cold beverages, such as sodas and beer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of clothing

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Ismael al igual que su esposa son clientes distinguidos de nuestra Institución ya que anteriormente habían solicitado el crédito para el pago de unos gastos médicos, y ahora están tramitando este crédito para terminar la construcción de una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda, para mayor protección de la familia y del hogar. 
El labora para un laboratorio medico y su esposa en una óptica en el área del mostrador, son una familia joven pero muy unida y responsable.
texts.en:
Both Ismael and his wife are distinguished clients of our institution who have had loans with us in the past to pay for medical expenses. Currently, they are requesting funding to complete construction of a wall on the rear of their home to provide better security and protection to the family and to the home. He works for a medical laboratory and his wife works in an optician's office as a salesclerk. They are a young but very united and responsible family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete construction of rear wall.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly E., 44 years old, tills a small rice farm that she owns. She has eight children. She dreams of having a good harvest to earn a better income for her family. She needs additional money to buy all the farming necessities like fertilizers and seeds. She would like a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will help a lot to sustain her livelihood and realize her plans for her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Babak

texts.en: Babak B., 22, is a very enthusiastic young entrepreneur who has sold electrical goods in a small shop in Agsu city for the past three years. His father added to his experience by teaching him the best practices in selling goods and communicating with customers. Babek`s dream is to build his own family one day and for this purpose he needs to increase his income. This guy really believe that you can be a part of his business!

loans.use: purchase more electrical goods

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Teriya sont majoritairement des femmes mariées (6 mariées et une veuve). Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles au quartier Noukoula de la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Baouréli, quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers essentiellement l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires et  des céréales.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les 4 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe  Teriya  sont à leur  5 prêt solidaire.
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales (haricot mil, maïs, fonio, riz) et  plusieurs variétés de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs et grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes à Noukoula et au marché de Konobougou, au comptant en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 17.000FCFA qui servira à étoffer leur fonds de commerce et subvenir aux dépenses ayant trait à la nourriture, à la scolarité des enfants et à la santé.
texts.en:
The majority of the seven members of the Teriya group are married (six married and one widow). They are on average 40 years old with three children and they all live in traditional families in the Noukoula district of the town of Konobougo, which lies in the "prefecture" of Baouréli, the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women got to know each other through relatives and trade various products, essentially buying and selling condiments and cereals. Having repaid four previous loans without incident, the women in the Teriya group are on their 5th group loan. They are planning to use this new loan to buy 4 tons of cereal (beans, millet, corn, fonio, rice) and several varieties of condiments. They get their supplies principally from local producers and wholesalers and they sell their goods in Noukoula and on the market in Konobougou, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of both women and men. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 17,000 FCFA each, which will be used to boost their working capital and to cover expenses relating to food, their children's schooling and health.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various articles

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
La Sra. Shirley, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Decididas II” del Distrito de Tarapoto,  Región San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años y es madre 02 hijos, 01 que aun estudia y esta en la universidad.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, por idea de una amiga tiene por actividad el trabajo de Tapicería ubicada en su casa con la ayuda de su maquina de coser, trabaja juntamente con su esposo.

En la actualidad se dedica al mismo negocio, con pedidos anticipadamente de sus clientes que a diario acuden a su casa y con este préstamo de S/2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, ampliara su negocio comprando, tela en rollos, hilos para coser los tapizados ya sea de muebles, motokar y vehículos motorizados, esta orgullosa por su trabajo.

Se siente una mujer realizada  por lo que agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido para desarrollarse como mujer y empresaria
texts.en:
Ms. Shirley belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Decididas II” in the Tarapoto District, San Martín Region and the San Martín Department. She is married and she is 57 years old. She is the mother of 2 children, 1 child is still studying and is attending university.

With the first loan of de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, based on a friend’s idea, she now works on upholstery in her home with the help of her sewing machine. She works with her husband.

Currently they work in the same business and the clients’ requests come to the home daily. With this loan of S/2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will expand her business by buying rolls of fabric, thread for sewing the upholstery for the furniture, a moto-taxi and motorized vehicles. She is proud of her work.

She feels like an accomplished woman therefore she is grateful for the opportunity offered by the Manuela Ramos Movement, so she can develop as a woman and businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric, different colors of thread to make the upholstery

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: Née en 1960, B. Joséphine vit depuis 50 ans au quartier Midombo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Joséphine a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Joséphine ne vit plus avec son mari. Joséphine vit donc seule et assure seule ses différents besoins. N’ayant jamais été à l’école, Joséphine vend du charbon de bois à son domicile, depuis une dizaine d’année. Parallèlement à cette activité, Joséphine vend également du maïs à son domicile. Joséphine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. L’activité de Joséphine lui procure des revenus l’aidant à faire face à ses besoins. Joséphine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu cinq crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Actuellement, Joséphine n’a pas pu réunir les moyens financiers suffisants pouvant l’aider à augmenter davantage le stock de ses produits et à mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un sixième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1960, Joséphine B. has been living for 50 years in the neighborhood of Midombo in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. She has two children, one of whom attends school. She no longer lives with her husband and provides alone for her various needs. Never having attended school, Joséphine sells wood charcoal from her home. Parallel to this activity, she also sells corn from her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, international market of Benin. Joséphine’s activity provides her with an income, which helps her meet her needs. She is an old time ALIDé customer having received five loans that she reimbursed fully. Currently, Joséphine is not able to bring together sufficient financial means to help her increase the stock of her products and to better meet the demand of her customers. This is what is driving her to request a sixth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of wood charcoal and corn.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily K. is a widowed woman with a daughter, 25, and a grandchild, who is turning 4 years old this week and who attends school. Emily has a poultry business and breeds broilers. She has been in this business for one year. The challenge of her business is from the seasonality of her goods as it is busiest in April for Easter, August when many people vacation on the coast, and December during the holidays. 

Previously, Emily taught dressmaking. She now gains additional income from working as a tailor and hairdresser. She owns her home and does not have piped water or electricity. She cites her greatest expenses as food, water, and paraffin.  

With the 25,000 Kenyan shilling (Kes) loan Emily is requesting, she wants to purchase more chicken. Emily is the chairwoman of her loan group and joined Yehu for the support that they provide. She hopes to succeed in life and her wish is that her granddaughter attains higher education.

loans.use: To buy chicken for resale.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura S. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old, married and has 11 children. 4 of her children are still going to school. To make a living, Laura owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Laura has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Laura joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Laura is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Laura from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Guljakhon

texts.ru: Тагоева Гулчахон проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж. работает учителем в средней школе. Сама Гулчахон имеет высшее образование "Педагог". Работает по профессии. Кроме того занимается торговлей. У нее продуктовый магазин. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Guljakhon T. lives in the region of Yavan. She is 40 years old. She is married and has five children. Her husband works as a teacher in a secondary school. Guljakhon has high education in teaching. She works in her profession. She is also in retail and has a grocery store. She has been in this business for more than six years. She is taking out the loan to increase variety of merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase variety of merchanidse

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas tiene 51 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos que aún estudian, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Zaña, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus constumbres afro – peruanas. Se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la compra y venta de arroz. El compra sacos de arroz en los molinos de la ciudad de Chiclayo y luego los ofrece en venta en las bodegas y negocios de la ciudad de Cajamarca. Esta actividad es muy rentable ya que la región Cajamarca, por ser una región ubicada en la sierra del país, no cuenta con este producto de consumo diario al alcance de su mano. Actualmente esta actividad es la única que le brinda ingresos económicos, por lo que se esfuerza al máximo para mantenerla.

Nicolas se ha vuelto conocido en la zona y cada vez son mas las personas que solicitan su producto, por ello desea adquirir mas sacos de arroz para poder aumentar sus ventas. Siguiendo su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Nicolas en un padre entregado a su trabajo y a su familia. Sus vecinos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 51 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. He and his family live in Zaña, a district known on a regional level for its Afro-Peruvian customs. This area is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Nicolas has been buying and selling rice for a year. He purchases sacks of rice from the mills in the city of Chiclayo and then sells them to grocery stores and businesses in the city of Cajamarca. This type of business is very profitable in Cajamarca because it is located in a mountainous area of the country where everyday consumer products are not readily available. At the moment, this business is his only source of income, so Nicolas invests all of his efforts into maintaining it.

Nicolas has become well-known in the area and more people are requesting his product. For this reason, he wants to buy more sacks of rice so that he can increase his sales. To meet this goal, Nicolas is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

Nicolas is a father who is dedicated to his work and his family. His neighbors consider him to be a peaceful and responsible person. His greatest wish is to provide his children with a quality education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 60 years old and married with three adult-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Anita has been in business for more than three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Anita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Salie

texts.en:
36 year old Salie S. aims to grow her “sari-sari” store into a grocery store which can provide wholesale grocery items, foodstuff, beverages and other basic commodities. “Sari-sari” means various foodstuffs, beverages and an assortment of grocery items are sold in a small open room of their house. This is the kind of income generating activity that Salie has been enjoying since the time she joined ASHI and had her loan. The small profit she makes in addition to her husband’s income as a hired jeep driver helps them meet the needs of her three children. This way, she is able to maintain her family’s good health.

Being a mother, Salie has so many dreams for her children. A top priority is to ensure that they have a degree in college to ensure a better career. While they are still young, she wanted to request more loans to increase her capital investment and make her business stable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, foodstuff and beverages for the inventories of her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Bailarines Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Bailarines está conformado por Blas Antonio F., María Ines M. Mejía y Jenny Vanessa M. G. quienes son horrados, trabajadores, esforzados y emprendedores. Este grupo ha fructificado sus negocios por medio la oferta de créditos y  los programas de  capacitación los cual les ha permitido desarrollar sus negocios tener recursos y la forma de administrarlos.

El coordinador del grupo es el señor Blas Antonio F. quien es una persona muy activa e independiente. El inicio en el 2002 con una pequeña venta de de chiverías la cual por medio de los prestamos fue creciendo hasta tener una pulpería surtida en la que invertirá el crédito con la compra de granos básicos, chiverías, verduras, frutas etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo  María Ines M. Mejía de 25 años de edad comercializa perfumes desde el 2006 y Jenny Vanessa M. G. quien comenzó vendiendo ropa por encargo luego instalo una pequeña tienda con una docena.
texts.en:
The Los Bailarines (The Dancers) group members are: Blas Antonio F., María Inés M. Mejía and Jenny Vanessa M. G.. They are honest, hard working, dedicated and enterprising. The group has strengthened their businesses thanks to loans and training workshops that have helped them develop their businesses, have resources and learn to administer them well. The group coordinator is Mr. Blas Antonio F. who is a very active and independent person. In 2002 he began selling yoghurt products. Thanks to the loans, the business gradually grew until he had a well-stocked grocery store. He will use the funds to invest in stock items like: basic grains, yoghurt products, vegetables, fruits, etc. The other group members are: María Inés M. Mejía, 25, who has sold perfume since 2006 and Jenny Vanessa M. G. who started out selling clothing on order and then set up a small store with a dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana nació en la ciudad de Urcos y actualmeente vive en la ciudad del Cusco donde vive con su esposo y sus cuatros hermosos hijos. 

Juana al ver que tenía mucha demanda la leña. Utilizo sus ahorros para abrir un stand en su domicilio, donde vende leña. La pueden encontrar en su puesto, los 7 días de la semana, desde muy temprano hasta bastante tarde de la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro de leña. Juana desprende una imagen de experiencia y amabilidad. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su puesto. Ella vende leña seca y a un costo barato. Su esposo Daniel es chofer y tiene su propio taxi y brida servicio de transportes en la ciudad del Cusco.  
     
Con su próximo préstamo, Juana espera recibir $400 USD. Por el momento, su puesto esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar leña y para hacer mantenimientos del taxi.  

Juana pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.  El sueño de la socia es sacar profesionales a sus hijos y construir casa de materia noble.
texts.en:
Juana was born in the city of Urcos, and she now lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and their four beautiful children. Juana saw that there was much demand for firewood. She used her savings to open a stand in her home where she sells firewood. She can be found at her stand seven days a week, from very early until rather late at night or until her supply of firewood is gone. Juana presents an image of experience and friendliness, and a regular flow of customers visits her stand. She sells dry firewood at a low cost. Her husband Daniel is a driver. He has his own taxi and offers transportation services in the city of Cusco. With her next loan, Juana hopes to receive $400 (US). At this time, her stand is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. She would like to use the money from the loan to buy firewood and to do maintenance on the taxi. Juana belongs to the community bank "El Amanecer" (the dawn). She has participated in the community bank for several loan cycles, and her fellow bank members have reconfirmed their confidence in her. Her dream is for her children to have careers and to build a house of quality materials.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood and do maintenance on the taxi

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat, shown in the photo with her loom, is 35 years old and her husband, Mr. Saveun Chheu, is 35 years old. They have been married since 1995 and have two young daughters. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Sinat has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a construction worker for ten years.

Sinat wants to supplement her income with another business: raising pigs. So she is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy piglets and pig feed. She will also use a part of the loan to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and pig feed plus silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Jazmina Amalia

texts.es:
Jazmina tiene la edad de 30 años, madre de tres hijos, casada, siendo su esposo mecánico. 
Ella se desempeña como promotora de ventas para el inss. Ambos trabajando para lograr mejores condiciones de vivienda. Ya que la parte de atrás de los baños esta forrada de plástico lo que desea mejorar para lograr tener mejor higiene como privacidad en sus necesidades.

Para esto comprara materiales de construcción como: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro y así poder hacer esta obra. Siendo Afodenic un apoyo mediante el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Jazmina, 30, is married and has three children; her husband is a mechanic. She works as a sales promoter for INSS (Nicaraguan Social Security Institute). Both work to attain better living conditions. The rear of their bathroom is made of plastic sheeting and she wants to have better hygienic conditions and privacy. To do so, she will buy concrete blocks, sand, cement and iron rods. Afodenic is a source of support through the financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy sand, cement, iron rods in order to build a bathroom and have better hygienic conditions.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, de 45 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposa Irene de 42 años y de su pequeño hijo Marti de 10 años, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan en un barrio comercial ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Desde joven aprendió a manejar autos y luego cuando debió sacar adelante a su familia no dudo en empezar a trabajar brindando el servicio de taxi por las calles de la gran ciudad. Ya han pasado varios años y dice que en la actualidad obtiene regulares ganancias, pues no solo trabaja con ocasionales pasajeros, sino también con pasajeros fijos, que lo llaman cuando quieren movilizarse con seguridad. Además como su auto es propio él mismo fija sus rutas y horarios, pues le agrada trabajar solo de día y por las noches descansa. Por lo general empieza a trabajar desde las 6 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde, y solo descansa a la hora de almuerzo. Así transcurren  los días de este empeñoso hombre, que tiene pensado  para el futuro comprar un auto más, y brindarlo en alquiler. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere decepcionar a las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le pemitira continuar con su negocio. Mario tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de llantas nuevas para su auto, pues las que tiene están algo deterioradas; además mandará su auto a la mecánica, pues necesita mantenimiento, de esta manera espera mejorar el servicio que ofrece.
texts.en:
Mario is 45 years old and he lives in his own home together with his wife Irene, 42 years old, and their young son Marti, 10 years old. They live in a commercial district located north of the city. Since he was young he learned to drive a car and later when he had a family to support, he never thought twice about providing taxi services in the streets of this great city. Many years have passed and he now has a steady source of income, especially because he does not only work with occasional passengers but he also has some steady clients that call him when they need to travel safely and securely. Additionally, since it is his own care that he drives he decides his own routes and his own schedule. He likes to work alone in the days and at nights he rests. Generally he starts work at 6 in the morning and finishes at 6 in the evening, only taking a break for lunch. This is a typical day for the hard working person. In the future he has planned to purchase another car and rent it out. This is a first time loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to making his payments on time. He does not want to disappoint the people that made this loan possible, a loan that will let him continue his work. Mario will invest the loan requested in the purchase of new tires for his car. The ones on his car now are very old. He will also bring his car to the repair shop for maintenance. This way he expects to improve the service he is able to offer.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To provide his car with necessary maintenance.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth D. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Janeth is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Janeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mick Onyango

texts.en:
Mick Onyango O. is a 40-year old secondhand clothes dealer in Kongowea, Mombasa. He has been in this business for the past year and his business is doing well. He is married to a woman named Vivian Achieng, who stays upcountry. She is a businesswoman who contributes to the family income. Together they are blessed with two children. 

Mick was introduced to KADET by a friend. He is now requesting his first loan to purchase more secondhand clothes for resale. He intends to expand his business with the anticipated profits. In the future, he hopes to lift his standard of living and succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.ar: عبد الله عمره 45 سنة متزوج وله ثلاثة اولاد يعمل بجد ونشاط يحب عائلته جدا ويسعى الى تحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي وتنمية عائلته يعمل في نقل الطلاب  يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء فان جديد اكبر لتوسيع عمله هو جدي جدا بالعمل ومحبوب من محيطه العملي  يلقى دعم كبير من عائلته لتطوير نفسه زبائنه هم من اصدقائه وجيرانه
texts.en: Abdallah is a 45-year-old husband and father of three, a diligent and proactive worker who loves his family greatly and seeks to improve his financial situation and advance his family, who are a great support to him. His work involves bussing students from the families of friends and neighbors. The applicant is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a new and larger van so that he can further expand capacity. He is very serious about his job and well-liked among those he works with.

loans.use: Purchase larger van.

loans.name: Policalo

texts.en:
Policalo M. is a resident and farmer in the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya.  He produces bananas, coffee, beans, maize, and milk that he sells locally.  He has been practicing mixed farming for the last two years.  He also runs a shop and earns additional income from his motorbike.  He has two employees on a temporary basis.

Policalo has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to develop a banana plantation and buy water pipes.  He hopes to buy four dairy cows and to have a good banana plantation with good returns.  His main challenges are unreliable labor, unpredictable weather conditions, and diseases.

loans.use: To develop a banana plantation

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en: Tolibjon is a married father of 4 children. His family lives in Istaravshan where Tolibjon runs a wholesale business selling juice and soft drinks. Tolibjon's store is well known in this neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours. Tolibjon has been in this business for 25 years. Now he is seeking a loan of 7000 somoni to purchase more juice and soft drinks to increase the stock he offers. Moreover, Tolibjon is hoping to spend a portion of the loan to buy insulation materials for his store to prepare it for the upcoming cold season. Tolibjon has had some struggles as his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable. However, he handled all these challenges well and is looking toward to the future with much enthusiasm and optimism. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country, known for its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a wider range of juice and soft drinks

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is from the village of Linconcomonan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Elizabeth is widowed and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas & rice per kilogram in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & rice. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas & rice

loans.name: Vahida

texts.en: Vahida Z. is a hard-working woman who lives in Sabirabad. She is 55 years old and lives with her husband and three children — two daughters and one son — aged between 23 and 28. Her son and husband are engaged in agriculture which did not cover all the family's needs. In 2005, to help provide for the family, she went into the business of selling jewelry, and since has gained a lot of clients. Vahida sells rings, watches, bracelets and other gold accessories. This is the first loan Vahida has taken from Aqroinvest and Kiva. She used this loan of 1500 AZN to invest in her jewely inventory, so as to increase the number of items for sale and boost her profit.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for sale

loans.name: Tsend-Ochir

texts.en:
Tsend-Ochir E. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. 

His oldest daughter is a university student while his younger two daughters both attend a local high school. 

Tsend-Ochir works as a carpenter to support his family. He has owned his carpentry business for almost 15 years and over this long time he has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and service. 

After Tsend-Ochir produces a variety of wooden items, his wife sells those products out of a shipping container that they own at the local market. 

After many years of running this business, he was able to start building his own work place which is under construction now. Tsend-Ochir plans to expand his business by hiring one more assistant carpenter in order to expand his production in the future. His earnings have enabled him to pay his oldest daughter's tuition fees and provide for his entire family. 

Tsend-Ochir is a hardworking man and is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more timber for his growing carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es:
Don Fidel, tiene 69 años de edad, reside en Santa Elena departamento de Usulután, vive con dos hijas, es viudo, las hijas tiene 38 y 26 años de edad, administra un negocio de venta de lácteos, este negocio es iniciativa propia, trabaja en su propia casa, con la ayuda de sus hijas y no tiene un horario fijo para atender el negocio.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para compra de leche y materiales para elaborar productos,  esta inversión le permitirá crecer y fortalecer el negocio, ayudándole a mantenerse firme en el mercado.
Las aspiraciones de don Fidel es instalar un negocio amplio, surtido de mercadería, y que las condiciones de vida de su familia cambien.
texts.en:
Fidel, age 69, lives in Santa Elena in the Usulután department.  He is a widower, and he lives with his two daughters, ages 38 and 26.  He manages a business selling dairy products.  He has the business through his own initiative.  He works in his own house with help from his daughters.  He does not have a fixed schedule for tending to his business.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy milk and materials to make products.  This investment will strengthen his business and allow it to grow.  It will help his business to stay strong in the market. 

Fidel strives to establish a comprehensive business that is stocked with merchandise.  He also hopes that his family’s living conditions change.

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses would like a loan to harvest two acres of maize plantation. He is a farmer living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He intends to educate his children and expand his plantation.

loans.use: Harvesting two acres of maize plantation

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Esta clienta labora como Archivista es Casada, es el # doce del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad que  le han dado esta institución con  este  desembolso para realizar  compra de  materiales, para reparación de tubería de agua potable  y mano de obra  de su vivienda ya que  estan en mala condicione para una mejor condicion.
texts.en: This client works as an archivist. She is married and this is the twelfth loan that CEPRODEL has offered her. She is grateful for the opportunity that CEPRODEL has given her through this funding, so that she can buy materials for repairing her home's water pipes. This loan will also pay for labor to improve the condition of her home, which is currently in poor condition.

loans.use: to buy pipes.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Maria Francisca R. R. tiene 27 años, Es divorciada vive con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del cantón.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca R. R. is 27 years old. She is divorced, she ha s3 children and she lives with her single children in Guaranda, a canton of the Bolívar province.

She is a member of the V.R.C. Grupo Enmanuel, a village bank located in San Juan, a precinct of the Guaranda canton. This bank has 17 members who work as farmers engaging in cultivating short cycle varieties of maize, wheat and potatoes in large quantities, as well as in breeding of animals such as pigs and hens.

Maria engages in agriculture, growing maize and breeding pigs and hens. She buys the products to feed his animals in the Comercial Silva every week-end, and he sells his animals every Thursday in the Guarada fair.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize, wheat and potatoes, to purchase animals, and to buy feeding and cropping supplies. The loan will economically help her fulfilling her needs, facing challenges such as pests, plant illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of owning a house.

She enjoys taking part in the canton’s celebrations.

loans.use: To sow maize, wheat and potatoes, to purchase animals, and to buy feeding and cropping supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Enma

texts.es:
Rosa Enma A. F., habita sola en su casa ya que sus hijos hicieron sus propios hogares y su esposo falleció. Doña Rosa es una mujer luchadora a pesar de su avanzada edad, durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado para salir adelante.  Vive en condiciones muy humildes pero con muchos ánimos y energías de salir adelante. 

Es una mujer creativa que ha hecho de su casa su propio negocio en el cual vende tortillas, pupusas, queso y crema. Ubicado en el Municipio de San Vicente del Departamento del mismo nombre. Tiene muchos clientes y es muy conocida en la zona gracias a su carisma. Siempre trata  de dar el mejor servicio a sus clientes y mantiene calidad e higiene en sus productos. 

Doña Rosa ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para tener la capacidad económica que le permitan aumentar más sus ventas y comprar la materia prima para su producto final como son: maíz, frijoles,variedad de queso,arroz,u otros necesarios para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de sabores en sus productos, todo esto con la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Enma A. F. lives alone in her home, as her children are already grown and in their own homes, and her husband passed away. Rosa is a hardworking woman who, despite her old age, has worked for a long time to get ahead. She lives in very humble conditions, but she has the energy and drive to succeed.

Rosa is a creative woman, who has made her home, located in the San Vincente Municipality of the San Vicente Department, into a business where she sells tortillas, pupusas (a type of stuffed flatbread), cheese and cream. She has a lot of clients, and she is very well known in the area thanks to her charisma. She always tries to give her clients the best service possible and maintain quality and sanitation in her products.
