Rosa has decided to apply for this loan with INTEGRAL to allow her to increase her sales and buy the necessary materials to continue investing in her business, such as maize, beans, a variety of cheeses, rice and other necessities to be able to offer greater variety and flavors in her products. With this investment, she aspires to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make tortillas and pupusas to sell.

loans.name: Juana Medaly

texts.es: Juana tiene 19 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Gana la vida vendiendo productos de belleza a sus vecinos en su comunidad. Vende sus productos por catalogo y toma pedidos de sus clientes. Cuenta con dos años de experiencia con este negocio. Juana es muy conocida en su caserío y cuenta con clientela establecida. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles. Esta inversión la ayudará responder a los pedidos que ya ha recibido. Con los ingresos de su negocio, ayuda a su esposo solventar los gastos familiares y de su hogar. Juana posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Juana, 19 years old, is married and has one son. She lives with her family in the district of Olmos, an agricultural zone with a lot of commercial activity located in the province of Lambayeque, about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

She makes her living selling beauty products to her neighbors in the community. She sells her products by catalog and takes orders from her clients. She has two years of experience with this business. Juana is well known in her neighborhood and counts on an established clientele. She wants to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise. For this she has decided to request a loan of 600 new sols. This investment will help her respond to the orders she has received. 

With the income from her business she helps her husband meet the family expenses of their home. Juana has very good personal and work references from her community.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for resale

loans.name: Joyda

texts.en:
Joyda M. is from the village of Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Joyda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Joyda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes  from raising pigs for sale. Joyda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joyda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joyda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Joyda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Joyda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Samwel Mwangi

texts.en:
Samwel has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 10 years. He is 38 years old, married to Julia Njabmi and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of KES.31,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Samwel hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 4 years, Millicent has been operating a hairdressing business.  Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby.  In her business, Millicent faces a major challenge in delayed payments by creditors. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a beauty shop in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Millicent wants to purchase hair pieces and chemicals for her hairdressing business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy hair pieces and chemicals

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her 2 children. She is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Violeta requested an 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood from her surroundings. Violeta is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, age 48, owns and operates a retail shop that sells "ukay-ukay" (used clothing). She has had this business for five years. She is widowed and has three children.

Anita has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy new stocks of used clothing. She is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of "ukay-ukay" (used clothing)

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is 45 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is a widow and has four children, all of whom are working. For the past seven years, Mabel has been selling charcoal in the local market. Her main challenge is the rainy season, but she makes enough money during the dry season. She is requesting a loan to purchase 50 bags of charcoal for her business. She dreams of having her own home someday.

loans.use: to purchase fifty bags of Charcoal for her business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Aisha has had a business of selling milk for three years.         

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase milk for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Aisha hopes to expand her business.       

Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: to purchase milk for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Veronica; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella realiza trabajos como tableros de ajedrez en madera, ella trabaja juntamente con su esposa, ella lleva este tipos de trabajos a lugares como Bolivia y Argentina, la socia tiene su taller en el distrito de Pisaq, ella vende trabajos de artesanía, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como madera y pinturas para hacer los tableros de ajedrez.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA” communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco district, part of Cusco province and department.

This member is Sra. Veronica, who is 24 years old. She lives with her partner and has one son. She alternates her daily activities between the business of selling handicrafts and making them, such as making wooden chess sets. She does this work together with her husband and then carries these kinds of crafts to places like Bolivia and Argentina to sell. Her workshop is in Pisac district where she also sells craftwork. Sra. Veronica wants to expand her craft store business. She is requesting a loan to buy materials such as wood and paint to make the chess sets.

Sra. Veronica is happy about the loan and is committed to making her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood and paint to make chess sets.

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita works hard to support her family.   She is a widow and has a food production business in the Philippines.

Miguelita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  Miguelita has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Miguelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian, de 21 años es un joven muy trabajador, es soltero y vive en casa de sus abuelo quienes lo ciaron desde muy chico y le dieron educación, el vive junto a ellos y ayuda en los gastos de su hogar.El trabajo de Cristian consiste en salir muy temprano a la ciudad en busca de los pasajeros que buscan la manera de movilizarse de un lugar a otro, ya sea a su centro de trabajo o a su centro de estudios, el realiza esta actividad en las calles de la ciudad, lleva ya casi 7 años trabajando en este rubro, lo hace solo y empezó con la mototaxi de su tío y ahora tiene su propio vehiculo.Lo que le gusta es que dispone de su tiempo y gracias este trabajo pudo terminar su carrera de técnico en enfermería de un instituto nacional que hay en la ciudad, lo que no le gusta es que se tiene que quemar además de tener algunas molestias con sus riñones, espera poder sacar el titulo de su carrera para que así pueda empezar a trabajar en lo que el estudio.Este es el sexto préstamo entre Cristian y la institución, espera poder seguir trabajando así, hace mención que poder trabajar con un grupo así es bueno ya que todos muestran responsabilidad. Con el préstamo solicitado 2500 soles, espera poder comprar sus documentos para ponerse en regla con la autoridad policial, además de algunas piezas para su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Cristian is 21 years old and is a very hard-working young man.  He is single and lives in his grandparent's house.  They raised him from a young boy and gave him his education.  He also helps his grandparents with the household expenses.   Cristian's job consists of leaving very early in the morning and going to the city to look for passengers that need transportation from one place to another, either to their workplace or to school.   He does this on the streets of the city.  He has been working alone at this job for almost 7 years.  He started with his uncle's mototaxi [motorcycle taxi]  and now he has his own vehicle.   What he like most about this job is that he can make his own schedule which allows him to work on finishing his technical nursing degree at a national institute in the city.  What he doesn't like is that he gets burned out in addition to having kidney problems.   He hopes to earn his degree so that he can start working in the profession he has studied for.  

This is his sixth loan with the institution and he hopes to be able to continue working .  He would like to mention that working with a group has been good as all are very responsible.  With the loan of 2500 soles [Peruvian currency] he will purchase the documents he needs to be in good standing with the police as well as some parts for his car.

loans.use: purchase the documents he needs to be in good standing with the police as well as parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Ana Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Ana, de 62 años de edad es originaria de Granada, esta casada, madre de 4 hijos, ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de vestido para niñas. Inicio con una maquina que compro por su cuenta cuando dejo de trabajar  como domestica para independizarse y dedicarse tiempo sus hijos busco la manera de poder salir adelante con un negocio propio que le permitiera generar ingresos al mismo tiempo poder criar a sus hijos. Ya  tiene 40 años de dedicarse a este negocio , ella vende sus productos en Matagalpa, Nueva Segovia, Jinotepe y Managua .  
Solicito el préstamo para comprar materia prima tales como hilo, agujas, tela, encajes, botones para elaborar vestidos para niñas. Con esta inversión podrá adquirir materia prima mas fácilmente, poder cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, hacer mas vestidos y mejorar sus ingresos. Ella desea poder vender sus diseños fuera de Nicaragua, tiene como meta próxima comprar 2 maquinas nuevas de coser para elaborar mas vestidos.
texts.en: Ms. Ana is 62 years old and originally from Granada, Nicaragua.  She is married and a mother of four children.  She is a business woman, dedicated to the sale and fabrication of girls' dresses.  She began with a sewing machine that she bought with her own savings when she quit her job as a housemaid in order to become independent and dedicate her time to her children.  She wanted a job that would allow her to make money while being able to care for her children.  She has since spent 40 years working in this business.  She sells her dresses in Matagalpa, Nueva Segovia, Jinotepe, and Managua.  She is seeking a loan in order to purchase prime materials, such as thread, needles, fabric, lace, and buttons with which to make girls' dresses.  With this investment, she will be able to acquire these materials more easily, fulfill the orders that her clients have made, make more dresses, and improve her earnings.  She hopes to be able to sell her designs outside of Nicaragua.  Her next goal is to purchase two new sewing machines to be able to make even more dresses.

loans.use: purchase prime materials such as thread, needles, fabric, lace, and buttons to make girls' dresses.

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie is married with 5 children.  She is 32 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Bernie has a piggery that she has been managing for 6 years. She has requested a loan of 3000 to purchase pigs.
Bernie is a new member of PMPC, joining this year (2011). In the future, Bernie hopes to expand her garden to plant other crops.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionisio, es un hombre trabajador D. 39 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su querida esposa Maria D. 40 años y sus 3 hijos Abner, Yesenia y Deyvis, quienes día a día lo motivan a seguir adelante. El cultivo D. cacao, es la actividad que diariamente realiza Dionisio, durante 15 años lleva trabajando en sus tierras, ya que son muy productivas para la siembra D. cacao. Es así que cada mañana se levanta con entusiasmo e ir a sus tierras para poder sacar una siembra D. buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que gracias al buen producto que obtiene pueD. velar por el bienestar D. su familia y considera que lo más difícil es no poder tener suficiente economía para contratar a los peones para la cosecha del producto. En adelante piensa comprar más plantas D. cacao y así producir más. Este es el décimo sexto crédito que obtiene D. MFP, ha sido muy puntual con sus pagos. En su banco comunal es muy querido por sus compañeros ya que es muy activo y responsable. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, piensa comprar más plantas D. cacao para asegurar sus futuras cosechas.
texts.en:
Dionisio is a hardworking, 39-year-old man living in his own house with his beloved wife, María, 40, and their three children, Abner, Yesenia and Deyvis who motivate him daily to continue forward.  

The activity that Dionisio carries out daily is cocoa bean farming.  He’s been working his fields for 15 years because they are very productive for cocoa beans.  He rises every morning with enthusiasm to go to his fields and produce good crops.  What he most enjoys about his work is that thanks to the good crops he obtains he’s able to watch over his family’s wellbeing.  He considers the most difficult part of the work not having enough funds to hire day workers to harvest his beans.  In the future, he plans to buy more cocoa bean plants to produce more.

This is the 6th MFP loan he’s gotten; he has been very punctual with his repayments.  He is very well liked by his fellow communal bank members because he’s very active and responsible.  He will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy more cocoa bean plants to assure future harvests.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa bean plants.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials and fish for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 26 years old. She is married and has two children who are enrolled in school. 

Alice and her husband sell foodstuffs and have spent five years in this business.  

She requests a loan to increase her store inventory, by buying beans, bananas and maize.  

Alice is likely to use the profits to renovate her house and to provide food for her family.  She dreams to have her own car to help with the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for resell.

loans.name: Tursunkul

texts.ru: Турсункул занимается бизнесом на протяжении 25 лет. Он женат, имеет детей. Старший сын женился. В бизнесе ему помогают жена и невестка.  Именно полученные доходы помогают ему содержать семью. В настоящее время он имеет несколько голов крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Он хочет получить займ в размере 3000 сомони и приобрести одну корову. Он надеется на ваше великодушие и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Tursunkul has had his business for 25 years. He is married, with children. His oldest son is married. Tursunkul's wife and daughter-in-law help him with his business. The income he brings in allows him to support his family. At this time, he has several heads of cattle and other livestock. He would like a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy a cow. He is counting on your generosity and is grateful to you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en: Anne Marie is 50 years old and has 7 children aged 17 to 28. All of them have attended school. Her husband works as a farmer. She sells vegetables and foodstuffs in a store she has run for 7 years. Anne Marie would like a loan to buy beans, tomatoes, and sorghum to sell in her store. She would like to use any profits to buy a motor bike to help with her business.

loans.use: To buy more beans, tomatoes and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru: Фахриддин целеустремленный и добросовестный юноша. Он хотел начать свой бизнес и пять лет назад он стал заниматься купле- продажей скота. Он является владельцем данного бизнеса. Фахриддин хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Fakhriddin is a goal-oriented and conscientious young man.  He wanted to start his own business and became involved in buying and selling livestock five years ago.  He is the owner of this business.  Fakhriddin wants to expand his business and maximize his profit.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 to purchase livestock and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 46 ans , célibataire  avec 3 enfants, a l’arrêt de ses études en terminal , pour subvenir a ses besoins, elle ouvre une boutique d’habits , ou elle vend des chemises, des pantalons, des ensembles de tailleurs ; des bodies et  différents articles de beauté qu’attirent les femmes.
Étant bénéficiaire de Hope depuis bientôt une année, elle a su profiter des ses différents crédits pour renforcer consolider son activité, qui a influencer largement  sa vie sociale et financière, aujourd’hui, elle ne s’endette plus et a son propre capital  pour s’approvisionner.
Ses épargnes sont énormes et elle a fait ses remboursements sans défauts de paiements.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va acheter des vêtements pour enfants, adolescents, filles, dames et hommes préparer les fêtes de fin d’année, elle a su fidéliser ses clients en leur offrant des petits présents.
Pour l’avenir, elle est entrain étendre sa boutique et s’occupe de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The client is a 46-year old woman, single with 3 children, who are at a standstill in their studies. In order to meet their needs, she has opened a clothing boutique where she sells shirts, pants, tailored outfits, bodysuits and different types of beauty supplies that attract female clients.
Having been a recipient of Hope for almost one year, she has learned how to take advantage of their different loans to reinforce and strengthen her business, which has largely influenced her social and financial life, such that, today, she is no longer in debt and has her own capital for restocking her shop. 
Her savings are vast and she reimburses without defaulting on the payments. 
With this new loan, she is going to buy clothing for children, teenagers, girls, women and men. In preparation for the end-of-the-year holidays, she has learned to develop loyalty with her clients by offering them little gifts.
Looking to the future, she is in the process of enlarging her shop and taking care of the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children, ladies and men

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.fr: Rosaline est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Marcelin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rosaline et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Rosaline mène comme activité depuis huit ans environs, la vente de poissons et de crevettes fumées dans un marché du Bénin. Rosaline s’approvisionne dans un lac du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Rosaline sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Rosaline ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Rosaline is 39 years old and married to a fisherman named Marcelin.  They have two children who both go to school and whom they financially support.  Rosaline and her husband take care of the various expenses of the family together.  In order to support herself and her family, Rosaline has been selling fish and smoked shrimps at a market in Benin for about eight years.  Rosaline gets her merchandise from a lake in Benin.  In order to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and income, Rosaline is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.  Her previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: To buy fish and fresh shrimps.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is 40 years old, married and has two children.  To earn a living, she practices dairy farming.  She has been in the business for 13 years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more financially stable. She has also been trained on business management skills. This has helped her to improve her business. She needs a loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is a single woman. She has a daughter who is five years old. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located at a busy and populated area and her primary customers are residents in her home area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delay of payments from customers. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more oil. Dorothy's  business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics such as body oil etc.

loans.name: Marieni Odalis

texts.es:
Marieni es una mujer de 46 años, viven en la ciudad de Nazca con sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente Marieni no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Puré con Bisteck para compartir con su familia, ya que este es su plato favorito.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Marieni trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, Marieni se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por la poca competencia que tiene por su zona y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Marieni se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como gaseosas, refrescos, cervezas, entre otros; de esta manera Marieni tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para lograr su gran sueño de poder brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos, a fin de verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Marieni is a 46 year old woman who lives in Nazca with her three children.  She loves her children very much and they are her reason for living.  She is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. She dedicates all her efforts to getting her family ahead because she is father and mother to her children.  Regrettably, Marieni couldn’t study for a professional degree because she had to work to support her parents from a very young age.  In her spare time, she enjoys watching television and sometimes cooks the delicious “Puré con Bisteck” to share with her family because this is her favorite dish.

Every day, with much determination and dedication, Marieni works at her small business selling drinks.  She begins work every day in the early morning hours and works for about twelve hours.  Marieni is comfortable in her work and believes that it’s going well because of the low competition in her area and the kind treatment she provides to her customers.

Marieni is very grateful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to their support, she will be able to purchase merchandise for her business: sodas, soft drinks, beer, and other products. In this way, Marieni will have a better stocked business and be able to increase sales and increase her income.  This will enable her to achieve her great dream of being able to provide her children with a good education and see them become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married lady, age 27, supporting a family of five members. She owns a motorcycle and transports people and goods; this is where her income comes from. She has been in operation for a period of four years, earning an income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Nancy is now servicing her second loan of 80,000 KES from KADET Ltd. and intends to use this loan to purchase a new motorbike. The anticipated loan will be used to purchase stock of cereals for resale. Her dream is to be successful in her business and live happily with her family.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Kimsim's Group

texts.en:
Kimsim, a 56 years old resident in Tbaung Khmum province, is married and has four dependent children in school. He earns a living through growing cassava and rice for 38 years. Drop of cassava price is the main challenge to him.
He decided to lead a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund. Previous loans have enabled him to provide healthcare to his family. Kimsim, the group leader, will use his loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide and to pay for plowing fees. He hopes that his crop will return him abundant crops yields to support his children’s studying and to upgrade the standard of living.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields to support his children’s studying.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is an intelligent and very hard-working woman. She has two children who are married, and her husband is a taxi driver. She started her business 15 years ago when her husband became unemployed, and she needed to help with the family\'s expenses. Feliciana began to learn how to do her current business when she was young and worked for many years as a secretary. Later she continued to learn about computers and other new things. Currently her job permits her to pay for her children\'s education, but she still needs to cover household expenses. Feliciana needs a $50 USD loan to buy materials like paper, printer ink, printer and computer parts, and other items that she uses to carry out her computer work. She plans to pay back the loan within 2 months. You can help support Feliciana and allow her to continue to pay for her family\'s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Feliciana es una mujer inteligente y muy trabajadora, tiene 2 hijos casados y su esposo es un taxista; inicio su negocio hace 15 años ante el problema que su esposo había quedado desempleado y entonces ella necesitaba ayudar con los gastos de la familia. Feliciana aprendió este oficio cuando era joven ya que fue secretaria durante muchos años, después continuó actualizándose para aprender computación y cosas nuevas. Actualmente su trabajo le ha permitido pagar los estudios de sus hijos, sin embargo aún necesitan cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Feliciana necesita un préstamo de $50 USD para comprar materiales como hojas, tinta de impresión, engargolados y algunos artículos que utiliza para hacer sus elaboraciones de trabajos por computadora. Ella planea pagar el préstamo en un término de 2 meses, tú puedes apoyar a Feliciana y permitir que siga cubriendo los gastos de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
For nearly 20 years, Svetlana has owned a small market business selling men’s clothing. Married with three children ages 28 to 24, she believes that God has blessed her business as she has sought to provide for the needs of her children and family. Svetlana currently has about 6000grh Ukrainian Hrivnas, in inventory which amounts to just under $1200 USD. Her take-home profit per month is usually around 1000grh or about $200 USD. She is known as a persistent, hard-working and goal oriented business owner. Through the years she has repaid a total of 11 different loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Generosity continues to be Svetlana’s motivation. Now that she has grandchildren coming along, there are more people that she would like to help. Svetlana has requested a loan for $500 to supplement her available capital and purchase inventory for the coming summer season. She wants to increase her business revenue so that she will have more income to share with her family.

На протязі 20 років Світлана займається бізнесом з продажу чоловічого одягу. Світлана – одружена, в неї троє дітей віком від 24 до 28 років. Вона вірить, що Господь благословив її бізнес й вона мала можливість забезпечувати потреби дітей та родини. Зараз у Світлани приблизно 1200 доларів в товарі. Щомісячний чистий прибуток складає приблизно 200 доларів. Світлана – наполеглива, працьовита та цілеспрямована. На протязі останніх років вона сплатила усі 11 позик, які отримала від „Надії України”. Світлана також дуже щедра. В неї нещодавно народились онуки, а, отже, допомога обов’язково знадобиться. Світлана просить про позику в 500 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів та закупити одяг для роздрібної торгівлі напередодні теплого літнього періоду. Вона хотіла б збільшити власні доходи для того, щоб забезпечити рідних усім необхідним.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Ginger

texts.en:
Ginger has one year's experience. Her father helped her in her business by giving her the 80 gas cylinders with which to start her business. She has done very well and has been able to keep and increase her business. At the present time she has 125 cylinders. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. at which time another person is paid to fill in for her until the next day. She rents the business premises where she works.

Ginger will invest her credit in buying more cylinders since there is great demand. Her clients have recommended her because of the great service she provides.

Ginger is single and lives with her mother and siblings. She has been working with her family since she was a little girl. At present, she is studying to teach children and hopes to graduate and start her teaching career.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Ginger tiene una experiencia de 1 año con su actividad. Su papa fue la persona que le ayudo en su negocio. Le dio 80 cilindros de gas con los que inicio. Le ha ido muy bien en este tiempo ya que mantiene su negocio y lo ha logrado incrementar con más cilindros. Actualmente posee 125 cilindros. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. A partir de las 8 p.m. hasta el siguiente día atiende el negocio otra persona. A la cual le paga por su servicio. El local donde tiene el negocio es alquilado.

Ginger el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas cilindros ya que su demanda va en aumento. Sus clientes le han referido por la atención con la brinda su servicio.

Ginger es soltera. Vive con su mama y hermanos. Desde muy pequeña ella conoció la actividad ya que trabajaba junto a su familia. Ella esta estudiando para profesora de niños. Esperando algún día graduarse y comenzar a ejercer su profesión.

loans.use: Purchasing gas cylinders

loans.name: Viginia

texts.en: Virginia is married, mother of 2 children who are in school. She is an active member of Kandara moonlight women group. She practices farming which is the only source of income. She rears 2 dairy cow on zero grazing. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. She practices mixed farming on her farm. Virginia would like to buy a high breed dairy cow which will increase the rate of milk production from the one cow she already has. She is applying a loan to be able to buy the cow at once and repay the loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Virginia material would like to buy a high breed dairy cow

loans.name: Merly Jacknela

texts.es:
Marly is a young woman who has a 5 year old child, her husband is involved in transport services in the community with his taxi. Availing herself of her husband’s mobility, Merly realized the opportunity for the daily transfer of a module with all the fittings necessary for the sale of shaved ice, and activity which she learned grace of her father’s tutelage when she was little. Early in the morning she takes care of the preparation of the syrups with the same patience and diligence that occupied the labor of her beloved maestro in this small city, since these are the most basic ingredients in the flavour, the presentation and the colour which are so appealing and pleasing to her clients. Merly begins her sales at eight in the morning until six in the evening, taking advantage of the hot climate of the city of Pucallpa which in the late hours of the afternoon has the most brilliant sun exposure. She has a great deal of public affluence in her business which demands more of her with each returning visit. Because of this , she hopes to be able to count on more modules for the sale of her shaved ice which at the same time giving jobs to some of the many youth in her city with initiative, and, of course, to be able to gift a good education and improved quality of life to her children, for this she needs a loan of $175 for a period of six months which she will expend in the purchase of more modules to service her clients and make them more satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Merly es una joven madre que tiene un niño de 5 años, su esposo se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte a su comunidad en un mototaxi y aprovechando la movilidad que conduce su esposo Merly realiza el traslado diario de un módulo con todos los implementos necesarios para la venta de raspadillas, actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su papá desde muy pequeña. Temprano por la mañana realiza la preparación de los jarabes con la misma paciencia y diligencia con el que desempeñaba su labor su querido maestro en esta pequeña ciudad ya que estos son los ingredientes básicos para que el sabor, la presentación y el color sean de total agrado para el paladar de sus clientes. Merly empieza a vender desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, aprovechando que el clima de la ciudad de Pucallpa es cálido y que en horas de la tarde se acentúa aún más el brillo solar. Tiene mucha afluencia de público en su negocio y la demanda se acrecienta cada vez más.Debido a este fenómeno ella desea contar con más módulos para la venta de sus rapadillas y a la vez brindar puestos de trabajo a muchos jóvenes de su ciudad con esta iniciativa y por supuesto poder otorgarle una buena educación y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija pequeña; por lo que requiere la suma de 175 dólares que devolverá en un lapso de seis meses con él piensa comprar más módulos a fin de mantener a sus clientes más contentos y satisfechos

loans.use: Purchase of a module to sell, which will allow her to continue augmenting her sales and give her family support.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Mrs. Janet O. is 34 years old, married with three (3) children and she lives in Agbara in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 1997. She sells weavon and hair attachments. She needs the loan of $800 to buy more weavon, hair attachments and a refrigerator for selling drinks. This, she believes, will improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods in cash and receive discounts from her distributors

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Nhuận, 46 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children at Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. The youngest one is still in school. In addition to farming a half acre rice paddy, she also weaves straw mattresses for extra income. She needs money to buy more straw because the in house supply is not enough for the production. At first she took out small loans, 50-100USD, gradually she applies for larger amount. Income from straw mattress production becomes central to her family’s economy. Her husband and children support her always. Tết is around the corner, she is applied for a loan of 325USD to buy more straw. Presently, her income is 100USD a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Nhuận, 46 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Con út của chị còn đang đi học nên ngoài làm 7 sào ruộng, chị Nhuận còn dệt chiếu để tạo thu nhập. Nguồn nguyên liệu từ gia đình không đủ chị phải mua lác từ bên ngoài. Thời gian đầu chị chỉ dám vay từ 50-100USD để mua lác. Sau khi đã quen với cách hoàn trả tuần, chị đã mạnh dạn vay các mức vốn cao hơn. Nguồn thu từ dệt chiếu đã trở thành nguồn thu chủ yếu của gia đình. Chồng và các con chị Nhuận đều tích cực hỗ trợ chị trong thời gian rỗi. Gần đến Tết, chị dự định xin vay 325USD để mua thêm lác tăng thu nhập. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị Nhuận là 100USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy straw for straw mattress production

loans.name: Louisa

texts.en: Louisa N. is a married woman with 7 children. She is 43 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells soft drinks and has been in business since 2000. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more crates of drinks for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Zulfiya S. is 50 years old and has a professional degree. She is married and a mother of 5 children. Zulfiya works as a nurse in the village's medical facility, earning 60 somoni a month. The main source of income for the family is the fattening of cattle and agriculture. Zulfiya's daughters take care of the animals while her husband and her sons take care of the crops. Since they raise their own feed for cattle, the Samatov family save a lot of money. The feed crops are harvested by Zulfiya's sons. Mrs. S. has been a client with Microinvest since 2007 and she used her first loan to purchase a cow. Now she is planning to use the new loan to purchase several sheep and so increase the number of animals the family owns.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Саматова Зулфия – 50 лет, образование средне специальное. Замужем , имеет 5 детей. Зулфия работает в мед. пункте села Карабчи медсестрой. Получает около 60 сомони в месяц. Основной источником дохода семьи является откорм скота и земледелие. Откормом скота занимаются дочери Зулфии а земледелием муж и сыновья. Так как они занимаются земледелием на корм для скота они не тратят деньги. Корм для скота собирают сыновья Зулфии с полей где они занимаются земледелием. Первый кредит от МЗФ «Микроинвест » Зулфия получил в 2007 года и купила корову . На получаемый кредит он хочет купить овец и тем самим увеличить количество скота.

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a dedicated mother who takes advantage of the opportunities she has to improve the quality of life for her family. Before she worked selling newspapers, she used to sell clothing along with her husband in the markets of their community. Now, thanks to her initiative, she and her husband work in various businesses. She would like to increase their income by offering snacks such as crackers, sweets and sodas to the people who come by her news stand each day.

Rosa, es una abnegada madre que no desaprovecha las oportunidades que se le presentan con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, antes de dedicarse a la venta de periódicos ofertaba semanalmente en compañía de su querido esposo diversas prendas de vestir en las feria de su comunidad, ahora gracias a su iniciativa ella y su esposo cuentan con actividades diversificadas. Tiene el deseo de mejorar los ingresos monetarios de su actual centro de trabajo ofertando también galletas, caramelos y bebidas gaseosas a las personas que transitan a diario por esta avenida.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CRACKERS, SWEETS AND SODAS TO SELL FROM HER NEWSPAPER STAND, INCREASING HER INCOME BY OFFERING MORE PRODUCTS TO HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Vantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Vantha T. and her husband, Mr. Sokun Vorn were married in 1997 and have one daughter who is in primary school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Vantha has been selling vegetables for over twenty years. She bought them from Ta Khmao market (the district market) for resale at Toul Tumpoung Market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a taxi driver in Phnom Penh. They are in the process of repairing their house and  are short of money to finish it.

Mrs. Vantha is requesting a loan of US$600 to add to her own money for finishing her house.

loans.use: For repairing her house.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthy U. lives in Snour Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She buys rice to keep in stock and resell for a reasonable price. Her business now is very improved; unfortunately, Mrs. Chanthy U. has insufficient money to invest in more rice to keep in stock. Thus, Mrs. Chanthy U. asked for a loan for this goal. Her husband, Mr. Thoeurn Son, always assists his wife in business. Aside from this business, Mr. Thoeurn Son is a pig breeder. Mrs. Chanthy U. is 23 and married without any children. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell rice for a reasonable price.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun C., 41, has been selling rice and porridge in the local market for the last three years. She lives in Kampong Cham with her husband, Duon Somol, and their three young children who are all in school. She typically makes US$5 each day, while her husband operates a motor taxi service and can usually make US$3 each day. High gas prices have recently hindered many taxi services and have made it difficult to access customers.

In an effort to increase her family's income and improve their economic situation, Oeun C. has asked for a loan of US$1000. She will use the money to invest in her food business, which the family believes may be the more stable of the two businesses. She hopes to reach more customers and increase her profits with this investment. Oeun is optimistic about the future.

loans.use: Invest in rice and porridge business

loans.name: Lystra 2021-6 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Loice A.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. She is 35 years old and married to a builder. She has four children who all go to school. Each week, Loice makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Loice is joined in her group by Mary W., Viola A., Grace J., and Rose U.. Mary has a business making tea and wants to open a restaurant. Viola is currently operating a business selling beans at the market and wants a loan to expand her business. Grace operates a business of selling clothes and wants to expand the business. Rose is currently in the business of selling perfumes at the shop and is requesting a loan to expand her business as well.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín decidió emigrar a esta frontera, para tener un mejor futuro de vida, ya que en su pueblo natal el trabajo es muy escaso y por lo regular en trabajo de campo, y el aspiraba a mas, pues para poder solventar gastos y vivir cómodamente. Al llegar a Reynosa empezó a buscar trabajo, encontró en una empresa maquiladora, al trabajar arduamente por varios años en esta maquiladora, el decido emprender su propio negocio, con los ahorros que tenia, empezó su negocio con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes el cual ahora desea agradar y remodelar debido al éxito obtenido.

El necesita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 6 meses, para remodelar y comprar mas surtido de mercancía.
texts.en:
Efraín decided to emigrate to this border in order to have a better future. In his hometown work is very scarce, and normally it is field work. He aspires to do more so that he can pay his expenses and live comfortably. Upon arriving in Reynosa he began to look for work. He found a job in a factory, and after working hard for several years in the factory, he decided to open his own business. With his savings, he began his business with a small grocery store, which he now wishes to improve and remodel due to the success he has had.

Efrain needs a loan of $450.00 US which he will pay in 6 months, in order to remodel and purchase a greater supply of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: remodelar su tienda

loans.name: Gulhumor

texts.en: K. Gulhumor was born in 1972 in the Spitamen region. She is married and has two children. Mrs. K. Gulhumor applied to the MicroInvest in 2008 when she heard about the MicroInvest loan program from her sister. She was in a difficult financial situation so she took a business development loan and could change and improve the business terms significantly. Now Mrs. K. Gulhumor has a separate business in fruits, vegetables and rice selling. She works straight with the suppliers so she can trade at the low prices. She has many repeat customers. Mrs. K. Gulhumor is applying to KIVA for a business support loan and trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. She applies to KIVA for the loan of 2100 STJ to be paid back in 3 months. She dreams of opening her own trade outlet.

loans.use: business turnover increase

loans.name: Nachia's Group

texts.en:
Nachia A. has been selling firewood in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She begins working at 7:00am every day and is able to earn a profit of approximately $60 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood to sell.

Nachia is 28 years old, divorced, and has 3 children, aged 12 years, 10 years, and 6 months. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Magulata and Hamida, who also own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente tiene 37 años, es soltero, vive solo ya que no tuvo hijos. Es protesista dental, se dedica hace 9 años a la atención en su pequeña clínica, la cual  gracias a su gran esfuerzo y gran atención ha aumentado el número de sus clientes, los cuales asisten fielmente a su consulta. El negocio es bueno, pero la gran dedicación que el le brinda a su trabajo a veces suelen agotarlo, haciendo que no pueda abastecerse para la atención de toda la clientela. Pero a pesar de los pequeños inconvenientes Vicente quiere sacar adelante su negocio,  es por eso que recurre a nuestra ayuda para hacer posibles sus metas. Vicente se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero quiere comprar mayor cantidad de material dental para la mejor atención a su clientela y si es posible contratar a una ayudante para desenvolverse mejor en la atención.
texts.en:
Vicente, 37, is single and lives by himself. He is a dental prosthetist. He has had a small office for nine years, which he built with great effort. Little by little he has built his practice, and now he has a large number of patients thanks to the care he gives them. Business is good, but the Vicente's dedication to his patients leaves him with little time to rest, and all the time he spends at work is not even enough to see all his patients. Despite the small inconveniences, Vicente wants to make his business grow, and this wish brings him to request our help. This is Vicente's first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. The loan will be used to purchase more dental materials, and possibly to hire an assistant to provide more and better care to his patients.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing dental materials for his job

loans.name: Haja Conteh Group

texts.en:
This is Haja C. and Fatmata K.. They named their group "Believe In God."  They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. This is not their first loan from Kiva through SMT. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Previously, each group member received a loan of Le 600,000.00. That loan created meaningful changes in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees, and to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. 

Again, they are requesting a loan of Le 600,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Haja (on the left) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-eight years of age. She was born in BatK., which is about thirty-six miles from Makeni. She is married to a photographer and they have six children. Two of her children are in secondary school, two are in primary school, one is in nursery school, and the last is not yet of school age. She has been a businesswoman for over twenty years.
 
Haja sells articles like toothpaste, Vaseline, jewelry, fingernail polish, and baby powder. With this new loan, she will expand her business. She will buy at least a carton of toothpaste, a carton of Vaseline, a carton of powder and dozens of earrings. She usually travels to Freetown, where she buys the items that she sells. The fare to Freetown is Le 12,000. In Freetown, a carton of toothpaste costs at least Le 200,000, and it costs Le 150,000 for a carton of Vaseline and Le 150,000 for a carton of powder.

So far, Haja faces no serious challenge in her business that are worth noting. Business is going fine and well. She enjoys what she does for a living. With the increase in profit that Haja will make as a result of the loan, she will be saving to buy a plot of land to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more articles

loans.name: Presentacion Raul

texts.es: Don Presentación  tiene 59 años de edad, reside en Villa Reconciliación en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene cuatro hijos, que están independientes, ella se desempeña como modista, hace costura y vende ropa. Su negocio es la siembra y venta de frijoles, y en tiempos libres también es chofer de tractor para madera en rosita al norte del país, un trabajo cansado ya que la ruta es a muchos kilómetro de la capital, pero le pagan bien el viaje, tiene veintidós años en cultivar frijoles y seis años de conductor, inicio con dinero prestado y unos ahorros que tenia, sus planes son construir cuartos para alquiler, para mejorar sus ingresos, sus objetivos es aumentar mas el cultivo que le generen mas ventas. A futuro es hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Presentación is a 59-year-old man who lives in Villa Reconciliación in the city of Managua. He and his wife have four grown-up children. His wife works as a seamstress who makes clothing and sells it. He grows and sells beans for a living. In his free time, he also works driving a timber tractor in Rosita, located in the northern part of the country. This is a very exhausting job because his route is many kilometers away from the capital. However, he is paid well for each trip. He has been growing beans for twenty-two years and driving the tractor for six. He started his business with his savings and with borrowed money. He plans on building rooms to rent out. In order to boost his earnings, his goal is to increase his crops so that he can generate more sales. In the future, he would like to do some home improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build two rooms to rent

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn K. is a villager in Trapaing Pring village in Kampong Chhnang province. She sells palm sugar. She is also a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she has a little income to support the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Suos Ty, is a construction worker. Mrs. Thorn K. is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To help purchase a second plot of land for cultivating rice

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie A. S. is a 34-year-old married man living in A. Maalaka, Lebanon in the Bekaa valley. He works as a sanitation repair man and usually works in private homes and at new construction sites. Elie is requesting a loan of $800 to replace his old tools.

loans.use: Buy new tools

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La señora Ángela es una mujer trabajadora que ha trabajo desde muy joven para apoyar a sus hijos a que no le falte nada. Tiene 48 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles norte en la ciudad de Managua, con cuatro hijos  mayores que se apoyan entre si. Doña Ángela se desempeña como conserje, es viuda lo cual se le hace mas difícil la carga de su familia, con este crédito  va  invertir en infraestructura en la construcción de la cocina ya que su casa es pequeña y cocina en la sala, lo cual se le hace un poco incomodo y desea poder gozar de su trabajo las mejoras, este es su cuarto ciclo y da gracias Afodenic por hacer realidad sus metas.
texts.en:
Ángela is a hardworking woman who has worked since she was very young to support her children so that they don't miss out on anything. She is 48 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua with her four grown children who support one another. Ángela works as a concierge. She is a widow, which has made taking care of her family more difficult. She will invest this loan in infrastructure for the construction of her kitchen. Her house is small and her kitchen is currently in the living room, which is very uncomfortable, and she would like to enjoy her home improvements. This is her fourth loan cycle, and she gives thanks to Afodenic for making her goals reality.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a kitchen

loans.name: Cristo Campesino Group

texts.es:
Estos socios representan al banco comunal  “CRISTO CAMPESINO”; Ellos son un grupo conformado por 10 miembros, todos ellos son naturales D. la comunidad D. Huacaytaqui, en el distrito D. quispicanchis, ubicados a 2 horas D. la ciudad del Cusco.

La mayoría D. los socios alternan sus actividades domésticas y la agricultura con: el engorD. D. ganados, la tala D. bosques, la venta minorista D. comidas en los mercados centrales D. las comunidades aledañas y D. mayor confluencia, y a la venta D. ropa que son traídas D. las ferias D. la ciudad del Cusco; nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para invertir en sus diferentes actividades y D. este modo seguir aportando económicamente en sus hogares.

Los socios quedan muy agradecidos por el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total D. sus deudas.
texts.en:
These partners represent the “Cristo Campesino” cooperative bank. They are a group comprised of 10 members, all of whom are from the community of Huacaytaqui in the Quispicanchis district, located about 2 hours from the city of Cusco. The majority of the members alternate between their domestic chores and farming with: fattening livestock, clearing forest, and retail food sales in the neighboring and most frequented markets of the city of Cusco. Our members request a loan to invest into their various activities so they can continue to support their households financially. The members are very grateful for the support provided through this medium, and simultaneously commit to the payment of all their debts.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement their various businesses.

loans.name: Giachina

texts.es: Giachina tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de animales en las principales ferias ganaderas de su zona, principalmente los fines de semana y cuando sus vecinos le solicitan. Además de este negocio Giachina se da tiempo para vender comida al paso por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas su actividad es atender a sus animales y su casa. Lo bueno de su trabajo es que obtiene los ingresos necesarios para sostener la economía de su hogar. Para más adelante Giachina está  pensando en comprar un terreno donde pueda implementar un establo para sus animales. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le permite crecer económicamente y tener un espacio de amistad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de más animales como ovejas y cerdos con los que  incrementará su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Giachina, 27, lives with her husband and son in a rented house. For 4 years she has sold animals in the principal livestock fairs in her zone. She sells primarily on the week ends and when her neighbors have requests. In addition to this business, Giachina sells food in the afternoons. In the mornings she tends to the animals and her house. The good thing about her work is that she gets the income needed to sustain her household. In the future, Giachina is thinking of buying a piece of land where she can put a stable for her animals. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to belong to her community bank because it allows her to grow economically and be in a place filled with friendship. The loan is to buy more animals like sheep and pigs. With these animals she will increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and pigs

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда Иброхимова живет в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Возраст 38 лет. Этим видом деятельности занимался муж, но после его смерти Мавлуда взяла все в свои руки. Этот вид бизнеса является основным доходом семьи и он существует более 10 лет. Клиентка хочет взять кредит, чтобы отремонтировать хлебопекарню.
texts.en:
Mavluda I. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. She is a widow and has 2 children. She is 38 years old. This occupation was her husband’s, but after his death Mavluda took everything into her own hands. This business is the main source of income for the family and it has existed for more than 10 years. The client would like to take out a loan in order to repair the bread bakery.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair bakery

loans.name: Eric

texts.es:
El señor Eric vive en alquiler en la calle Antofagasta de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja en una imprenta grafica lugar donde empezó solo como compaginador y ahora es jefe de producción.

El crédito que solicita es para seguir capacitándose y comprar material educativo en su rama (libros especializados) y seguir ascendiendo de cargo ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007 y su historial de pagos es muy bueno, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Eric lives in an apartment on Antofagasta street in the Pasankeri zone in the city of La Paz. He works in a graphic printing business where he started as a graphic print worker and now is the chief of production. The loan that he is requesting is to continue his training and to purchase educational materials in his field (technical books) in order to continue growing in this field since it is his only source of income. He has been a client of Impro since 2007 and his repayment history is very good, and thus he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tecnical books in his field of study to continue his training

loans.name: Jesus Nelida

texts.es:
La señora Jesús Nélida G. D. A. tiene 55 años, vive en el distrito D. El Porvenir, en la provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Completa, tiene 1 nieta que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Nélida tiene como negocio la venta D. menú (la venta lo realiza todos los días). 
Cuando inicio con Manuela Ramos vendía comida en lo que anteriormente se le denominaba   La Parada  “Mercado Santa Rosa” (distrito El Porvenir), Su negocio estaba ubicado al costado D. su domicilio, en un club D. madres. Luego con el pasar del tiempo se trasladó su negocio a su domicilio.
Los insumos para la preparación D. alimentos los obtiene en los mercados D. abastos D. su distrito.
Con el crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal Viva con Esperanza, lo invirtió en la compra D. insumos como arroz, azúcar y sal (esto comprado al por mayor).
Con el crédito D. 800 soles continuara invirtiéndolo en la compra D. insumos como azúcar y sal.
Jesús tiene como sueño construir su casa y así poder alquilar dormitorios porque considera que con el pasar D. los años y en su edad avanzada ya no podrá seguir trabajando igual.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jesús Nélida G. D. A. is 55 years old and lives in the El Porvenir district of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru. She completed graD. school and has a grandchild she takes care of. Nélida sells menú (prepared plates of food) for a living. She sells menú seven days a week. When she started with Manuela Ramos, she sold food in what used to be called La Parada Mercado Santa Rosa. Her business was located next to her home in a club for mothers. She eventually moved her business into her home. She buys the supplies she needs for her business in the wholesale markets in her area. She bought supplies like rice and salt with the first loan of 300 soles received from her communal bank “Viva con Esperanza.” She will again buy supplies like sugar and salt with this new loan of 800 soles. Jesús dreams of building a house to be able to rent out rooms because she feels that as she gets older she won’t be able to keep doing the same work.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La compra de insumos como azúcar y sal.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is 49 years old. She is married and is the mother of three children. Currently all her children are schooling.

Akua sells smoked fish and started her fish sales twenty years ago at Sefwi Bekwai community market. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and, because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base that travels from other parts of the surrounding communities to buy her fish.

Akua buys her stock of fish from the fishmongers. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina G. D. M. resiD.  en el municipio D. San Martin departamento D. San Salvador. La Sra. Rosalina tiene 50 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos D. los cuales dos son mayores D. edad y trabajan, y su otra hija flor D. 11 años D. edad es estudiante, Rosalina tiene una tortillería y una tienda en su casa donD. posee  15 años D. experiencia, en su colonia es muy conocida es por eso que mantiene una clientela estable, ahora Rosalina solicita un crédito para comprar  maíz utilizado en las tortillas y para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosalina G. D. M. lives in the San Martin municipality in the San Salvador department. Rosalina, 50, lives with her husband and their three children. Two children are grown and working. Her third child, a daughter, is an 11 year old student. Rosalina has a tortilla shop and a store in her house. She has 15 years of experience, and she is well known in her colony. She, therefore, has a stable customer base. Rosalina is now asking for a loan to buy corn to use in making the tortillas and to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and stock her store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells shoes and slippers as hawker in Abura. Elizabeth has received no formal education.  She is a single parent and has 4 dependants. Elizabeth has been selling shoes and slippers since 2007. She is responsible for paying for feeding and clothing. Her loan will be used to buy slippers and sandals for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy slippers and sandals for resale.

loans.name: Aliou Sow

texts.fr:
MBTH/1421
Aliou Sow  Y.  est un chauffeur de taxi urbain il conduit son propre véhicule qu’il a acquis grâce à ses économies. Chaque jour il fait avec son véhicule le tour de la ville de Mbour à la recherche de passagers. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d’aider ses parents mais aussi d’économiser pour  préparer son mariage. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il compte dépanner son véhicule de transport. Il est âgé de 28 ans et est célibataire.

M
texts.en:
MBTH/1421 Aliou Sow Y. is a taxi driver.  He drives his own vehicle that he acquired, thanks to his savings.  Every day, he takes his vehicle around the city of Mbour in search of passengers.  The revenues derived from his business enable him to help his parents and also to save money in preparation for his marriage.  With this loan he's requesting, he intends to repair his transport vehicle.  He is 28 years old and unmarried.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repaire his vehicle

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.en:
Oswaldo says that he loves being his own boss. After a successful career for working for various companies and a large distributor, he decided that he would break out on his own. Two and a half years later, Oswaldo’s dry-goods distribution business now has two employees and serves local delis, variety stores, and grocery stores in his Queens neighborhood. 

Oswaldo has requested a loan of $6,000 to increase his inventory of dry goods. Priding himself on keeping his costs to a minimum, he has identified two major areas that will allow him to reduce overhead and inventory costs to a minimum. 

Now, when Oswaldo makes a sale, he immediately takes the money to a wholesaler to make his next purchase. This process requires multiple trips each day and wastes large amounts of time and money. With a bit of a cash cushion, Oswaldo will be able to reduce the number of times he will have to visit a distributor, thereby saving on gas and time. Also, Oswaldo will be able to buy sale items in bulk. With a continuously growing business, he has spent all of his earned money on expansion and will now be able to reduce his costs simultaneously.

Despite starting a small business in a difficult economy, Oswaldo has grown his business into an established, profitable venture. With his loan, he will continue to expand his business. In the next five years he plans to purchase computers, create a Web site, and set up an electronic record-keeping system. His long term plan? “Keep growing!”

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Oswaldo from  United States

loans.use: Dry goods inventory

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Even at her age of 56 years old, Monina M. still dreams of living in a beautiful house along with her 22-year-old only daughter, Girley.

To be able to achieve her dreams in life, Monina joined ASHI because she wanted to put up a business which will be her source of income. Her daughter who is just a high school graduate will be her partner in running her business since her husband passed away a long time ago.

The loan Monina requested through ASHI is her only hope in achieving her dreams through a rice buy-and-sell business she is going to start up. With this business, she would have money to buy their food and other basic needs every day. Her child could also earn money by helping her.

loans.use: To buy rice for her rice-selling business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 yrs old, married to Cecilia, and the father of six children. He is applying for his first loan with KADET.  With this loan Joseph intends to buy cooking ingredients for his cafe, such as wheat flour and cooking oil.

Joseph came to know about KADET through World Vision Kenya and KADET farmers' field day.  His hopes and dreams are to improve living standards for his family and be able to provide a good education for his children.

Joseph has also taken in an orphan and is struggling to put him through school. His greatest desire is to assist such members in the community only that he is limited in resources. He hopes to use some of his business profits to provide food and education for orphans in his community.

Joseph can be described as very committed to leadership, honesty, and hard work.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add stock to sell such as wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old but still very focused and hardworking in her business. She is married to Lorenzo, 56 years old, who works as a farmer in their village. They are blessed with nine children: six of them are married while the others are still studying in a public school in their village.

Myrna has a strong determination to succeed in life. She is now managing her village store business as her way of supporting her husband in meeting the needs of their family while her husband is managing their rice fields. She came up with this kind of business because their income from their farm is seasonal. Together they are helping one another for the welfare of their family.

For the continuous improvement of her business, Myrna is now requesting to borrow PHP 8,000. She plans to use the loan to purchase more grocery items for her store to earn a bigger income. She is hoping that the lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha V. is from the village of Rizal, Santiago City. She is 54 years old, is married and has three adult children. Editha owns and operates a business vending cosmetics products and accessories. She has been engaged in her business for over a year now. In 2009, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional items to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. She is a good housewife, living at home and looking after her two children. Her husband, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver who is able to make about US $3 of profit every day. This couple also is supported by the children who are garment factory workers. Em S. would like to take out a loan of US $1000 as her husband needs to purchase a taxi. This will allow her husband to earn more than before.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Elena Gómez Rodríguez tiene una pulpería  en el casco urbano de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento y Zinc para el techo para construir un lugar más amplio y situar ahí la pulpería. Ella empezó este negocio con muy pocos productos para ofertas a los clientes, este fue creciendo a medida que aumentaba la demanda por su buena atención. A tenido este negocio desde hace unos 7 años y lo atiende todos los días desde la 7 de la mañana  hasta las 8 de la noches y le ayuda su esposo también, antes de tener este negocio se dedicaba alas labores del hogar y al cuido de el hijo que ella tiene.

La Sra. Martha Gómez espera que con la compra de los materiales de construcción empiece rápido la construcción del nuevo local donde estará ubicada la pulpería y tener mejor condición y espacio en su casa de habitación donde esta actualmente la pulpería.

Martha Gómez es casad y tiene un solo hijo el cual cursando los estudio primario y a través de su negocio costea los gastos del estudio de su hijo.

Este es el crédito numero 7 que ella a tenido con Ceprodel en un periodo de 5 años. los cuales le han beneficiado positivamente ya que le ha ayudado a aumentar su inventario de productos y tener una mejor oferta a sus cliente y así aumente los ingresos familiares y que mejore su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Elena Gómez Rodríguez owns a general store in the urban zone of Condega. She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel for the purchase of construction materials like cement and Zinc for the roof, in order to construct a larger location for the general store. She initiated this business with a limited inventory, offering very few products to her clients. Her inventory has been increasing, however, because she saw increasing demand due to her good service. She has running this business for 7 years, opening it every day from 7 in the morning until 8 in the evening. Her husband helps her also. Before she had this business, she spent her time doing housework and taking care of her son. Mrs. Martha hopes that with the purchase of these construction materials the construction will soon start for her grocery store's new location, leaving more space and better conditions in her home where the store is currently located. Martha Gómez is married and has just one son who is currently in elementary school. Through her business's profits, she pays for the expenses of her son's studies. This is the 7th loan that she has received from Ceprodel over the last 5 years. These loans have benefited her, allowing her to increase her inventory of products and offer a better selection to her clients, which in turn has allowed her to generate greater revenues for her family and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials like Zinc and cement

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mr. Chenda Y. (shown in the photo), age 37, and his wife, Mrs. Sinat Un, age 35, married in 2000 and just have one son who is attending school. The family is living in a small village off of National Road number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chenda and his wife have been selling fish for a year. They buy fish from Prek Toch market and transport it to sell in Phnom Penh market. Chenda is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his nephew to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his nephew to drive to work.

loans.name: Urbana

texts.es:
Urbana, de 39 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Mario (33) y sus hijos; Sila (13), y Ángela (11).
Hace 2 años, junto a su esposo, compró un auto con el propósito de alquilarlo, pero luego decidieron que su esposo podía brindar el servicio de taxi para obtener mayores ganancias. Desde entonces, él maneja el auto y ella administra las ganancias, además de hacerse cargo del mantenimiento mecánico. A su vez, desde hace unos meses han logrado incorporarse a una línea de transporte de su ciudad, lo que les facilita el trabajo.
