Aunque el negocio va bien, ambos coinciden en que una gran dificultad es el aumento repentino del precio de la gasolina, lo que les perjudica en gran medida. Para el futuro, tienen planeado comprar un auto más, y esta vez brindarlo en alquiler.

Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con el grupo que le dio confianza. Urbana tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en el mantenimiento a su auto .
texts.en:
Urbana, 39, lives in her own house with her husband, Mario, 33, and their children: Sila, 13 and Ángela, 11. Two years ago, she and her husband bought a car with the intention of leasing it out. However, they soon decided that her husband could provide taxi services and thus earn higher profits. Since then, he drives and she administers the profits and sees to vehicle maintenance and repairs. A few months ago, they mananged to incorporate into one of the city's transportation lines, which greatly facilitates their work. Although business is good, they both agree that the sudden increase in the price of gasoline has been very detrimental. For the future, they plan to buy another car which they will lease out. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion because she does not want to disappoint the group that placed its trust in her. Urbana plans to use the funds for vehicle maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle service and maintenance.

loans.name: Nhy

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhy C. is 42 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Samon Yin, are farmers who own a two-hectare field on which they cultivate rice. Mr. Samon Yin (who is pictured on the left) is also a farm laborer who can receive only a little salary to support his family. This couple has two children, one of whom is accountant in the private company while the other one is student in the local school. 

Mrs. Nhy C. is now requesting 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to purchase a water machine to support her farming and a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine and a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Develop and promote her commercial activity

loans.name: C6207 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Laetitie is 32 years old and is a proven entrepreneur known in the business of selling meat. She joined a group called Abishyizehamwe of which she is the president. The group owns a butcher shop where they sell cow meat and which they open from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day. This is their second successful year.

Laetitie and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company which hopefully will allow them to satisfy the demand of their customers. It will enable them to sell the meat of more than one cow per day and also start selling sheep and goat meat in order to cover their customer needs.

With this loan, the group hopes to earn more profits which in turn will allow each member of the group to start saving as well as taking care of his/her family. In addition, they will also be able to reserve funds for future reinvestment in their business.

loans.use: To purchase  one sheep, goat and more than one cow to increase the quantity of meat for sale

loans.name: Esther Kahaso

texts.en:
Esther Kahaso M. is a 38-year-old married woman with four children between eleven and two years of age. Esther moves from one place to another selling kanga (traditional African cloth).  She has been in the business for a period of about three years earning a monthly profit of approximately 6,000 Kenya shillings.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend. She wants to use her loan to buy more stock of kanga in order to increase her profit margin to sustain her family. She hope to expand her current business.

loans.use: Buy more Kangas

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud S. is 26 years old and from Gaza. He is married with five members in his family. Mahmoud works as a carpenter. He is requesting a loan to buy more equipment. This will help him to enlarge his business, increase his productivity and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more carpentry equipment

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn B. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 26 years old. Genalyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Genalyn owns and operates a business preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken for sale. Genalyn has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Genalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genalyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Genalyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Badamtseren

texts.en:
Badamtseren, 53, is a widow who lives with her two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. They have been living together in their current home for ten years. 

Currently, Badamtseren operates a mobile meat and food products retail business in her town. She purchases her products from wholesale shops in Mongolia and Ereen, a Chinese border town. Badamtseren has been in this business for many years and has gained much experience. In addition, she has a small plot of land where she plants vegetables for family use and sells any surplus each fall at the market. 

Badamtseren is an enthusiastic person who has been working hard to provide a better life for her two children. Her main business goal is to own her own workplace and expand her business operation. Badamtseren is requesting a 350,000 MNT loan to purchase vegetable seeds for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 30 years and married.  Faustin is commonly known in the business for selling a variety of goods in his shop.  Those goods include mainly cosmetic goods, cooking oil, sugar etc.  Faustin is very proud of his business and this is his fifth successful year.  His shop is open from 6 am until 8 pm every day.

Faustin is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs.  With this additional business of foodstuffs, Faustin hopes to earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep expanding his capital for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita V. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Teresita is married and has 6 adult children. She owns & operates a bakery business where she sells loaf bread, star bread and other different kinds of breads to the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yenny es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su padre y a su menor hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola que ha venido experimentando un crecimiento comercial moderado, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al negocio de la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría aves de corral como patos, pavos y gallinas en diversos corrales situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, usualmente los ofrece a sus clientes por pedidos, generalmente se los piden con ocasión de festividades especiales y también los vende en restaurantes de la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella apoya económicamente a su familia.

Yenny desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas alimento para que sus aves se desarrollen rápidamente, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Yenny es una mujer que gusta mucho de las actividades que realiza, ella siempre da lo mejor de si para seguir adelante y poder ayudar a su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida, en la zona todos la conocen por ser una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Yenny is a 32 year-old mother who lives with her father and her young son in the Cayaltí district. It is an agricultural area that has been experiencing moderate commercial growth, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. She devotes herself to the business of raising and selling animals. She raises caged birds such as ducks, turkeys, and chickens in various cages located behind her house. She usually takes orders from her customers, who generally request them for special occasions. She also sells them to restaurants in the area. She supports her family economically with the income from this business. Yenny would like to expand her business by purchasing more feed, so that her birds will develop more rapidly. This is why she is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. A loan of 1,500 nuevos soles will help her to achieve her goal. Yenny is a woman who enjoys her work. She always does her best in order to get ahead and to be able to help her family to have a better quality of life. In the area where she lives, everyone knows her as a calm and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feed in order to expand her business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy zinc, blocks, cement, nails, planks,  hammers, sand, beams, and labor

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhun C. (in the picture) is 48. She and her husband, Mr. Thy Em, 43, live a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married for 20 years and have one daughter who is also married. Their son-in-law and grandchild are living with them. 

Sokhun is a rice farmer. Her husband is a construction worker. The family does not have their own transportation so traveling costs them a lot of money. She is requesting her first loan of US$ 700 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y  tiene 2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de emolientes (mates), huevos sancochados y sándwich, ella vende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 a.m, ella vende en el mercado de Vinocanchon de forma independiente que está ubicado en San Jeronimo, su esposo es maestro de construcción y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para preparar los emolientes y sándwich. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”, which is located in the District of Wanchaq, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. Sonia divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling herbal tonics, deviled eggs, and sandwiches. She sells her products from 5am until 11am as an independent merchant at the Vinocanchon Market, which is located in San Jeronimo. Her husband is a master builder and they both work together so that their children can get ahead. Sonia wants to improve her business, so she is requesting this loan so that she can buy ingredients for preparing herbal tonics and sandwiches.

She is grateful to everyone who helped make this dream possible. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing herbal tonics and sandwiches

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
Romulo es socio del Banco Comunal Proyección.
Romulo es conviviente, tiene 6 hijos y solo una hija de 9 años esta a su responsabilidad además de un nieto de 3 años, Romulo se dedica a la venta de artefactos eléctricos de importación que compra en aduana, la venta lo realiza al por mayor a las diferentes tiendas. Además Romulo junto a su pareja tienen una tienda de alquiler de vestidos de novias, decoraciones de locales.
Romulo necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles para el pago de transporte de los artefactos.
Romulo sueña con construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho ya tiene su terreno, actualmente vive en casa alquilada y brindar una buena educación a su hija y nieto.
texts.en:
Romulo is a member of the community bank Proyección (Projection). Romulo lives with his partner. He has six children. Now only a daughter who is 9 and a grandson who is 3 are his responsibility. Romulo works in the sale of imported electrical appliances, which he buys at the customs house. He sells them wholesale to different stores. In addition, Romulo and his partner have a store where they rent wedding dresses and decorations. Romulo needs a loan of 3000 PEN to pay for the transport of appliances. Romulo dreams of constructing a house in the city of Ayacucho. He already has a piece of land. He now lives in a rented house. He also dreams of offering a good education to his daughter and his grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the transportation of appliances.

loans.name: Japhet Kibet

texts.en:
Japhet Kibet C., a resident of Turbo outside of Eldoret town, is 37 years old and married to Mary Kibet, whose farming activities provide a source of additional income for the family. They have two school-going children. Japhet has been operating a general shop for seven years, earning a monthly profit of Kshs.12,000.

Japhet learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area and is now applying for his first loan of Kshs. 20,000 from KADET LTD with which he intends to buy six boxes of cooking oil, five bags of sugar and several small items including boxes of matches and cartons of soap bars. He will use the anticipated extra profits to expand his shop to ensure financial stability.

In the future Japhet hopes to have a hotel to earn additional income. His deepest desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through a good education.

loans.use: To buy six  boxes of cooking oil, five bags of sugar, and some small items e.g. matchboxes, cartons of soap bars, etc.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 47 years old and married. She owns a shop selling a variety of goods such as women's shoes, women's handbags and some other goods. Marthe has been in this business for a long time. The business hours are from 7 am to 7 pm every day except Saturday.

Although Marthe has been in this business for a long time, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully. To address this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing different kinds of shoes and bags for women. If successful, Marthe will hopefully increase her sales, and these sales will result in earning a lot of profit, which will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of shoes and bags for women

loans.name: Kabatuura Women's Group-Bushenyi

texts.en: K. Gaudy belongs to Kabatuura Women’s group- Bushenyi. She is happily married with four kids and she operates a pub in Kahija.  Before she ventured into this business, four years ago , she was selling local brew. 150,000 shillings is what accrues to her business as weekly profits. Gaudy also sells bananas to supplement what she earns from her pub business. She says with this loan she is going to restock her bar with more crates of drinks for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more crates of drinks for her pub

loans.name: Ologolimot Ole

texts.en:
Ologoikot Ole K. is 23 years old. He is married to Nadupoi K. and is a father of eight children aged between three to twelve years. Ologoikot is a wheat farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last twenty eight years.
  
Ologoikot learned about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan and he is planning to prepare land for the next planting season and buy more farm supplies. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

Ologoikot hopes to become a large scale farmer in wheat and buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: To prepare land for next planting season and buy more farm supplies

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida V. is from the village of Salucong. She is 53 years old. Adelaida is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Adelaida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling health & medicinal products in the local community. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adelaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Adelaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva T. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 55 years old. Genoveva is married and has 10 children. To make a living, Genoveva owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Genoveva is thankful for their farm because it helps her family immensely.

Genoveva joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genoveva has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Genoveva is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Norma Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Norma; ella tiene 50 años. Tiene 2 hijos y ella es casada;  La socia se dedica  ala compra y venta de materiales educativos, la socia viaja a la ciudad de Juliaca a comprar todo tipo de materiales de librería para la época escolar y para todo el resto del año, la socia viaja al menos 3 veces al año para implementar su negocio y poder así tener variedad de mercadería y actualizar sus productos educativos. La socia compra también corrospun para realizar figuras como el cuerpo humano,  animales de la granja entre otros y venderlos a pedido a los diferentes centros educativos y jardines de la ciudad. La socia en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para la elaboración de cuerpos humanos y hacerlos didácticos para los jardines que comenzarán en la quincena de enero las clases de verano y vacacionales. La socia necesita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales de corrospun para realizar figuras educativas.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the QORICHUSPA Communal Bank which is located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.  She is 50 years old and married with 2 children.  

She is engaged in the business of buying and selling educational materials. She travels to the city of Juliaca to purchase all types of materials from the bookstore for the school term and for the rest of the year.  In order to run her business, she travels at least 3 times a year so she will have a variety of merchandise to make her educational products.  

She also buys corrospum (a micro-porous material similar to plastic) to make figures such as the human body, and farm animals (among others), and sells them on order to various schools and kindergartens in the city.  

Norma is requesting this loan to buy materials to make models of the human body and to make didactic materials for the kindergarten as summer vacation classes will begin on the fifteenth of January.  She needs the loan to purchase corrospum (a micro-porous material similar to plastic) to make educational figures.

She is happy to receive the loan and is committed to making her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to purchase corrospum to make educational figures.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza C. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 33 years old. Esperanza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Esperanza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Esperanza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Esperanza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esperanza is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Esperanza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rufina; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6.00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el local de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el restaurant.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rufina, 40, is a member of the “EL MOLINITO II” (The Little Mill II) communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in spouse and four children.  She alternates her daily chores with a restaurant business.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She is open for business from 7am until 6pm and this business makes it possible for her to support her children.  She wants to improve the restaurant’s site and is asking for a loan to equip the restaurant.

She is happy about the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To equip the restaurant.

loans.name: Wilhelma

texts.en:
Wilhelma D. C. is from the village of Taguilon. She is 64 years old. Wilhelma is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Wilhelma raises native chickens for sale. Wilhelma is also engaged in other businesses in the retail sector, primarily selling a variety of goods in the local community in her sari-sari store.

In 2007, Wilhelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilhelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Wilhelma is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Wilhelma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
GLORIA ELENA A. D., ES DE MANAGUA, ELLA TRABAJA DIARIO COMO AFANADORA, ES MADRE DE FAMILIA DE DOS HIJOS, Y ESTOS  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDEN DE ELLA Y SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DOÑA  GLORIA ELENA ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC, PERLINES, PINTURA PARA EL TECHO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION YA QUE ESTE SE ENCUENTRA EN MAL ESTADO.
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION Y BRINDARLE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA, AGRADECE A CEPRODEL YA QUE CON ESTOS FINANCIAMIENTO E PODIDO MEJORAR MI CASA.
texts.en:
Gloria Elena A. D. is from Managua.  She works in the cleaning business and is the mother of two school-aged children.

Doña Gloria Elena has requested a loan through CEPRODEL to carry out home improvements.  She plans to buy zinc, metal profiles and paint for the ceiling which is in disrepair.

She wants to improve her environment and give her family better living conditions.  She is grateful to CEPRODEL for the loan and the possibility to make these home improvements.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Carmen Isaura

texts.es:
Carmen Isaura L. M. tiene 37 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Carmen  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener ingresos estables.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Carmen Isaura L. M. is 37 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and unmarried children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 4 children.

The 'Grupo Enmanuel' community bank is located in San Juan, in Guaranda canton.  The 17 members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities.  They also raise animals such as pigs and hens.

Carmen is a farmer who grows corn.  She also raises pigs and hens.  She buys her animal feed in 'Comercial Silva' every weekend and sells her products in the 'Feria de los Jueves' market in Guaranda.

Carmen is requesting this loan to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals.  She will also buy feed supplies and supplies for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to have a stable income.

Carmen enjoys celebrating carnival festivities.

loans.use: to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals

loans.name: Vanessa Mercedes

texts.es: Vanessa Mercedes G. de 24 años de edad, madre soltera, vive en casa propia con sus dos pequeños hijos uno de los cuales ya se encuentra cursando sus primeros años de estudio. Vanessa se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, luchadora, dedicada y sobre todo llena de sueños y metas.  Ella posee una tienda en su casa de habitación ubicada en el Municipio de Ahuachapán del Departamento de Ahuachapan, en la cual vende todo tipo productos como: golosinas, granos básicos, huevos, café entre otros. Además de estos productos también se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa interior y ropa de vestir, venta de tortillas y pupusas los fines de semana, como se ve, es una mujer completamente dedicada a su trabajo procurando el bienestar de sus pequeños hijos: Miguel y Paola. Gracias a su carisma y habilidad para las ventas las personas cada día la prefieren más y exigen más variedad de sus productos. Vanessa confía que   con este préstamo que está solicitando a INTEGRAL  va poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, ofreciéndoles una mayor  variedad  de prendas de vestir y al  mismo tiempo mejorar sus ventas logrando obtener mayores ingresos para poder seguir manteniendo a su familia ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la cuenta.
texts.en: Vanessa Mercedes G. is 24 years old, a single mother, and lives in her house with her two young children, one of which is just starting school.  Vanessa is known for being enterprising, hardworking, dedicated and above all, full of dreams and goals.  She has a store in her house located in the Municipality of Ahuachapán in the Department of Ahuachapán.  There, she sells all types of products like sweets, basic grains, eggs, coffee, etc.  In addition to these items, she also sells underwear, clothing, tortillas and pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish) on weekends.  As seen, she is woman completely dedicated to her work to ensure the welfare of her young children, Miguel and Paola.  Thanks to her charisma and sales ability, people prefer her more and more each day and demand more variety in her products.  Vanessa is confident that with this loan requested from Apoyo Integral, she will be able to meet her customers’ demand, offering them a greater variety of clothing and improve her sales.  This way, she will obtain higher earnings to continue support her family, as it is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy sweets, basic grains, eggs, coffee, and other items.

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima lives in Pakpattan which is a small city in Punjab province, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She owns a 2-room house there and lives in it with her family in the area of Shakar Gunj. 

Ghulam is a very supportive lady who sells bed-sheets to share the financial burden with her husband. She also does her household responsibilities very well and takes care of her children. She has given birth to four daughters. Two of them are studying while others are not of school-going age yet. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business selling fruits. He started this business 13 years ago. He operates his business in a busy market in the city and offers different seasonal fruit varieties to his customers. He has a good name in the market for his good customer dealings and reasonable rates.  Using the loan, he will put more variety of fresh seasonal fruit in his shop for resale. 

Ghulam is hopeful that the loan investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position which will help her family to live a better  life financially.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit for fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth J. C. is a lady of thirty-two years, married and a mother of three lovely children. They live in Koitoror in the outskirts of Eldoret town. She does dairy farming in the same area. She milks the cows and sells the milk to her customers, and she has been in this business for six years now and gets a monthly income of fourteen thousand shillings.

This will be Elizabeth's third loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy one dairy cow, dairy feed, and milking jelly. With the income that she will get she plans to pay school fees for her children and expand her dairy farm. 

In future she plans to own a ranch and continue with the dairy farm.

loans.use: To buy one dairy cow, dairy feed and milking jelly.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three siblings. He has been working as a professional taxi driver for the past 11 years. His main route is between his town and the surrounding villages. He also does private transportation upon request of the clients. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was very thankful for the results. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new car in order to continue expansion of his business. In the future, he is hoping to hire a part-time employee to help him with the work.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Ambenakola Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Ambenakola, sont toutes des femmes mariées ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massoukou, sous préfecture de Fana; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de charbon de bois  et de sel de cuisine.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Ambenakola sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter  du  charbon et du sel.                                                                          
La cliente BAGNEBA compte acheter 30 sacs de charbon de bois avec les charbonniers du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au village de Massoukou, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de charbon.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Ambenakola group are all married with an average age of 37 years old and three children; they all live in traditional extended families in the village of Massoukou in the sub-prefecture of Fana, which lies in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). 
They met each other through relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell charcoal and kitchen salt. 

The women of the Ambenakola group are on their second group loan, which will be used to buy charcoal and salt. 

The customer, Bagnegba, is planning to buy 30 sacks of charcoal from coal producers in the village and surrounding areas. She carries out her sales every day in the village of Massoukou, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will be used to make her loan repayments and contribute to social ceremonies; the balance will be reinvested in her coal trading activity.

.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 49 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as spices, groceries, etc. Lucia has borrowed from and repaid 10 loans to NWTF before this one. She has been running the sari-sari store for many years and also earns extra income from a piggery. Lucia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old and a business man. He is married to Jane, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been selling second hand clothes in an open air market as his primary business and also does land farming with the support of his wife as his secondary business. He has been in the business for the past nine years, with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support family members.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Peter will use the loan to add more stock of second hand clothes, purchase farm manure and seedlings.

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to educate his children up to university level and live a comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: To add more stock of second hand clothes, purchase farm manure and seedlings

loans.name: Benkadi  5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi  5  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de DIGAN dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, région de KOULIKORO (deuxième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 42  ans,  5 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide et du gombo.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  cinquième  prêt  de campagne.
SALIMAI, qui est la deuxième debout à droite,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU.  Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU, BAMAKO et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, souvent en gros, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 15.000 à 25.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi 5 is a group composed of married women from the village of DIGAN in the sub-prefecture of OUELESSEBOUGOU, Region of KOULIKORO (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and average 42 years of age and five children each. The group members grow peanuts and okra.

Concerned about making their plantations profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their fifth farm loan.

SALIMAI, who is standing second from the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, sundry supplies and equipment, and some farm inputs at the big market of OUELESSEBOUGOU.

Following the off-season, the harvested crops are stocked for a certain time, so that they gain in value. And then they are sold retail (often in bulk) for cash at the big market of OUELESSEBOUGOU, BAMAKO, and at surrounding markets. The customers come generally from large cities.

After selling the produce, the group members each plan on making a profit of 15,000 to 25,000 francs CFA that will be used for paying the loan interest and for typical family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Víctor Hugo

texts.es: Víctor Hugo de 46 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposa María de 32 años y su hijo que por el momento se encuentra estudiando. Víctor se dedica  a la venta de medicina natural en las principales zonas del lugar donde reside. Ha logrado establecer variedad de clientes gracias a su amabilidad y calidad de sus productos. Durarte muchos años ha trabajado duramente para poder llevar a su familia el pan de cada día. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y quiere mantenerlo activo por muchos años más. El desea poder ofrecer mayor variedad de medicinas a sus clientes para poder aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. Es por esta razón que solicita este crédito para comprar variedad de medicinas como: vitaminas, pomadas, jarabes para la tos, y de más productos que sean atractivos para los clientes. Tiene plena confianza que los resultado van a ser positivos y podrá aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Víctor Hugo is 46 years old and lives in his own home with his wife, 32 year old María, and their son who attends school.   Víctor sells natural medicines in the main zones of the area where he lives.  He’s managed to establish many customers, thanks to his friendliness and to the quality of his products.  He’s worked hard for many years in order to provide his family with their daily bread.  This business is his primary source of income and he wants to continue it for many years to come.  He wants to be able to offer a greater variety of medicine to his customers so that he can increase his sales and income.  He is asking for this loan so that he can buy a greater variety of medicine, such as vitamins, creams, cough syrup, and more products that are attractive to his customers.  He is very confident that the results will be positive and he will be able to provide a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy medications for resale.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena es una mujer de 25 años que vive en San Miguel de Los Bancos, es madre soltera y su hijo hoy en día tiene 8 años de edad. Vive en casa de su madre que se llama también María y tiene 53 años, ella trabaja lavando a mano ropa de otras personas.

María Elena vivió la falta de oportunidades de trabajo y ya que debía mantener a su hijo aprendió de un amigo  la manera de fabricar productos desinfectantes para la limpieza doméstica hace dos años. Desde entonces se dedica de lleno a esta actividad. Diariamente trabaja hasta 10 horas y aunque es un trabajo muy duro a María lo más difícil de aprender fue la venta ya que según nos cuenta que no tenía experiencia en esto. Ella recibe ayuda de su sobrina quien es empleada en el sector público y en su tiempo libre la visita. María quiere invertir en materia prima para hacer sus productos por lo que necesita un crédito y así lograr su objetivo que forma parte de su gran meta.

Ella adora las actividades al aire libre y practica el fútbol, trata de compartir al máximo con su hijo y madre, ella sueña con hacer que su negocio crezca y vender su producto a nivel nacional.
texts.en:
María Elena is a 25-year-old woman living in San Miguel de los Bancos.  She’s a single mother of a son who is 8 years old now.  She lives in her mother’s house.  Her mother is also María and is 53 years old.  She works hand washing other people’s clothes.

María Elena suffered the lack of employment opportunities and, needing to support her son, learned how to make disinfectant supplies for home cleaning two years ago from a friend.  Since then, she’s been totally involved in this activity.  She works up to ten hours daily because it’s very hard work.  What was most difficult for María to learn was sales because, according to her, she had no experience in that.  A niece, who is employed in the public sector, visits her in her free time and helps her.  María wants to invest in raw materials to make her products so needs a loan to reach the objective that’s part of her great goal.

She loves activities in the fresh air and plays soccer.  She tries to share to the greatest extent possible with her mother and son.  She dreams with making the business grow and to sell her products nationally.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to continue making disinfectants.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is married and has 2 children. Roberto is 33 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Roberto operates a bakery to earn a living. He had requested a loan for 20000 to purchase 3 sacks of flour, margarine, sugar, oil, yeast and other items.

Roberto has been a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Roberto hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of flour, margarine, sugar, oil yeast and other items.

loans.name: Blanca Encarnación

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Amigas De Espoir se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

La señora Blanca es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y fáciles de conseguir. Tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 20, 18 y 11 años dos de ellos estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es agricultor.
 
Nuestra amiga es una gran madre y esposa que para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar también se dedica al  comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería nueva. Trabaja todos los días pero por horas y nos cuenta que cuando sale lo hace en las mañanas o en las noches ya que a estas horas es más fresco y encuentra a sus clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la traen de Quito o de Guayaquil  cada vez que necesita. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Amigas De Espoir" meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta. The city is well-known, and has a nickname of "Calceta without equal" because of the beauty of its women, and because for its inhabitants, there is no more beautiful city in the entire world.

Señora Blanca is a founding member of the Communal Bank, which she likes because the loans are very quick and easy to obtain.  She is 37 years old and has a common-law marriage, from which she has three children aged 20, 18 and 11.  Two of her children are attending high school and primary school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Our friend is a great mother and wife, who also works in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells clothes of every type, selling door-to-door, and also selling from her home, where her customers come when she has new merchandise.  She works for hours every day, and tells us that when she goes out to sell, she does so in the mornings or evenings, as this is when it is cooler and she can meet her customers.  She provides credit, and makes her charges each weekend.  She gets her merchandise from Quito or Guayaquil whenever necessary.  She has been working in this business for four years, and began it with the first loan that she received from the bank.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as: trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

Her dreams are to continue moving ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anelor

texts.en:
Anelor is 36 years old and is married with six children. She has five children in school and works very hard to provide for them. For the past year, Anelor has run a sari-sari (retail) store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other grocery products.

Anelor is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Rice and corn production are the primary source of income at Annayatan, Baggao, Cagayan. Vilma lives in this village together with her spouse and two children. The couple inherited a two-hectare plot of land from their in-laws and have been cultivating it for almost 15 years. 

Last crop season, they earned a yield of 35,000 PHP. Due to the expensive cost of farm inputs and daily needs at home, the profits earned were just enough to cover daily meals and the education expenses of her two children.

With her desire to improve her crop production, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides, and also to pay for laborers who help in transplanting rice seedlings in her rice field.

In the future, Vilma would like to achieve a plentiful harvest every harvest season. She also wants to continuously educate her children so that they can achieve degrees and pursue their chosen careers for the improvement of their lives someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides, and pay for laborers who help in transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto de 53 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia,  no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito La Matanza que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Alberto se dedica a la venta de harina de maíz para la elaboración de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), esta actividad los realiza desde hace 5 años, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de harina de maíz para la preparación de chicha de jora en la zona donde vive, cuenta con su clientela, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Teniendo la oportunidad de que su negocio crezca Alberto a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1300 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de harina de maíz para la elaboración de chicha de jora, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y para que su familia se supere poco a poco.
texts.en:
Alberto is 53, and lives with his wife and children in their own house, which doesn't have basic services. It is located in the rural area of La Matanza district, which is part of Piura department. Throughout this area, the people make their living from farming, livestock-raising, and handicrafts. 

Albert sells corn meal for making chicha de jora (this is a delicious beverage made from corn, that is very popular in northern Peru). He has been in this business for five years, and runs it out of his home.  

Lately, his sales of corn meal for making chicha de jora have increased in the area where he lives. He has his clientele, which has helped him to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.

Because he has the opportunity to see his business grow, Alberto has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,300 nuevos soles, to buy a larger quantity of corn meal for making chicha de jora. His aim is to obtain greater profits, and increase his clientele, in order to pay back the loan granted, and so that his family can get ahead, little by little.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of corn meal for making chicha de jora (corn beer), and to continue selling to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Natalicio De Jesus

texts.es:
El Sr. Natalicio es de Ciudad del Este, está casado con la Sra. Florencia, tienen 4 hijos menores. Natalicio se dedica a la venta  de harina de maíz, que el mismo fabrica con su esposa Florencia.
Se inicio en esta actividad vendiendo productos que fabricaba un vecino, junto un poco de dinero y compro para su máquina de moler maíz, para que de esa forma pueda trabajar en forma independiente con su familia.
El ha demostrado responsabilidad en créditos anteriores que vine  pagando en forma excelente, por lo que esta vez solicita de nuevo la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de Kiva para la compra de maíz, el cual es el producto indispensable para su negocio.
Natalicio agradece a las personas que confían en él para que el pueda acceder a créditos ya que manifiesta que es la única manera de obtener un capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Natalicio is from Ciudad del Este.  He’s married to Florencia and they have four minor children.  Natalicio sells corn flour that he himself makes with his wife, Florencia.

He started this activity selling products that a neighbor made.  He saved up a bit of money and bought his own machine to grind corn so that he could work independently with his family.

He has shown responsibility with his previous loans that he’s been repaying in excellent form so he’s asking Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for a new loan to buy corn which is an indispensable product for his business.

Natalicio thanks the people who trust him so that he can access loans because he states that this is the only way he can obtain working capital.

loans.use: to buy corn to make corn flour.

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат работает в центральном местном больнице. Его зарплата не хватает на содержании жены и детей. Поэтому он открыл свой бизнес, который приносить ему стабильный доход. Он занимается выращиванием пшеницы более 6 лет и успешен в своем деле. Его жена помогает ему в бизнесе, особенно по обработки земли и посева семян. Фуркат хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемой прибыли для того чтобы улучшить свое домашние условия. С этой целью он запрашивает займ, и просить вашу поддержку. Он заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Furkat works at the local central hospital.  His salary is not sufficient to support his wife and children, and this is why he started his own business, which brings him a stable income.  He has been involved in growing wheat for over six years and is successful in his business.  Furkat's wife helps him with the business, especially with treating land and sowing seeds.  Furkat wants to expand his business and make a desired profit in order to improve his living conditions.  He is requesting this loan for this purpose and asks for your support.  Furkat thanks you in advance for you kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to expand his business and make a desired profit

loans.name: Luz Eneida

texts.es:
La señora Luz Eneida se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir a terceros, esta labor la aprendió de su madre quien la entreno y le enseño todo lo necesario para desempeñarse y poder trabajar. Este negocio de la señora Luz Eneida surgió debido a que a ella le toco renunciar a su anterior trabajo en un hotel puesto que no podía dedicarle tiempo a su hijo. Actualmente en su negocio la señora Luz Eneida tiene cinco trabajadoras y siete máquinas.
Con el fin de agilizar la entrega de los pedidos, la señora Luz Eneida requiere de la compra de una maquina plana, que le permita aumentar sus ingresos y a futuro conseguir nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Luz Eneida works making clothing for third parties.  She learned this work from her mother, who trained her and taught her everything she needed to know to perform this work.  Luz Eneida started this business after she left her old job at a hotel because she could not spend time with her son.  

Currently Luz Eneida's business has five workers and seven sewing machines.  In order to expedite order delivery, Luz Eneida needs to purchase a flat sewing machine.  This would allow her to increase her income and attract new customers in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a flat sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Chepsai Group

texts.en:
Edward is the facilitator of the Chepsai group. Edward and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Edward takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Edward had an excellent maize yield harvesting nine bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Edward was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Edward and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Edward will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Chepsai group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Edward is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a 44-year-old businesswoman who is married to Mbutu, a businessman. They are blessed with four children ages 2, 12, 14, 16, and 18. For the past three years, Juliana has been running a boutique shop. She earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES which she uses to support her family. Juliana was introduced to KADET by a staff member.

Juliana is applying for her first loan with KADET to buy a stock of new clothes to add to her shop. With the anticipated profit from her business she will educate her children. In the future, Juliana hopes to open another boutique to help improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda works hard to support her family. Linda is married and has an entertainment (Resto Bar) business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years now. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of liquor and canned juices to sell. In the future, Linda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of liquor and canned juices to sell.

loans.name: Rouweida

texts.en:
Rouweida is a 41-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and six children who are all attending school. Unlike other women in her place, Rouweida is working hard to help her husband and become both capable to satisfy their family needs and wants. She has owned a mini-market since 2007 in her town, and she feels happy with what she has attained so far. 

Today, she’s looking to borrow $2900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy supplementary products such as groceries and provisions to be able to grow her business. In the future, she plans to open her own supermarket.

loans.use: to buy supplementary products such as groceries and provisions.

loans.name: Eluminee

texts.en:
Eluminee is 30 years old. She has four children aged between 3 and 10 years. Two of them go to school. She is married to a farmer. She has a small shop which she has been running for four years. 

With the loan she will buy more products such as sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees. She wants to have a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Midedji 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIDEDJI 1 est composé de trois  personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Françoise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Françoise est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin. Françoise n'a pas fréquenté l'école mais a appris la couture. Françoise est mariée à un mécanicien auto du nom de célestin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Françoise vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Françoise vend à son domicile des biscuits, des bonbons et des céréales depuis quinze ans à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Françoise faire aussi la couture. Françoise  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Françoise ensemble avec les membres du  groupe MIDEDJI 1, sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des cartons de biscuits et des céréales.

loans.name: Ammer

texts.en: It was hard for Ammer  to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Ammer  is 50 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 7 children.  Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 30000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Ammer  has gained great confidence in the business as she has learnt how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a well known businessmen in Salyan. He is single. Saleh has been in this business for 3 years. He likes the variety. Saleh sells the china-ware, cut-glass wares: champagne glasses,drinking glass, set  and etc. 
He requires a loan of $500 to expand the area of his business and to buy a lot of wares.

loans.use: To buy the crystalware, cut-glass wares

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tarasila Wangui Irungu intends to buy the farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds.

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Mrs. Morm R., 35-year-old mother of 2 children who are enrolled in school, lives with her husband in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement the family revenue, she runs a grocery store on the roadside of this village and typically makes in average $11/day, while her husband earns around $3/day from his work at a local clinic. Morm R. is asking for $1000 loan to purchase more grocery products for her inventory as well as to satisfy an increase in the number of her clients. The  sustainable development of this business motivates her to go ahead and be able to provide a high level of her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes works selling motorbike parts. She plans on buying more parts. She has been working in this job for over fifteen years.  She's are married woman with five children.  Her husband works on a truck picking up garbage.  She buys parts from a warehouse and has an establishment.  She sells tires, tubes , oil , gas.  She is in a small community called Los Casabes.

loans.use: To buy motorbike parts for resale.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Mrs. Elsa F. is 36 years old, and she is happily married to 43 year old Mateo Miranda. The couple has four children, who are all students living at home. Elsa began her venture in 1990 as the owner of a small carpentry business that is currently very well equipped with top quality machinery. Recently she began to make fine furniture for commercial sale in large cities like the capital city of Paraguay, Ciudad del Este, among others. She has a truck for deliveries. The couple's dream is to see their children be professionally successful in the future as well. They are asking for a loan to buy pallettes of wood, since today their products demand a higher quality and buying larger quantites requires a larger amount of money.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Elsa F. de 36 años de edad, se encuentra felizmente casada con el Sr. Mateo Miranda de 43 años de edad. El matrimonio cuenta con 4 hijos, todos estudiantes y viven con ellos. Doña Elsa se inicio en este rubro en el año 1990 siendo propietaria de una pequeña carpintería que actualmente se encuentra muy bien equipada y con maquinarias de primera calidad. Posteriormente se dedicaron a la fabricación de muebles finos para la comercialización en grandes ciudades como la capital del Paraguay, Ciudad del Este, entre otros. Y para dicho traslado cuentan con un camión. El sueño de la pareja es verles a sus hijos que en el futuro sean profesionales exitosos. El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de maderas en rollo, ya que en esta época del año sus productos obtienen una mayor demanda y comprando en grandes cantidades se adquiere una mayor ganancia.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Cynder Gael

texts.es:
Mrs. Cynder M. is 30 years old and the mother of 3 children, all of whom study and for whom Mrs. M. work tirelessly selling foods from a Kiosk that is rented in the center of the city. Mrs. M. separated from her husband not long ago and decided that she would become the head of the household. Despite her hard reality, she has succeeded; motived by her immense love as a mother. Many people enjoy her excellent seasonings and her great variety of plates she offers thanks to her culinary skills. Nevertheless, the rent for the kiosk is much more than the normal going rate and cuts into her earnings she works so hard for on a daily basis. Today she wishes to expand her business and to purchase her own kiosk so that she will not have to pay rent, and in which way she will be able to continue to give unconditional support to her children as well as continuing to delight her loyal customers. Your contribution can make this dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Cynder M. de 30 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales son estudiantes y trabaja incansablemente vendiendo comida en un kiosco que alquila en el centro de su ciudad ya que se separó de su esposo hace un tiempo y decidió llevar las riendas de su hogar sola.A pesar de esta dura realidad ha salido adelante, motivada por el inmenso amor de madre que posee y es así que muchas personas disfrutan de su excelente sazón y gran variedad de platos gracias a sus habilidades culinarias, sin embargo el alquiler del kiosco muchas veces merma considerablemente los ingresos que diariamente se esfuerza por conseguir.Hoy anhela grandemente adquirir su propio kiosco para no tener que pagar un alquiler, de tal manera que pueda seguir siendo aquél apoyo incondicional para sus hijos y asimismo pueda seguir siendo el deleite de sus comensales.Vuestra contribución posibilitará este hecho.

loans.use: To purchase a vending space to increase earnings.

loans.name: Ngheam

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngheam Heng, 45, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Champ province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on their rice paddy growing crops and together earn around $1/day of profit. All of her children are currently employed at a garment factory and help to support the household by giving $100 each month between them.
In order to generate additional profits, Ngheam Heng and her husband would like to produce wine and sell them, yet they face a financial constraint in the business. Currently, this couple has requested for a loan to purchase some tools and other items to assist in their wine producing business. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs.Ngheam Heng is unavailable)

loans.use: To purchase tools and some items to produce Khmer wine.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria P. is a single mother with three children For 6 years she has worked selling food outside of the Mayoreo market. She knows how to run her business well, and despite being a single mother, she has worked very hard to provide for her three children through the difficult times they have had as a family.

Since she was very young, she has been interested in preparing and selling food, and she ventured into this market out of necessity and her responsibility as a mother to her children. From the time she started working, the location was in poor condition, without a roof or walls, but once she began borrowing from Ceprodel and investing these funds, she has little by little built her business and now she needs to purchase cooking ingredients. Her greatest hope is to attract more customers in order to earn more money, which she will reinvest into her business and use for the necessities of her children at home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Translator.

Rosa Maria P. es madre soltera y con tres hijos a su responsabilidad. Desde hace 6 años se dedica al negocio de venta de comida en las afueras del mercado Mayoreo. Ha sabido administrar bien su negocio y a pesar de ser soltera, ha logrado con mucho esfuerzo mantener a sus tres hijos en medio de situaciones difíciles que como familia atraviesan. Desde muy pequeña se interesó por elaborar los alimentos y venderlos, incursiona en este mercado por la necesidad y responsabilidad que como madre debe tener hacia sus hijos. Al momento de iniciar su localidad estaba en pésimas condiciones sin techo ni pared pero a partir de que comenzó a realizar créditos en Ceprodel los ha invertido para construir poco a poco su negocio y a la vez para surtir de ingredientes para la comida. Su mayor anhelo es captar mas clientes para obtener mejores ganancias y reinvertirlo en su negocio y las necesidades de sus hijos en su hogar.

loans.use: To acquire cooking ingredients

loans.name: Bubulete I A Group

texts.en:
Justine B. is a 32-year-old mother of three young children. She and her husband make a living by running a retail store in Kamuli, Uganda, and wish to buy more merchandise to expand her store. With the extra profits, she hopes to start a new business.

Justine has applied for a loan of $825 U.S. dollars along with two other women. In this type of group loan, the money is divided among each woman to invest in her own business. They guarantee each other's loans, so that if one woman can't repay it, the others will cover her share. Sarah Namulida wants to grow her charcoal selling business, while Betty Nakianda hopes to purchase a fridge for her small brewery. Justine has taken out a loan before and paid it back on time, so she is confident that she will be able to repay this one as well.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand her retail shop

loans.name: Nureste

texts.en: Nureste A. is a livestock breeder in the northeastern Azerbaijan town of Khachmaz. She is married with five children and she and her family have been involved with this business for the last ten years. Nureste has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit and is currently looking for funding so that she can purchase more livestock.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina is a hard-working woman and since the age of 18 she has worked in a ceramics workshop. Helping her husband and her brother-in-law, she started to learn about the ceramic trade, learning how to create different decorative ornaments. In time, she became an expert; nevertheless, keeping up a job and running a household was very hard for her. This is why she left her job to open a business from home. She realised that she could make a success of selling office and school equipment and so that is what she did. Today, she has been running her bookshop for three years and thankfully it is all going well. In the future she would like to install a mini ceramic workshop so that she can continue to create ornaments and so that her children have a secure business when they finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Constantina es una mujer muy trabajadora que desde los dieciocho años ha trabajado en un taller de cerámica. Ayudando a su esposo y a su cuñado empezó a aprender el oficio de trabajar la cerámica para producir diversos objetos de ornamento. Con el paso del tiempo ha llegado a especializarse en este oficio; no obstante, mantenerse en ese trabajo y a la vez ocuparse de los quehaceres del hogar fue muy pesado para ella. Es así que detuvo su trabajo para abrir un negocio en su misma casa. Se le ocurrió que tendría éxito vendiendo útiles para oficina y colegio si es que se lo proponía. Y así lo hizo. Actualmente lleva tres años con su librería y felizmente le está yendo bien. Más adelante ella quisiera implementar un mini taller de cerámica para seguir produciendo adornos y también para que sus hijos, al terminar el colegio, tengan un oficio seguro.

loans.use: To buy the necessary tools for her ceramic workshop

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan works as an attorney’s assistant in legal proceedings, in court, in city hall and all legal related matters. He resides in the Villa Copacabana neighborhood of La Paz. He is married and his wife is employed. He has two daughters that are of school age. This is the second time that Juan requests a loan in Impro and the second time that he asks for Kiva’s help. The loan will be used to purchase school supplies for his two daughters and for their monthly tuition. His hard work and his desire to get ahead allow him to assume this loan. His prior loan from Kiva has been paid in full and according to the required terms.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Juan trabaja como asistente de abogados realizando trámites legales, en el juzgado, alcaldía, Derechos Reales y Todo lo referente al área legal. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz. Es casado y su esposa es empleada, Tiene dos Hijas en edad escolar. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva; el crédito será destinado para la compra de material escolar de sus dos hijas como también el pago de las mensualidades del colegio. Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito. El crédito anterior conseguido a través de Kiva ha sido pagado en su totalidad y de acuerdo a los plazos establecidos.

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies and payment of tuition for his daughters.

loans.name: Marta Chavela

texts.pt:
Marta is 39 years old and a native of Namaacha, a district that borders with Swaziland. Marta is married and the mother of 3 sons the oldest of which is 17 years old, the second is 11, and the third is 4. Marta studied until the 7th grade, not continuing due to mandatory military service which lasted 2 years.

After her discharge she returned with her husband that she met in the army to the town of Namaacha. Marta learned the business through her father in law who was a great trader in the area. The establishment that she runs was from her father in law who is deceased. Marta says that the products with the most sell-through are beer, that she buys for 21MTn and resells for 25MTn, and sugar.

Marta has had a monthly income of 2,500MTn and is able to save a little by the end of the month. Besides the business of selling staple products she also raises cattle, and currently has 24 head. Marta has 2 employees, one for each activity, and she pays 1,200MTn per month to each one.

This is her first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. She has never had a loan before. She came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is a client. With this loan, Marta intends to purchase basic staple products to resell in her establishment. She would like to refurbish and paint her stand, increase her animal count as well as recoup a tractor that was her father in law's.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Marta tem 39 anos de idade e é natural de Namaacha, distrito que faz fronteira com a Swazilandia. Marta é casada e mãe de três filhos, sendo a primeira com 17 anos, a segunda com 11 anos e a terceira com 4 anos. Marta estudou ate 7ª classe, não tendo continuado devido ao serviço militar obrigatório no qual permaneceu lá durante 2 anos. Com a sua desmobilização voltou com o marido que conhecera lá na tropa para vila de Namaacha. Marta aprendeu o negocio através do seu sogro que foi um grande comerciante na zona. O estabelecimento que explora foi do falecido sogro. Marta diz que o produtos que tem mais saída são a cerveja que compra por MTn 21 e revende por MTn 25 e o açúcar. Marta tem tido um lucro mensal de MTn 2,500 e consegue poupar um pouco no fim do mês. Marta para alem do negocio de venD. de produtos da primeira necessidade dedica se a criação de gado bovino, contando atualmente com 24 cabeças.
