Marta tem dois empregados, um para cada atividade, e paga MTn 1,200 por mês para cada um. Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Marta com Hluvuku e Kiva. Marta nunca teve outro empréstimo antes e conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que é cliente. Com o empréstimo, Marta pretende comprar produtos de necessidade básica para revender em seu estabelecimento. Constitui sonho para ela reabilitar a sua barraca pintar e ampliar, aumentar o seu efectivo animal, alem de recuperar um trator do falecido sogro.

loans.use: Purchase goods to restock her store

loans.name: Eshmumin

texts.en:
T. Eshmumin is 54 years old, married, and has five children. In addition, he also has several wonderful grandchildren. Despite his old age, Eshmumin has been involved in bicycle repair since 2007. His business has gradually expanded, and customers continuously return because of his hard-working and polite nature. His clientele is extremely satisfied with their products, and the income Eshmumin earns is a major factor of his family’s income.

Eshmumin would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase spare parts for bicycles and increase his repair capabilities. He expresses his gratitude and thanks everyone who will support him in advance, and promises to return his loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of the spare parts for bicycle for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Bahati's Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.en:
Bahati is 25 years old and married with two children -- one is two years old and the other is six months old. She has been a charcoal and ice cream seller since 2007. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $23 from her sales.

In the past, Bahati has had another successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She plans to buy more charcoal to sell for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Halima, Aziza, Asma, Mwanahamisi and Fatma, who also have businesses.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell in her business

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor T. is a 57-year-old widow with seven children (three sons and four daughters). Three of her children are married and live outside the family home; one daughter is a garment factory worker; another daughter is a silk weaver; yet another daughter assists in her mother's business of selling grocery items; and, her youngest son raises cows. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Nhor has been selling grocery items for two years. She purchases her inventory from the Preak Anchan market in order to later resell such goods from in front of her house. Currently, she would like to expand her business, but lacks the money to do so. Therefore, Nhor is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to expand her grocery business and to buy silk materials for her daughter's weaving business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing grocery items for resale and to purchase silk materials for her daughter's weaving business.

loans.name: Firengiz

texts.en: Firengiz S. is 46 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of four children. All of her children are in school. Her husband helps her with sales, but before, they were both unemployed and Firengiz was pushed to start her own business so that she could help him cover their living expenses. For more than 10 years she has been selling children's clothing. Firengiz is a very enthusiastic and dynamic woman. She has very good taste in selecting the clothing that she buys and amazing marketing skills in convincing her clients about the clothing they should buy. She has been the main breadwinner of the family for a long time. She now requests a loan which she will use to buy new clothing for the autumn season and to purchase some women's clothes. Firengiz is grateful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells construction retail items and tools in the local Yubileinyi market. Valentina is married with one daughter, Alla. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her gross income is about 8,000 Grivnas. 

Valentina decided to start this business because construction and remodeling supplies are always in demand. She is very focused and hard-working. She devotes most of her time to this small business and believes her venture makes her life brighter and richer. This time Valentina is requesting a 6,000 Grivna loan to increase her turnover capital. She is hoping to repay her the loan in 6 months. 

Note: Valentina is in a picture with some of her customers who came to buy from her as this picture was taken.

loans.use: To increase inventory and turnover in capital

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 25 años, es conviviente, de esa relación conyugal tiene tres hijos y uno en camino. En horas de la mañana se dedica a su casa y cuidar sus hijos, hace 3 años ella y su esposo compraron un motocarro para que su esposo trabajara en transporte de pasajeros, dice que les va muy bien, diario le deja un aproximado de 20 soles, por lo cual han visto que le es muy rentable. Solo es muy difícil cuando la moto tiene que entrar en reparación y deben comprar nuevas piezas para que rinda como debe ser, ahora ellos están pensando en comprar otra moto y hacerla trabajar con un chofer y esto les de un ingreso adicional. Es su 5to préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará los repuestos para su motocarro, los que les costarán un aproximado de S/.1.500.00
texts.en:
Norma is 25 years old, she is common-law married, and from this union she has three children and one on the way. In the morning hours she tends to her house and cares for her children. Three years ago she and her husband purchase a motorcycle cab, her husband is the driver providing transport to passengers. She says that it's going very well, earning approximately 20 nuevos soles daily, which they have considered as very successful. It is very difficult when the motorcycle has to go in for repairs and when they have to buy new parts to get it to run as it should. They are thinking about buying a second one and hire a driver to keep it running, to give them a second income. It is her 5th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). With the funds requested she will purchase spare parts for the motorcycle cab, which will cost approximately S/.1500.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the motorcycle cab.

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya M., 28 years old, lives in the town of Khapichhen in Lalitpur, where two years ago she opened her tailoring shop specializing in making custom-fitted ladies’ dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. Before starting the business, Maiya took a six-month training course in tailoring. She is now requesting a loan to buy raw materials for her work.

Maiya lives in a single family with her husband, Mr. Rabin M., who works in his own electronic shop, and her three-year-old son, who is in preschool.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Seak N., 31, is married and lives in Siem Reap with her husband. Since 1992, she has been selling groceries to earn a living and is able to make US$ 7 a day, while her husband makes $1.70 a day working as a police official. This couple has three children, two of whom are students while one is too young to attend school. Seak N. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to add to her grocery inventory.

loans.use: To add to her grocery inventory.

loans.name: Faina

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Faina K. from Mbarali. She is married with two children, age 2 and 5. Faina has been running a clothes and voucher business since 2005. She purchases clothes and vouchers from wholesale businesses and sells them at retail.

She works at her business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Faina currently earns about US$250 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$550 to purchase more vouchers and clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to increase number and varieties of items in her business. Faina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans wit

loans.use: To purchase more vouchers and clothes in bulk for her business

loans.name: Vohid

texts.ru: Вохид Мужчина в возрасте 56 лет , отец троих детей.Он вместе с сыном занимается бизнесом продажи живой рыбы.Он торгует на рынке г.Гафурова. У него свои постоянные клиенты которые перепродают товар.Сам Вохид имеет поставщиков рыбы , которые сами привозят ему.Вохид в основном продаёт рыбы породы сазан.Для увеличения оборотного капитала Вохид решил взять кредит.
texts.en:
Vohid is a 56 year old man, a father of three children. He and his son are in the business of selling live fish. He works on the market of the Gafurov town. He has many regular customers who then resell his fish. Vohid has suppliers of fish who bring it to him. Vohid mostly sells carp of similar type of fish. To increase his working capital Vohid decided to take out a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
La señora Edelmira Sánchez A. tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria estudio su secundaria completa, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos dependen económicamente de ella.
Edelmira Sánchez se dedica a la venta de menú los cuales son repartidos en la curtiembre “Los Líderes”, así como entre sus familiares y vecinos, prepara únicamente pedidos, la preparación de los alimentos los realiza en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 85 soles que recibió del Banco Comunal  “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la compra de víveres para la preparación de sus alimentos.
Con el crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de víveres para los extender la cobertura de su negocio.
Edelmira tiene como un sueño, poner su restaurante o una juguería.
texts.en:
Edelmira Sánchez A. is 51 years old and lives in the Moche District in the province of Trujillo, in the department of Libertad, Peru. She finished high school and has 6 children, two still depend on her financially.

Edelmira sells meals which are delivered to the tannery "Los Líderes”, as well, as to friends and neighbors. She only offers take out orders and prepares them in her house.

With her first loan of 85 Soles (3 Soles = $1USD) that she received from the Communal Bank “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, she invested in supplies for the preparation of meals.

With the loan of 500 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she'll invest it in supplies in order to reach a wider customer base.

Edelmira dreams of implementing a restaurant or a toy store.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to grow her business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, actualmente toda la familia vive en una casa alquilada. Tras haber laborado dependientemente por muchos años en una entidad financiera, ahora se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, en lo que le va muy bien por cada campaña, ya que sus pedidos son de 1000 a 1700 soles cada vez, y sus ganancias 350 a 450 soles. Cada vez que tiene que recoger la caja con los productos, su esposo la apoya prestándole el dinero hasta que ella realice sus cobros en su totalidad y le devuelve.  A Carmen le gusta todo tipo de negocio, por ello que hace unos 4 meses incursionó también en la venta de “Rena Ware”, que es una línea de utensilios de cocina, lo cual dice estar resultándoles mucho mejor de lo que esperaba. Pero ello, no significa que reemplazará la venta de cosméticos, a la cual está ya muy acostumbrada, y conoce las cualidades y ventajas de cada uno de los productos de belleza y tiene una gran gama de clientes. Carmen acaba de asumir la presidencia de su banco comunal, por lo cual hace compromisos de cumplir con el cargo encomendado, Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable. El dinero que viene solicitando es para adquirir productos de belleza con un costo menor, aparte de los pedidos, de ese modo sus ganancias serán mayores.
texts.en:
Carmen is 47, married, and has two children. The whole family lives in a rented house. After years of working as an employee of a financial organization, she now works selling cosmetics. She does very well each season. Her orders are now 1000 to 1700 PEN every time, and her earnings are 350 to 450 PEN. Every time she has to pick up the box with the products, her husband supports her by lending her the money until she makes her total charges. Then, she returns the money to him. Carmen likes all types of business. That’s why 4 months ago she started selling “Rena Ware, a line of kitchen utensils. This is doing better than she thought. But, that does not mean that it will take the place of her selling cosmetics. She is very used to selling cosmetics; she knows the qualities and advantages of every one of her beauty products. She has a great range of customers. Carmen has just begun the presidency of her community bank. She promises to complete the duties in her charge. This is her 8th loan with MFP. In all of this time she has shown herself to be a very responsible customer. The loan is to buy additional beauty products at wholesale prices, which will lead to greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba I. is married with 2 children and received an education through primary school. Since 2007, she has worked as a trader selling shoes at Kissi in Elmina. While Habiba works as a trader, her husband is employed as a fisherman. Habiba will use the loan to purchase additional footwear for resale and she plans to save some of her newly gained profits and also reinvest some into the business to ensure her continued success.

loans.use: To purchase additional footwear for resale.

loans.name: Abdugafur

texts.en: M. Abdugafur is 44 years old. He is married and has a son. Abdugafur sells toys for children. He rents a place for selling which is located in one of the local markets. He has been running his own small business for 15 years. Having only a couple competitors in the market he is doing well with his business. Abdugafur always dreamed of owning his own small store and not having to depend on anyone else. He believes that someday his dream will come true and he will open his own store. Today he is requesting 6500 Somoni for the term of 9 months for purchasing new toys to increase his range of goods. Abdugafur thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to be accurate with the loan repayment. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more toys to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is 23-year-old man. He has been working as a plumber since 2003. Today, he is hoping to borrow $1,200 to be a part of an upcoming project.

loans.use: To be a part of an upcoming project

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
The smiling face shown in the picture is Mrs. S., 36, a mother who is blessed with a daughter who is enrolled in public school. She was married, but has been divorced from her husband for a year.

S. currently owns a sewing machine which she uses to sew the neighbors’ clothing for income. She will be using the loan to purchase more tailoring tools to better support her business. As well, she will buy a bicycle for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring tools for her business and a bicycle for transportation

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana Maria tiene la edad de 45 años, reside en el Municipio de Villa el carmen Carretera viaja a León, casada, y tiene  cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos trabajan y dos estudian, la señora Ana Maria se desempeña como Vice alcaldesa de Villa el Carmen. También tiene un negocio una pulpería y venta de ropa Con este crédito quiera compra materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines para reforzar un tramo que lo administra su hijo en el mercado del municipio, ya que esta en mal estado. Sus planes es poder seguir invirtiendo en ropa, zapatos y otros productos que pueda vender y crecer en inventario como en buenas utilidades.
texts.en:
Doña Ana Maria is 45 years old, and lives in the Villa el Carmen municipality. She is married, and has 4 grown children, two of whom study, and two work. Ana Maria works as the vice mayor of Villa el Carmen. She also has a general store and sells clothing. She is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials, such as zinc, and materials to re-enforce part of the municipal market. Her plans are to continue investing in clothing, shoes, and other products that she can sell and grow her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Cory

texts.en:
Cory B. is from the village of Extension, Taglimao Cagayan De Oro City. She is 23 years old. Cory is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Cory owns and operates a variety store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Cory is just starting this business.

In 2009, Cory joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cory has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Cory is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cory from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her inventory

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Omolayo

texts.en: Omolayo is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She live in Lagos state Nigeria. She sells eggs, provision and foodstuff. Omolayo has been in this business for over 2 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N150, 000 to purchase more provision and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lender and LAPO microfinance for financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs, foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Luz Del Transito

texts.es: Luz del Transito R. P. tiene la edad de 36 años. Doña Luz  tiene 2 hijos que son menores de edad y están a su cargo. La actividad económica de  es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio por la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de su casa, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante ya que es la única manera en la que puede ofrecer sus productos. Tiene los propósitos de incrementar su inventario para competir fuertemente. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo efectuara la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, chaquetas. Los sueños de Luz son de establecerse en una tienda y así  proporcionarle este negocio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz del Transito R. P. is 36 years old and has two children who are still minors and under her care. Four years ago, Luz began selling clothing to make money to pay the household costs. Her business is mobile as this is the only way she can sell her products. With this loan, Luz hopes to add to her inventory and make her venture more competitive. She would use the money to buy pants, shirts, skirts, and jackets. Luz's dream is to open a store and eventually pass the business on to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia S. is from the village of Salimpuno,Pana-on,Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Eulalia is married and has 2 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Eulalia owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating pedicab transport services. Eulalia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Eulalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eulalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories.

Eulalia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tires and other accessories. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Eulalia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tires and other accessories

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Vending of vegetables is the business of Lilia B.. She used to roam around their village to sell her vegetables.  Lilia is happily married to Damian and they were blessed with six children: Francis-23 years old;Randy-22 years old; Richard-21 years old still studying; Bernardo-19 years old; Ariel-16 years old still studying;Rhialyn-10 years old. 

Lilia would like to buy additional vegetables to further improve their way of living and to be able to support the needs of their children.  According to her, the income she generate from her business is not enough so she is asking for financial assistance from the lenders.  She would like to avail a loan of PHP5,000.  This will be used to purchase more vegetables that she will sell.

loans.use: Additional capital for vending acitvity

loans.name: Joseph Mwangi

texts.en:
Joseph Mwangi is a 51-year-old farmer. He is married and has three children. His primary business is to supply milk to his customers in Ngecha, Kikuyu. On the side, he also has a vegetable farm from which he supplies vegetables to Ngecha. He has been supplying milk for about seven years. He has been able to collect a monthly profit of about 20000 Kenyan shillings. 

Joseph wants to buy an extra cow to increase his milk supply.  He is the founder of his borrower group and has not borrowed from any other sources before. In the future, he hopes to own a big dairy farm with over ten cows, each producing about 30 litres of milk per day.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy an extra dairy cow to supply milk to community

loans.name: Jeramy

texts.en: Jeramy is a hog raiser. She lives with her husband and three children namely: Joshua (seven years old, elementary pupil), Jonard (two years old), and Jose III (one year old). Jeramy is married to Jose Jr. who is busy cultivating their rice fields while Jeramy is busy with her hog raising business. Aside from raising hogs, she is also a manicurist. So far, she is working hard to earn more income for feed for her pigs. But due to the high cost of feed, she would like to borrow additional capital of 4,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed for her pigs. Some of it will also be used to buy materials needed for her pedicure and manicure business.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising and manicure businesses

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en:
Batsuren is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 5-year-old daughter in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband is an inspector at the bank of Mongolia, and Batsuren owns a retail clothing business in her town. She began her business in 2007 with working capital of 1,000,000 tugrugs and now her working capital exceeds 2,800,000 tugrugs. Because of her business success, she has been able to improve her family’s finances and improve their quality of life. Batsuren would like to eventually own her own shop and expand her clothing offerings for her customers. She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more clothes and begin the expansion of her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and begin the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Having plowing done

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario M. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman Camiguin Province. He is 54 years old. Mario is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Mario owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store where he sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Mario has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Mario is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Mario from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elena Micaela

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Elena Micaela B. tiene 59 años de edad es casada, con 3 hijos todos mayores de edad, es de la etnia creole y pertenece a una familia muy conocida en el barrio Santa Rosa, esta señora tiene desde hace aproximadamente 6 años una pulpería en donde vende varias clases de productos incluyendo granos básicos, gaseosas y otros.

Cabe señalar que la microempresaria B. es miembro de la iglesia Verbo desde hace algunos años en donde participa activamente en las actividades de la iglesia. La señora B. esta solicitando apoyo para que se le financie la suma de US 900 dólares para comprar productos en general para surtir su pulpería. 

La microempresaria B. considera que con este préstamo podrá mejorar su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos ya que le permitirá diversificar sus ventas.
texts.en:
This businesswoman is Elena Micaela B.. She is 59, married, and has three grown children. She is of Creole ethnicity, and she belongs to a well known family in the Santa Rosa neighborhood. For approximately six years she has had a mini market, where she sells various types of products including basic grains, soft drinks, and others. Please note that businesswoman B. has been a member of the Verbo church for some years, and she actively participates in church activities. Mrs. B. is asking for a loan for 900 US dollars to buy general products to stock her mini market. Businesswoman B. feels that with this loan she will be able to improve her business and get greater income because she will be allowed to diversify her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and various products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora   ROSA G. R. tiene 71 años, vive en el distrito DEL PROVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal UNIDAS PARA EL PROGRESO II. La socia presenta estudios  hasta 1ero de Primaria, pero refiere que luego empezó a aprender a escribir y leer con ayuda de sus familiares, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo ya mayor e independiente. Rosa se dedica a la venta de anticuchos (comida al paso) en la esquina de su casa. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para la compra de 1 parrilla y bancos.
Con este crédito de 1,100.00  nuevos soles comprará insumos como: camote, mollejas, corazón (carne) al por mayor para preparar sus anticuchos. Ella sueña con  empezar a vender menú todos los días.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa González Rodríguez is 71 years old, lives in "Del Porvenir" District, Trujillo Province, Libertad Department in Peru. She belongs to the Communal Bank "Unidas para el Progreso II." She has a 1st grade education, but says she learned to read and write with the help of relatives. She is a single mother of one grown son. Rosa sells food in the corner of her home. With her first loan of PEN 300, she bought a grill and some benches. With this loan of PEN 1,100 she will buy beef and organ meats to prepare the food she sells. Her dream is to be able to sell food every day.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying organ meats to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a fridge to prepare fruit juices, ice and fresh water

loans.name: La Cumbre Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Cumbre” esta representada por la señora Norma  y compuesto por 10 miembros 9 mujeres y un varón es un grupo unido y dinámico como lo demuestra su presidenta la cual es casada y tiene dos pequeños niños uno en edad escolar y el otro es un lactante D. un año D. edad, la señora norma se dedica a la venta D. comida en la puerta D. su casa  donD. atienD. a algunos pensionistas y a la gente del lugar, el crédito será destinado a la compra D. mesas y sombrillas para atender a sus clientes en su patio y desea realizar un tinglado para la época D. lluvia para darles mas comodidad a sus clientes y agrandar su negocio para poder terminar D. construir su casa y darles un techo mas cómodo a sus hijos, su esposo trabaja como chofer y ayuda con los quehacer para colaborar a su esposa y poder tener la opción D. poder tener su propio carro para trabajar y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia. El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. refrescos, café, cosméticos, ropa, chompas otras se dedica a la prestación D. servicios en salones D. belleza y el único varón participante posee una cerrajería propia.  El mercado en el cual se desempeñan existe bastante competencia, sin embargo, ellas se valen D. la rapidez que tienen para cambiar y surtir sus mercaderías para salir adelante y obtener el ingreso necesario para el sustento D. sus familias. El presente crédito será utilizado para capital D. operaciones y para la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y materiales para incrementar su ventas y mejor la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia se pueD. mencionar que las socias trabajaron antes bajo la modalidad D. créditos solidarios en otras instituciones similares a la fundación por lo que saben administrar los fondos otorgados para el beneficio D. sus negocios y para el mejoramiento D. la calidad D. vida D. sus hogares.
texts.en:
The group "La Cumbre" is represented by Norma and composed of 10 members, nine women and one man. It is a united and dynamic group as is demonstrated by their president who is married and has two small children, one of school age and the other a one year old baby. Norma sells food from the doorway of her house where she attends to some boarders and the local people. The loan will be used to buy tables and sunshades so she can serve her clients on her patio and she would like a cabin to make her customers more comfortable when it rains. She wants to grow her business so that she can finish building her house and put a better roof over the heads of her children. Her husband works as a chauffeur and helps his wife and hopes to have his own car so that he can work and improve his family's quality of life. The other members of the group sell sodas, coffee, cosmetics, clothes, and sweaters, another serves customers in a beauty salon, and the one male in the group has his own locksmith business. There is plenty of competition in the markets within which they operate, but they rely on the speed with which they can change and supply their goods to be successful and get the income they need to support their families. The current loan will be used for operating capital and to buy supplies, raw materials, and goods to increase their sales and improve their families' quality of life. In speaking of their experiences, it can be said that the members used to work with other similar micro-loan institutions through the Foundation so they know how to administer the funds granted for the benefit of their businesses and for the improvement of the quality of life in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Siony's Group

texts.en:
Siony B., 40, is from the village of Santiago. She is the leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Siony is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Siony raises livestock, mainly pigs for fattening and sale.  Siony has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month

In 2007, Siony joined ASKI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  Siony has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Siony is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Siony from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 
--------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build a wall around his house

loans.name: Zefer

texts.en:
Zefer M. is a 42-year-old man who breeds livestock in the small village of Saatli city. Zefer has been breeding cows for the last 20 years.  He uses the milk from the cows for his personal use and also sells the cattle for meat.

He is married and doing everything to make his wife happy as well as his two adorable daughters. Zefer applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN  to purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Phestus Ragga

texts.en:
Phestus Ragga O. operates a tailoring business in Migori town in Kenya. Besides that, he is also a driver who operates along Kisumu Migori route. With the dream of buying his own Matatu vehicle, Phestus wants to expand his business so that his income can increase with enough profit to be able to save. He wishes to get a loan of KES 30,000, which will be used to boost his tailoring business.

He is 30 years old, a husband, and a father of five children.

loans.use: To increase stock for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Chantsal

texts.en:
Chantsal is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a “ger” in a rented yard. Her 22-year-old son and 20-year-old daughter are both university students.  They have been living together in their current home for three years. 

During the day, Chantsal operates a grocery store in a rented shop with the help of her husband. She sells a variety of food products including candies, biscuits, beverages, pastries and bread. Chantsal purchases her products two to four times a week depending on product sales. She has been operating her grocery store since 2009, after working as a salesperson in her brother's similar shop. In addition, she has certificates as a cook and builder.  

Chantsal is a precise person who has very good communication skills. She says, “My dream is one day to open my own shop which will save me my rental costs. The most important thing to me is to pay the university tuition fees of my son and daughter.  Tuition rates have been increasing from year to year and have become a problem for us. I need to work hard to provide financial stability for my family.”  She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more food products to sell at her shop and make payments for her children's tuition payments.

loans.use: To make her children's university tuition payments

loans.name: Togoontumur

texts.en:
Togoontumur S. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She operates a dairy-trading business, purchasing dairy products from a nearby small village and transporting them to the market in her town. Togoontumur started her business in 1995 with working capital of 30,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) and it soon reached 2,900,000 MNT. 

Since her business has become increasingly profitable, she has been able to provide for her three children's university tuition fees and purchased a car for her husband as well. 

Togoontumur's main goal is to expand her business and she wishes one of her children would inherit her business in the future. She is an open-minded and hardworking woman. 

Togoontumur is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products at wholesale prices in order to increase her sales in the market.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Mrs. Chey S., 48, is a modest woman living in Kompong Tom Province. She is a local cultivator, raising pigs and growing crops on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expense needs, her husband works selling wooden beds that he makes himself. He owns a cart and he uses it to pick up beds to sell around his community. The couple have four children: two are now married and two are single. Both of the children are employed and provide some of their income to meet the financial needs of their family. To generate additional income, Chey S. is applying for a loan in order to buy a plowing machine for their use and also to rent to farmers during the farming season.

loans.use: To buy a plowing machine for their use and also to rent to farmers during the farming season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a piece of property (a lot).

loans.name: Primo

texts.en:
Primo P. is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is 27 years old and is single. Primo works in someone else's business providing habal-habal (motorcycle) transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Primo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Primo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair the engine of his motorcycle. This loan will be his ninth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the engine of his motorcycle

loans.name: Neng

texts.en: Mrs. Neng M. was born in 1945 and lives in Prey Kabbas Kha village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Meou Tieng, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Her husband is also a laborer. Although they work a lot, they earn very little money to support their family. To improve this situation, Mrs. Neng M. is requesting a loan to start a new business and buy a cow for breeding. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline. She is the mother of a child who is a teacher. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella y lo que mas le agrada son las charlas de cómo invertir su dinero.
Yanet es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 7 años que estudia y vive en casa alquilada, Yanet tiene un restaurante en una avenida transitada, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 1 personal, además Yanet vende bebidas.
Yanet solicita un crédito de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido para la decoración del local y la compra de gaseosa.
Yanet sueña con tener una casa y otro restaurante.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the Anabella communal bank. What she likes most about it are the talks on how to invest your money. She has a live-in partner and a seven-year-old son who goes to school. She lives in a rented house. Yanet has a restaurant on a busy avenue. She is open for business every day and has one staff person. She also sells beverages. Yanet is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy soft drinks and to decorate the restaurant. She dreams with owning a house and having another restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To decorate the space and buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Letty Diana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Letty esta en el Banco Comunal hace seis años y está muy a gusto porque los intereses son mínimos, ella tiene 42 años esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, tres de los cuales viven con ella a pesar de que son mayores de edad, también tiene una nieta de 1 año que vive con ella y dice que es su princesa. Su esposo es albañil.

Se dedica a la venta de sabanas y a la cría de pollos, tiene una pequeña granja, trabaja todos los días en el cuidado y alimentación de sus pollos,  la venta de sabanas las realiza los sábados y domingos, trabaja unas cinco horas entregando y cobrando ya que deja a crédito. Compra las sabanas en Picoaza, en cuanto a los pollos los compra en una incubadora y después de tres meses los entrega en tiendas de la localidad.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar mitad en sabanas y la otra parte en pollos.

Su sueño es terminar su casa ya que le falta mucho.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora communal bank meets at the La Sequita church parish that is part of Montecristi, a prosperous Manabí canton full of hard-working dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish whose members are people who only know of work and family. Letty has been with this communal bank for 6 years and is very satisfied due to the low interest. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children three of which still live with her despite being adults. She also has a 1 year old granddaughter she calls her princess who also lives with her. Her husband works as a mason. Letty sells bed sheets and raises chicks on her small farm. She works everyday feeding and caring for her chicks, she sells her sheets on Saturdays and Sundays, and spends about 5 hours delivering and collecting since she sells on credit. Letty purchases sheets in Picoaza and buys the chicks from a hatchery and after three months she delivers them to local stores. She will use half the loan to purchase sheets and the other half for chicks. Her dream is to finish her house that still has a long way to go.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bedsheets and chickens

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sandra has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for four years.  She sells vegetables too.

To help expand her business, Sandra has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal and vegetables. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sandra hopes to generate greater profits to pay for school fees. In the future, Sandra hopes to go back to school and become a doctor.  

Sandra is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to behave.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra integrada por mujeres muy trabajadoras quienes quieren salir adelante mediante el trabajo y ayuda solidaria de todas las integrantes. 
La Sra. Honoria es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la  venta de leche, queso y verduras. 
En fin realiza varias actividades, es una señora muy creativa en su actividad, y todos sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. 
Ella tiene una familia muy unida con varios  hijos y su marido trabaja en agricultura. 
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. 
La señora  solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados etc.
texts.en: This committee is made up of very hard-working women, who want to succeed through hard work and the mutual solidarity of the group. Señora Honoria is one of the group members. She works selling milk, cheese and vegetables, among other activities: she is very creative in her approach to work, and her customers are impressed with her hard work. She has a very close family, with several children, and her husband works in agriculture. She is very satisfied with the group's work and with the training they have received. She is seeking the loan to buy animal feeds, etc.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds

loans.name: Basooka Kwavula Development Association-Mityana Group

texts.en: 63-year-old K. Walusansa worked as a government veterinary officer before he decided to start his current cattle and poultry business 12 years ago. K. is married with 21 children, all of whom have completed school. Aside from the aforementioned business, he also operates a farm in Masaka. His weekly profits equal 500,000 shillings. With this loan, he is going to buy medicines to treat his animals and buy more chicken feed. He is affiliated with the Basooka Kwavula development association-Mityana.

loans.use: The purchase of medicines to treat his animals and also buy more chicken feed

loans.name: Anna M.

texts.en:
Anna is a woman of 54 years, married to G., who is a farmer. She stays in Kalii, Emali which is a peri-urban area.  She operates a general shop where she sells food items like flour, salt, sugar, cooking oil, etc. This is her primary business which she has been running for the last six years. Her secondary business is farming which she does on the family farm and later selling the produce at a profit.
 
She came to know about KADET through a community awareness event, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. With this loan advance, she plans to add more stock with the following items: sugar, bales of flour, rice, salt, and others for Kshs 10,000, and also she wants to invest the rest in farming.

She hopes to give her family a better life.

loans.use: To invest in farm & to restock her retail shop

loans.name: C6207 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Janviere is 26 years old and is married with two children who are 6 months and 3 years old.  She is the president of a group called “Abishyizehamwe” and this group is commonly known for selling a variety of goods in their various businesses, such as clothes, foodstuffs, gasoline, etc. 

Janviere and her team are now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to satisfy the demand of their customers which keeps increasing beyond their financial capacity.  With the use of this loan, Janviere and her team expect to earn more profits which, in turn, will be used to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Heriknaz

texts.en:
Heriknaz A. lives in Yerevan with her husband, sister-in-law and her son. Heriknaz first worked in a self-service store as a cashier and later in a shoe factory. In 1991, Heriknaz and her husband left Armenia for Bulgaria where they managed their own shop. After 5 years, they have returned home and Heriknaz started a business renting a space at the trade fair where she sells a variety of toys, including mechanical, musical, and educational toys. 

Heriknaz’s first Kiva loan allowed her to organize mixed products trading in her shop and place a stall with mixed products for resale in front of her rented shop. Now, she is requesting a loan of 500, 000 AMD to buy a lot of toys for her shop in view of the New Year's holidays. This is Heriknaz’s eleventh loan from Nor Horizon and her second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy toys for her shop in view of the New Year's holidays

loans.name: Elba Del Socorro

texts.es:
Elba de 28 años de edad, vive en la Ciudad de Nueva Guinea, costado sur del Parque, es madre soltera de un niño de 5 añitos, vive con su mamá que que le ayuda cuidandole a su hijo cuando ella sale a trabajar, recibe ayuda para el niño por parte del papá, ella trabaja como docente desde hace  4 años en la Escuela Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell ubicada en la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea,  esta joven es una mujer bien responsable, honesta y  trabajadora  que ha luchado para que a su hijo no le falte lo basico en el hogar.  

Esta solicitando su segundo crèdito, para remodelar su vivienda y asi brindar mejores condiciones a su linda familia. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su hijo estudie para que sea un hombre de bien y que goce de mucha salud.
texts.en:
Elba is 28 years old and lives in the city of Nueva Guinea, on the south side of the Park.  She is a single mother and has a 5 year-old child.  Elba lives with her mom who helps her by looking after her son when she goes out to work.  She receives help from the child's father.  Elba has been working as a teacher at Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell School which is located in Area #1 of Nueva Guinea for four years.  This young woman is very responsible, honest and hard working and she has worked hard so that her son doesn't want for any essentials in their home.

Elba is requesting her second loan to remodel her home and thereby provide better conditions for her beautiful family.  Her biggest dream in life is for her son to study so that he becomes a good man and for him to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To remodel her home

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab, 51, lives in Okara, a small Pakistani city known for its agriculture industry. She resides in the small housing colony named Faisal Mehmood with her family in a two-room brick house. Zainab is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and and discharge her household responsibilities. She is also an expert in sewing clothes, earning family income by sewing for her neighboring clients.

Zainab is a mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her elder son works in a Punjabi food restaurant, while her daughter also sews clothes. Five are at home, while two others are getting their education. Her husband, M. R., runs a shop in the market where he sells construction supplies to his regular customers and also to the building constructors.

Zainab has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business, which she has operated for over 10 years. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine which will help her work more efficiently and complete orders on time, as her current machine has become old and incapable of producing quality work. She is hopeful that an investment will earn her more profits.

Zainab is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit history and has faithfully attended all meetings.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Lok

texts.en:
Mr. Lok T. is a villager who lives in Kaoh Prak village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to cultivate vegetables to sell to support his family. He would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for growing vegetables on his farm. The rest of the loan he wants use to buy bamboo to build a vegetable trellis. His wife, Mrs. Chea San, stays at home and also helps her husband with the farming. 
This couple has four children. Three of the children are seamstresses in a garment factory and the last one is a farmer. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea T., 63, is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. T. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of USD 2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 38 on food and USD 8 on other necessary expenses. 

T. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase corn and bean seeds to grow. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy corn and bean seeds to grow

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
JORGE LUIS M. U., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA EN MANTENIMIENTO,  Y POR LA NOCHE ESTUDIA INGENIERIA EN LA UNIVERSIDAD.
DON JORGE ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, BLOQUES PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR SU CASA DE HABITACION, YA QUE ESTA TODABIA NO ESTABA CONSTRUIDA EN SU TOTALIDAD. 
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION Y BRINDARLE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
A GRADECE A CEPRODEL POR EL PRESTAMO BRINDADO YA QUE AHORA SU FAMILIA CONTARA CON UNA MEJOR VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis M. U. is from Managua. He is employed as a janitor and at night he is studying engineering in university. 

Jorge approached the offices of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to make some home improvements. He will invest in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand, and construction blocks to finish building the house. It is not entirely built yet. these home improvements are to provide better living conditions to his family. 

He is thankful to Ceprodel for the loan and now his family will be able to have a better home.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Angel Domingo

texts.es:
Angel Domingo R. A. tiene 46 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Angel Domingo  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener terreno para sembrar.

Le gusta hacer deporte y salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Angel Domingo R. A. is 64 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and their three single children in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.  He has five children.  

The members of the Grupo Enmanuel Community Bank can be found in the San Juan precinct, which is in the Guaranda canton.  This bank has 17 members, farmers who grow large quantities of short cycle corn, wheat, and potatoes.  They also raise animals and sell them on Thursdays at the fair in the city of Guaranda.

He is requesting the loan to plant corn, wheat, and potatoes.  He will also buy animals and supplies to feed the animals and for his crops.  The support of the loan would financially help supply him with the necessities.

The challenges he faces are pest infestation, diseases, and climate change.

His dream is to have a field to sow.

He likes playing sports and going out with his family.

loans.use: to plant corn, wheat, and potatoes, and to buy animals

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 30 años de edad, es natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, esta casada con Simeón de 33 años y tienen 03 hijos juntos viven en su propia  casa en la comunidad de Pampa Miraflores caseríos del distrito de Santa Rosa. Reyna y su pareja, cuentan con muchos proyectos en mente, razón por la cual hace 03 años invirtieron sus ahorros en venta de repuestos para todo tipo de vehiculo motorizado. En su negocio le va muy bien  y existe mayor demanda por parte de sus clientes  y trabajan de la mano junto con su esposo. Le gusta este negocio a pesar de obtener buenas ganancias esta en plena comunicación con las personas. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir creciendo económicamente y con el transcurso del tiempo abrir otra sucursal  en otros distritos. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de repuestos y lubricantes. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, el dinero solicitado le será de mucha utilidad. En su banco comunal es una socia participe. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará accesorios para la venta de repuesto que realiza.
texts.en: Reyna is 30 years old and is from the District of Santa Rosa.  She is married to Simeón who is 33 and they have three children together.  They live in their own house in the community of Pampa Miraflores, a rural area in the District of Santa Rosa.  Reyna and her husband have many projects in mind, which is why they invested their savings in selling spare parts for all types of motor vehicles three years ago.  Their business is doing very well and there is greater demand from their customers.  They work closely together.  She likes this business since in addition to making a good profit, she is able to interact with people.  Her plans are to continue growing financially and to open another branch in other districts over time.  The loan requested is to obtain spare parts and lubricants.  This is her eighth loan with MFP and the money requested will be very useful for her.  She is a participating member in her communal bank.  With the 3,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will buy accessories for her spare parts sales.

loans.use: to buy accessories for motor vehicles.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a twenty-seven-year-old single mother with one child. She rents a house in Kasese. Florence has been dealing in fresh foods for three years, a business she started with 300,000 UGX. She now has 800,000 UGX. Her problem is high transport costs.

Florence intends to use her profits to buy additional fresh foods. Her vision is to build a house and set up a food store.

loans.use: To buy fresh foods

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a hardworking, obedient and reliable lady.  With her personality, she is able to run her clothes-selling business in a competitive environment.  She has been running the business for almost four years and has employed one person.  She was previously selling vehicle spare parts to earn a livelihood for her family. She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Retailing is 26-year-old N. Hope's business, one in which she has been giving a good account of herself for seven years now in Nabuti-Mukono. She says to get established in this enterprise, she was prevailed upon by her close friends who were already engaged in business. The single mother of one sells a variety of general merchandise that is in high demand amongst the people around her neighborhood.

Hard work and determination have been her calling cards, and weekly she earns profits of shillings 400,000. She will use this loan to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Branny

texts.es: Branny, de 21 años, es una joven madre de familia muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Roger de 24 años y su querido hijo Ángel de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Branny es una madre muy amorosa, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y del cual es muy solicitada por sus clientes, a quienes siempre les brinda una sonrisa, ya que sabe que ellos son muy importantes para el progreso de su negocio. Su metodología de trabajo, es la venta de casacas, chompas, pantalones, por catálogo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, a quienes siempre hace reír, debido a la alegría que le pone a todo lo que hace. Lleva 2 años en este trabajo y lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar bajo el intenso calor todos los días en busca de clientes. Anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender más prendas y atender mejor a su clientela, sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para mejorar su vida, ante esto pide el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda desarrollarse como comerciante. Es será su tercer crédito con MFP, por ello esta muy contenta, además tiene la confianza en que pagará a tiempo sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Branny, 21, is a young, very kind and hard working mother living in her own house with her husband, Roger, 24, and her beloved son, Ángel, 4, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

Branny is a very loving mother.  She sells clothes and is quite sought after by her customers that she always greets with a smile because she knows that they are important for her business’ progress.  Her working methodology is jacket, sweater and pants sales via catalogue.  What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers who she always makes laugh because of the joy she puts into everything she does.  She’s been in business for two years and what she least likes is having to walk under the intense heat every day looking for customers.  She dreams with having a store where she can sell more clothes and better tend to her customers.  She knows that she must work hard to improve her life and in face of that asks all of you for support so that she can develop as a merchant.

This will be her third loan with MFP.  She is very happy about that and is confident that she will repay her installments on time.  She is very respected in her communal bank because she always imposes order during the meetings.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more clothes to offer a wider variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with one child. Michelle has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, biscuits, and beverages. She has had this business for three years and has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more inventory. Michelle is a new member of HSPFI and hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 44 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. 

Jonah has a general store and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more products for her general store. 

Jonah became a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Rose has a business that sells clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy lives in  Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Cissy has a business of selling clothes. She has been in this business for one year. She works six days out of every week. Cissy sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Cissy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. The main business challenges for Cissy include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes herself and to start selling on a wholesale basis only. Cissy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Carlos Manuel, tiene a su cargo una persona es luchadora, responsable, con buenos valores y principios  morales, que lucha para sacar adelante sus hijos para un futuro mejor. 

A esta oficina de ceprodel se presento  a solicitar crédito que será utilizado para remodelación de su vivienda, en hacer un porche,  para darle más seguridad  a su familia y agradece a ceprodel la oportunidad con este desembolso compra materiales de construcción tales como bloque, hierro, cemento, arena.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel is from the city of Managua, and he has one person under his care.  He is tenacious and responsible with good values and moral principles.  He works hard to get his children ahead in order to have a better future.

He came to this Ceprodel office to request a loan.  It will be used to remodel his home by building a porch to provide his family with more security.  He is grateful to Ceprodel for the opportunity.  With this loan he will buy construction materials like cement blocks, iron, cement, and sand.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Eliodoro

texts.en:
Eliodoro is cheerful and a humble father. He was blessed with three children and a responsible wife who does daily household chores. Despite poverty, the couple still aspires to provide a progressive living for the family.

Eliodoro was given a rice field as an inheritance from his parents, and he has cultivated it for 10 years now. He raise crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for future sale. According to him, typhoons, drought, pests and snails affect his crop production.

He is now requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy fertilizers and moluscicides used in farming. Moluscicides are chemicals used for the treatment of pest and snails. 

Eliodoro hopes to surpass all the trials he has been encountering in his farming business and produce a better yield to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and moluscicides (chemicals used for the treatment of pests and snails) to use in farming.

loans.name: Mery Salome

texts.es:
Mery es socia del  Banco Comunal “Vallecito Vizcachani”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, uno de ellos es independiente.  Cuenta con educación primaria.
Su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de verduras y flores, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ocho años.
Con este nuevo préstamo  de  S/.  100.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de semillas de zanahoria, cebolla y flores, etc,  para el sembrío,  para luego venderlos.  Trabaja sola en el negocia su esposo trabaja en construcción civil.
La señora desea tener un puesto en el mercado y que su  negocio crezca.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo en períodos cortos
texts.en:
Mery’s a member of the “Vallecito Vizcachani” (Little Vizcachani Valley) communal bank located in Puno District and Department.  She’s 42 years old, married and has five children; one of them is independent.  She finished elementary school.

Her first loan was for 300 new soles and she invested it in her vegetable and flower sales business.  He’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 8 years.

She will use this new, 100 new sol loan, to buy carrot seeds, onions and flowers, etc. to grow and then sell.  She works alone in her business; her husband works in civil construction.  She hopes to have a stand in the market and that her business grows.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of short-term loans.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds, onions and flowers, etc.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 58 years old and married, with 10 children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc,. in her sari sari store.

Dominga has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from furniture making.  Dominga aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Marve

texts.en: Marve is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Marve has a retail shop that sells souvenir shirts, pajamas and bath towels. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy t-shirts needed for making souvenir shirts. Marve is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marve hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts needed for making souvenir shirts

loans.name: Hanz Nord

texts.es:
Hanz de 31 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Hanz se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza y comercialización de animales de corral (cuyes  y aves de corral), sus corrales los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos  naturales, una vez que lleguen a su peso  y tamaño ideal los ofrece a sus clientes en los diferentes mercados de la zona y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y para realizar arreglos en sus corrales, para engordarlos y luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un buen precio por ellos y así pueda tener mayores ganancias para brindarle a su esposa  una mejor calidad de vida.  Hanz  es una persona dedicada su trabajo y lo único que desea es poder brindarle a su familia algunas comodidades en su hogar y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Hanz, 31, lives with his wife and children in his own house that only has electricity and is located in Paijan District belonging to La Libertad Department, a zone noted for farming, animal husbandry and tourism.

Hanz has been raising small farm animals (guinea pigs and barnyard fowl) to sell for several years now.  His corrals are in his back yard and he feeds his animals nutritionally balanced feed, grains and natural grasses.  Once they reach ideal size and weight he sells them to customers in various local markets and uses income obtained from the sales to cover his daily household needs.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa through its Seed Capital program for a 2500 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his animals and to do some repairs to the corrals to fatten his animals up and then sell them in the various local markets aiming for good prices for them to have higher profits to provide his wife with a better quality of life.  Hanz is a person who is dedicated to work and all he wants is to be able to provide his family with some comfort at home and that his business continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to do some repairs to his corrals.

loans.name: Onester

texts.en:
Onester is 35 years old.  She is a married woman with three children, and all three are in the school. She has a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years.

Onester requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to order more charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 51 years old and married to George. Together they have four children ages 18, 23, 26, and 28 years old. She is a farmer and sells second hand clothes. She has been in the business for the past 10 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is her third loan term in KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for farming and also purchase some clothes for resale.


She will use the anticipated profit to purchase a dairy cow. Her dream is to own a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who currently attend school. For the past four years, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her salon where she does hairdressing for local women. Elizabeth's loan group is comprised of two hardworking women.
