If the loan boosts the business, he will buy a piece of land and build commercial houses. John’s dream is to open a butchery in Kajiado and start supplying meat to Nairobi. He describes himself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats and sheep for trading

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
M. Gulchehra is 43 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of 3 children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle, and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. Gulchehra asks for a loan of $1976 USD in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Pro Desarrollo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Pisac district of the province of Calca.

Her name is Fortunata P. B. and she is 35 years old.  Fortunata is single and doesn´t have any children.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her vegetable business.  She sells many different types of vegetables (depending on the season) in the market of Pisac from 8am to 1pm in the afternoon.

Fortunata  commits to making her loan payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to invest in a vegetable business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. makes palm oil at Abura for resale.  Ama has been through junior high school.  She is a widow taking care of ten dependents. She has been in this business for three years. She responsibly provides the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruit to process into oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependents.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruit to process into oil for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is 55 years old and married with six children whose ages range between 15 and 31. Two of the children are currently attending school.

Esther has a dairy farm in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for 15 years and sells her milk through Kenya Cooperative Creameries. She has employed one farmhand. She also earns income from her small-scale farming of tea, which she sells locally.

Esther has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable her to meet her family's basic needs. She would like to increase the number of her dairy cows, build a modern dairy unit and improve the quality of her dairy feeds in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Abarihamwe Women's Group-Ntungamo

texts.en: K. Agatha began her banana sales business 2 years ago. The 49-year-old, happily married mother of 4 says before she ventured into her current trade, she was operating a used-clothing sales enterprise. Agatha says one of her closest friends was behind the decision to change businesses. This business, which she operates from Ntungamo food market, generates her 100,000 UGX, weekly. Agatha, who belongs to Abarihamwe Women's group, says she is requesting this loan to purchase other foods such as cassava, maize and potatoes to sell.

loans.use: The purchase of foods such as cassava, maize and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Harold Augusto

texts.es: El Sr G. labora como técnico en computación  es  soltero, tiene un hijos  a su cargo,   es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para  comprar  puertas y ventanas y mano de obra, para  su vivienda.
texts.en: Mr. G. is a computing technician. He is single and he has one child in his care. This is his first loan through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner). He is thankful for the support provided through this loan. He will purchase doors and windows for his home and pay for their installation.

loans.use: To make some home improvements.

loans.name: Donita

texts.es:
La señora Donita L. S. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el Barrio la Ceibita de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion. Donita es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio, tiene muchos clientes a los cuales abastece de su productos, su negocio esta en un lugar estrategico en donde la afluencia de personas es grande.
Donita todos los dias se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para atender a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor para surtir su negocio y asi tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Donita L. S. is 33 years old and lives in the neighborhood of La Ceibita in the city of Choluteca. She sells popular consumer products from a store in her home. Donita is a hardworking woman who is devoted to her business. She has many customers who buy her products. Her business is situated in a strategic location where there is a large influx of people.

Donita wakes up every day at 6am so that she can attend to her customers. Her loan will be used to purchase merchandise in bulk so that she can restock her business and generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise in bulk to restock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, damask cloth, sheets, and mobile phones

loans.name: Smbat

texts.en: Smbat S. lives in the village Shaqe, in the Syunik region of Armenia with his pensioner mother and 2 sons. He works as a driver, but the salary is too low to meet the family needs. So Smbat is also engaged in agriculture. He needs more financial means to develop  agriculture business. With the requested loan Smbat plans to buy seeds and fuel.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fuel

loans.name: 0410018- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
"Vạn P. Thị (48) is a 49 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Vạn is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 0410018- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường (0410018- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường).

Vạn is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To making a living, Vạn operates a family member's fishing business harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Vạn has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,100,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Vạn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Vạn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Vạn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  P. Thị Vòng (78) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


2.  N. Thị Thọ (43) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


3.  Lê Thị Tăm (71) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


4.  Lê Thị Chọn (49) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


5.  P. Thị Trà (100) is a 61 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


6.  Lê Thị Duyên (28) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Vạn P. Thị (48) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Vạn là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0410018- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường (0410018- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Vạn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Vạn kiếm được khoảng 2,100,000 VND.  Vào 2002, Vạn đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Vạn đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị đánh cá bao gồm lưỡi câu & lưới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. Thị Vòng (78) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  N. Thị Thọ (43) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  Lê Thị Tăm (71) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  Lê Thị Chọn (49) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  P. Thị Trà (100) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


6.  Lê Thị Duyên (28) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: John Mbugua

texts.en:
John, who has practiced farming in the town of Olkalou for the last five years, is 30 years old, married to Lucy Wairimu and the father of three children. John was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his third loan, his previous loans all repaid well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and to plough the land.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading dairy farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and to plough the land.

loans.name: Martir Group

texts.es:
El grupo Martir lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadora y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Teresa del Carmen de 32 años quien desde hace 10 años inicio su negocio de venta de ropa el cual en el 2009 aumento gracias a los préstamos y su ardua labor. Ella invertirá en ropa para niños, damas y caballeros con el fin de que su negocio siga creciendo.
Las otras integrantes son Josefa de 37 años quien vede zapatos desde hace 2 años y Martir Isabel de 35 años quien tiene una mini pulpería.
texts.en:
The “Martir” Group is comprised of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Teresa del Carmen who is 32 years old and started her business selling clothing 10 years ago. In 2009, she expanded it thanks to the loans and her hard work. She will invest in clothing for children, women and men in order for her business to continue growing.

The other group members are 37-year-old Josefa who has sold shoes for two years, and 35-year-old Martir Isabel who has a small store.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise for children, men and women.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a widow with 3 children, one of whom still attends school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child. 

For the past 20 years, Mwanasha has operated a business selling doughnuts at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Mwanasha dreams of expanding and establishing another business in the future.

Mwanasha plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to start another business by purchasing bales of mitumba (secondhand clothes) for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of mitumba (secondhand clothes) for sale.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya and is age 39. She has been in farming for 12 years producing milk, cabbages and tea and selling all these to the local market. She is married with three children who are all in school.

Winnie has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she hopes her income will improve with the new acquisition, in addition to her poultry, and make life better for the entire family. She says she hopes to be stable enough to acquire two more dairy cows and put up a dairy unit on her farm in the next five years.

Winnie says poor land ownership is the challenge in farming.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah is 33 years old, married and has two children.  

She makes and sells detergents to earn a living. She has been operating the business for three years. Besides making detergents, she gets extra income from farming.  

She was previously selling second-hand clothes. She has boosted her business with her previous loan from Faulu Kenya. 

Juliah hopes to buy a business premise instead of renting in the future. She has requested 40,000 KES to buy chemicals for making soap and containers for storing it.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for making soap and containers for storing it.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 49 years old and married to Joseph. They have two school-going children. 

She sells second hand-clothes and has been doing it for many years. She is applying for her fourth loan; she wants to use it to buy materials to add to her stock and also be able to meet the demands of her clients. 

The profits made from this business will help her cater for her family's needs and pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials to add to her stock.

loans.name: Maria Calixta

texts.es: La señora Maria Calixta tiene 52 años, ella es casada. Maria tiene su negocio que es la venta de frijoles cosidos, gaseosas y leña, cabe señalar tiene 21 años de tener este negocio y también posee una clientela ya establecida en su comarca. La mayoría de sus ventas son al contado, sin embargo también realiza ventas a crédito, para algunos clientes que son fijos. Este negocio nació por la necesidad de incrementar los ingresos familiares, para mejorar económicamente. Ella desea invertir este crédito en la compra de frijoles, leña y gaseosas. Su sueño es tener otro medio de ingreso para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Calixta is 52 years old and married. Her business is selling cooked beans, sodas and firewood. She has been doing this for 21 years and has a well-established clientele in her neighborhood. The majority of her sales are in cash, but she also sells on credit for some of her regular customers. The business was born out of the need to bring more income into the family to improve financially. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of beans, firewood and sodas. Her dream is to have another form of income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, firewood and sodas.

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Airene has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, biscuits and snacks.

Airene is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Airene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits and snacks

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal Inti, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de Carbón de ladrillo, gallinas y papa en la Selva. Viviana es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 3 años, el préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en su negocio ya que es la Fiesta de Santa Rosa y hay mayor demanda. Agradece los préstamos recibidos, lo mas importante para ella son sus hijos, les ha podido educar en buenos colegios y tiene la satisfacción de que el mayor ya ingresó a la Universidad San Cristóbal de Huamanga, le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque le enseñan a ahorrar y a poder invertir bien en su negocio, ahora su meta es poder comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the “Inti” communal bank.  She’s 37 years old and has four children.  She sells charcoal briquettes, chickens and potatoes in the jungle.  Viviana has been a member of FINCA Perú for the last three years.  The loan she’s requesting will be invested in her business because the feast day of Saint Rose is approaching and demand rises.

She gives thanks for the loans received.  Her children are the most important thing to her.  She’s managed to educate them in good schools and she has the satisfaction that her eldest has enrolled in the San Cristóbal University in Huamanga.

She likes the communal bank meetings because they teach her how to save and to invest well in her business.  Now, her goal is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is 45 years old, married and father of four children (in the ages between one and seven) living in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for the past 12 years and acquired start-up capital for this business through farming. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations and debtors who don’t pay on time. Nonetheless he continues to dream of having his own wholesale shop. Gerald needs the loan to buy items like soap, sugar and salt for sale.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt and sugar for sale

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
This is a loan group with four members that is located in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Hean was chosen as the team leader. He is 31 years old and he lives with his common-law wife and their four children. All of his children are attending school. Since 2008, Hean has run a transportation business as a Tuk-tuk driver and he earns approximately 4 USD each day. He is working very hard and striving to earn something for himself and contribute to the household expenses. Hean works every day from six in the morning through six at night.

Hean is requesting a loan to repair and renovate his house. He hopes that this loan will help his family find happiness and prosperity and allow him to educate his children through university and honor his village. This will be the eighth cycle of his HKL loans and the third cycle of his Kiva partner loans. He is very thankful to all of the kind donors who always help his family.

loans.use: to repair his broken house

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es: El señor Carlos Miguel solicita  un préstamo para impermeabilizar el techo de su casa; por que en temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina por consecuencia el techo se esta deteriorando. Juan Carlos quiere prevenir que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto al igual que sus hijos puedan contagiarse de alguna enfermedad por la humedad que se genera. Para poder cubrir los gastos el y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora 10 horas de Lunes a Viernes y algunas ocasiones se queda tiempo extra para recibir mas dinero. Carlos Miguel  es padre  de dos niños, de los que quiere brindar mejor patrimonio. Para que el pueda realizar su proyecto necesita comprar el impermeabilizante.
texts.en: Mr. Carlos Miguel is requesting a loan to waterproof the roof of his house, because during the rainy season water seeps through and the roof is deteriorating.  Juan Carlos wants to prevent any further damage and having to spend more than necessary.  He also wants to prevent any illnesses his children might get because of the humidity.  To cover household expenses he and his wife work ten hours a day from Monday to Friday and sometimes overtime for extra money.  Carlos Miguel has two children and he wants to give them the best he can.  In order to carry out his project he needs to buy waterproofing materials.

loans.use: To buy waterproofing materials.

loans.name: Hellen Kasivi

texts.en: Hellen is a 41 year-old married woman. She has 4 children, with ages ranging from 5 years to 25 years. She describes herself as being talkative and likes sharing ideas. She operates a clinic where she provides medical services to patients and sells medicine to them. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes10,000 loan to buy more medicine. Her business goal is to grow her business and open another clinic in a different area within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children to the university level

loans.use: To purchase medicine

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 49 years old and is married with 4 children aged 16, 14, 8 and 5. He has 2 additional dependents living with him. They are his wife's relatives. 
In 2004, Mohamed established his plumbing fittings business. He began his business by repairing fittings whilst he was an apprentice at SALWACO. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from his business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy plumbing material for his shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. 
In the future, Mohamed plans to do contract for major companies in order to cater to his children's schooling and medication. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plumbing material for his business

loans.name: Chile

texts.en:
Chile is 33 years old and lives in Helen, Larena, Siquijor. She is separated from her husband and without children. To earn a living, Chile has a business selling finished food products, like sausage, delivered to her neighboring village. She earns about 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 30,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her sausage business. 

Chile has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year. In the future, Chile would to expand and acquire a permanent space to display her products in the right location.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her sausage business

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 31 years old and has been in farming for 8 years. His farm produces maize and beans, which he supplies to the local market. He is the father of one two-year-old child, and he lives with his family in Kitale, Western Kenya.

Silas has requested a farming loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the milk produce will help him take care of his children. Since farming is his only source of income, he wants to improve his farming business by reinvesting his profits in it.

He laments the unreliability of the rain and animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. For the last five years, she has been running a grocery business to support her family. She has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she plans to expand her business. Caroline is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy small fish (omena), tomatoes and fruits for resale. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care.

loans.use: To buy small fish, tomatoes and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Bikuweraki Womens Group

texts.en: Jane, a mother of four, has operated a business selling clothes for the past 15 years in Jinja. Offering a variety of the latest designer skirts, dresses, shirts, t-shirts, trousers, etc., she earns a weekly income of  UGX 80,000. Jane will use her portion of the loan to purchase bales of new clothing to resell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase bales of new clothing to resell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en: Atta is single parent and has one child. Atta is a hairdresser and owns a beauty salon in Ankako, which she has done for four years. Atta uses her income to feed herself and her child. Atta will use the loan to buy hair wigs and  hair creams for her beauty shop. With the new profits, Atta wishes to expand her salon.

loans.use: buy hair wigs and  hair creams

loans.name: Pierrette's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pierrette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 30 ans. Pierrette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pierrette est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Simon. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportés Pierrette et son mari. Pour cette raison, Pierrette vend du du gari (farine de manioc) et des bananes à son domicile et de façon ambulante depuis une vingtaine d'année. Parallèlement à son activité, Pierrette  vend aussi du maïs,ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Pierrette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pierrette sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des bananes et du maïs.

loans.name: Hải

texts.en:
Mrs Hải is 24 years old and she is married.
 
She has had a retail business selling dry food and general thing for 2 years.
Hải lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
 Her family has no latrine. The most difficult that she face is lack of capital to build a new latrine, Huệ is request a loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to purchase cement, brick, sand,... to build a hygienic toilet. This is the first loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Hải hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, brick, sand,... to build a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eliza would like to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Damet

texts.en:
Damet has had his own auto-repair business since 2001.
With this business he has been able to provide his children with an education.
He wishes to see his children successfully finish their education and ensure an opportunity for them for a better future.
This 33-year-old man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has 2 children.
Having borrowed $600 he purchased paint and other materials.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy spare parts. He wants to offer better services to his customers and increase the number of his customers.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Ngot

texts.en: Mrs. Ngot and her husband are of the same of age, 42. They have 4 children between the ages of 8 and 22. Mr. Toan, her husband had cancer, so the family sold all their land to pay $3125 for his medical treatment. Now, Mr. Toan has to have a follow up examination at the hospital every two months. The family expenses are about $50 for this. Mrs. Ngot‘s eldest child works as a daily laborer, and her second helps Mrs. Ngot to sell meat at the local market. Her third and four children are going to school in grades 9 and 3. Roast pork selling is important to increase her income by about $0.75/person/month. Their average income is low at about $8/person/month. Mrs. Ngot repaid a loan of $32 in time. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $50 again for her selling business.

loans.use: Increase her business of selling roast pork.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en:
Thuan's husband is a” honda driver” and she sells many kinds of cake, carrying her products on foot or using a bicycle. Their three children are in school (7th, 6th, and 3rd class); their oldest boy (13 years old) suffers from asthma. The family owe $312.50 to a bank on a loan they took out to buy the father’s motorbike. Their average income is $10 per month per person.

Thuan wants to borrow $ 50 to increase the capital available for her micro-business. She will repay it over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: increase available capital for her cake sales

loans.name: Mann

texts.en: Mrs. Mann S. is 28 years old and mother of two little children. They live in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Mann works as a housewife looking after her little kids, while her husband works as a taxi-driver, earning about $5 each day. This loan will be potentially used for her family to purchase a used car to operate a business. Mann believes that her husband will be able to earn more if he drives their own taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a used car to use to operate a business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
My construction work seems never-ending and I would like to finish it to be able to live in the rooms. I have already been delayed because of a lack of money but the cold and wet season is approaching and I am worried that my family will be uncomfortable because of the little space that we have. I am asking for a loan of $1,000.00 to finish the construction work on my house.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar y me gustaría terminarla para poder habitar esos cuartos, ya que me he tardado un poco debído a la falta de dinero pero se acerca la temporada de lluvias y de frío así es que me preocupa que mi familia este incómoda debido al poco espacio que tenemos" Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para terminar la construcción de mi vivienda

loans.use: To finish construction work on my house

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima K. lives in Mastchokh; she is married and has 3 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 but is a serious client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  Mrs. K. is in the business of rice selling. She has a direct supplier, which allows her to sell rice at a price lower than the bazaar price. She is very polite and has permanent clients who want to buy only from her. She is very experienced in the business.  Mrs. K. requests a loan for US$300 for business development. She wants to increase sales volume to increase family income which would allow her daughter to continue her education.

loans.use: for business development.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossi Agbodazé is 36 years old, married, and has five (05) children. He has been working as a carpenter for 7 years. He bought a grain mill which allows the conversion of millet or maize into flour to make food paste. This business lightens the burden on the women of the neighbouring villages. The income drawn from this business will allow Mr. Agbodazé to educate his children and meet the family's needs. With this loan, Mr. Agbodazé is thinking of improving the equipment in his mill to make it more competitive.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mr Kossi Agbodazé est âgé de 36 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. Il exerce l’activité de menuisier depuis 7 ans. Il a achèté un moulin à gran qui permet de transformer le mil ou le mais en farine pour la fabrication de pates alimentaires . Cette activité allège la souffrance des femmes des villages environnants Le revenu tiré de son activité lui permet de scolariser ces enfants et faire face aux autres charges de famille. Avec le présent emprunt Mr Kossi Agbodazé pense aménager le local de son moulin pour rendre son service plus compétitif

loans.use: To fit out a mill office

loans.name: Asghari's Group

texts.en:
I am Asghari N., the leader of a group of three other women: Haseena B., Sardaran B., and Samina B.. We have been together for almost a year and have always helped each other in times of need. In addition, we all are aware of the importance of hard work and exert a lot of effort to make our businesses prosper.

I have six kids, and my husband manufactures furniture. He has been in this business for more then 15 years. We would use the loan to buy wood in bulk. Haseena B. would use the loan for the family's business in second-hand items. Sardaran B. wants to purchase a rickshaw. Samina B. would invest the loan in the family’s fruit business.

loans.use: Buy wood in bulk

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert trabaja como agente de seguros y los fines de semana toca guitarra en un grupo de música tropical.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Santa Rosa Grande de la Ladera Norte de la ciudad de La Paz..
Es soltero y vive en la casa de sus abuelos y los gastos de alimentación, educación y otros los cubre con su trabajo ya que es independiente.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para realizar el pago de matricula y mensualidades en la Universidad Salesiana de Bolivia.
Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Pago de matricula y mensualidades en la Universidad Saleciana donde él estudia.

loans.name: Annie's Group

texts.en:
My name is Annie J., I am married with six children, and I have lived all my life in Raiwind, Pakistan. As I did not receive education when I was young, I do not want the same fate to befall my kids. Therefore, I enrolled all my kids to school, all of whom have continued except for one son, who paints buildings. My husband is also a painter and paints buildings on contract. We would like to request a loan to buy paint brushes, a ladder and few other related items.

I have been joined in my loan group by several other women who are: Parween A., who needs a loan for her gas cylinders business; Shamim A., who is borrowing for her communications office; Suriya B., who wants to fix her car’s engine; and Martha B. who will invest her share of loan in her lumber yard.

loans.use: Buy paint brushes, ladder and few other related items

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juanita is well loved and respected in her community. Despite her age she remains eager to get ahead and support her daughters and granddaughters. Through her work she aims each day to improve their quality of life. She is coming to you today to kindly request a loan for expanding her beauty salon, a small business she opened with her daughters. A courageous mother, Juanita believes that expanding her beauty salon and providing good service will enable her to increase the number of clients and, at the same time, her income. Your contribution will enable her to make her dreams come true.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Doña Juanita, es muy querida y respetada en su localidad, pese a su avanzada edad sigue ansiosa D. seguir adelante y apoyar a sus hijas y nietecitas en sus actividades con el fin D. buscar día a día mejorar su calidad D. vida.La razón por la que se presenta ante vosotros es para solicitarte gentilmente un préstamo para implementar su salón D. belleza, pequeño negocio que abrió en sociedad con sus amadas hijas.Esta valerosa madre considera que implementando su salón y brindando un buen servicio logrará ampliar la cantidad D. clientes y por enD. sus ingresos económicos.Tu aporte permitirá cristalizar los sueños D. esta querida madre.

loans.use: Capital injection for expanding her beauty salon

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim S. is Khmer cake seller in Trapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 36 and a widow with two children, both of whom are staying at home to help their mother's business. The whole family now relies on Mrs. Yim S. and the family is in poor financial circumstances.  They live in an old house and during the rainy season the roof always leaks. Mrs. Yim S. is requesting a loan to buy zinc sheet metal to replace the old roof.

loans.use: To buy zinc sheet metal to replace the old roof

loans.name: Theng

texts.en:
Mr. Theng Y., 44, and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Chhoeng, 39, live along national road number one about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2003 and have one daughter.   

Mr. Theng has been a motor taxi (Tuk Tuk) driver since 2005. He works in Phnom Penh City, while his wife works at home caring for their daughter. Currently his motor taxi is broken needs repair. Also, the staircase to their home is old and needs fixing. He is requesting a loan of $1200 to repair his motor taxi and make a new staircase to replace the old one.

loans.use: To make a new staircase to replace the old one and repair his motor taxi (Tuk Tuk)

loans.name: Umarali

texts.ru:
Umarali B. lives in the Shahrinav region of Tajikistan. He is a translator by trade but because it is difficult to find a job, for the part fifteen years he has been engaged in agriculture. For sowing wheat in the fall, he plans to obtain a loan that would allow him to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Бобохонов Умарали проживает в районе Шахринау. Учился на переводчика английского языка , но в связи с тем, что на данный момент найти работу очень сложно он занимается земледелием. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет. Для посева пшеницы к осеннему сезону, планирует получить кредит и закупить семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Thi Tinh's Group

texts.vi:
Đào Thị Tính(Ms 23070006), sinh năm 1961, tham gia mức vay4.876.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Hàng ngày cô tăng gia sản xuất và đi chợ bán rau. Cô sống cùng chồng và 4 con nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học nên phần nào còn vất vả. Chồng cô đi làm có thu nhập ổn định. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Vốn là người đảm đang và được mọi người tin tưởng nên cô được bầu làm nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn. Trong nhóm cô còn có:
Nguyễn Thị Tiền(Ms 23070062), sinh năm 1971, chị tham gia vay ở mức vốn 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư thức ăn chăn nuôi với trang trại khoảng 1000 con gồm gà, vịt, ngan.
Nguyễn Thị phương(Ms 23070063), sinh năm 1972, chị tham gia vay vốn ở mức 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
Đồng Thị Thủy(Ms 23070065 ), sinh năm 1961, tham gia mức vay 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi.
Nguyễn Thị Xuân(Ms 2307005), sinh năm 1979, tham gia vay vốn ở mức 4.028.000 vnđ để mở rộng cửa hàng may mặc.
Nguyễn Thị Hà(Ms 23070110), sinh năm 1966, Tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 1.972.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
Đào Thị Lan(Ms 23070111), sinh năm 1972, tham gia vay vốn mức: 1.972.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi gà, vịt.
texts.en:
Đào Thị Tính(Ms 23070006), sinh năm 1961, tham gia mức vay4.876.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Hàng ngày cô tăng gia sản xuất và đi chợ bán rau. Cô sống cùng chồng và 4 con nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học nên phần nào còn vất vả. Chồng cô đi làm có thu nhập ổn định. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Vốn là người đảm đang và được mọi người tin tưởng nên cô được bầu làm nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn. Trong nhóm cô còn có: Nguyễn Thị Tiền(Ms 23070062), sinh năm 1971, chị tham gia vay ở mức vốn 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư thức ăn chăn nuôi với trang trại khoảng 1000 con gồm gà, vịt, ngan. Nguyễn Thị phương(Ms 23070063), sinh năm 1972, chị tham gia vay vốn ở mức 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Đồng Thị Thủy(Ms 23070065 ), sinh năm 1961, tham gia mức vay 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi. Nguyễn Thị Xuân(Ms 2307005), sinh năm 1979, tham gia vay vốn ở mức 4.028.000 vnđ để mở rộng cửa hàng may mặc. Nguyễn Thị Hà(Ms 23070110), sinh năm 1966, Tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 1.972.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn. Đào Thị Lan(Ms 23070111), sinh năm 1972, tham gia vay vốn mức: 1.972.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi gà, vịt.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Isabel M. nasceu na província de Gaza tem 48 anos de idade é casada maritalmente e mãe de 5 filhos e o mais velhos tem 29 anos de idade e os mais novos são gémeos e estudam na 9ªclasse, para alem dos seus filhos sustenta dois sobrinhos que vive com eles.

Isabel estudou ate 6ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus pais, em 1977 incorporou se nas forças armadas de Moçambique e em 1981 foi desmobilizada, desde 1981 trabalha com civil no hospital militar como assistente  administrativa.

Funcionaria do ministério da defesa a Maios de 20 anos com um horário das 7:30 ate as 15:30 tem um salário mensal de 2779,21mt . este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva nunca teve noutras instituições. Os dois primeiros foram aplicados na construção da sua residência e com pretende fazer os acabamentos e construção do muro de vedação.

Assim num futuro tão breve pretende mobilar a casa e conta com apoio de credito.
texts.en:
Isabel M., 48, married, was born in the city of Gaza, in Mozambique. She is the mother of 5 children. Her oldest son is 29 years old, and her youngest, enrolled in the first year of high school, are twins. In addition to supporting her own kids she provides for two nephews, who live with them. Due to lack of financial resources, her studies were interrupted in 6th grade. She joined the military in 1977 forças armadas de Moçambique... until 1981, when she was....desmobilizada... and started working in a Military Hospital as an administrative assistant. She's been working full-time for the Department of Defense for over 20 years with a monthly salary of 2779,21 MT. This is her third loan cycle with Hluvuku and the first through Kiva. Her first two loans were used to build her house and now she pretends to invest the money from this loan on finishing touches and insulation. In the future with the help of another loan, she hopes to furnish her house. TRANSLATION INCOMPLETE BUT NAOMI SUBMITTED AS A DUPLICATE

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de material de construçao

loans.name: Basilia Yamilet

texts.es: Doña Basilia habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Olor Palme, tiene 31 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada y se desempeña como técnico en sonido, el negocio de la Sra. Basilia es la costura, vende ropa y productos de cosmético desde hace dos años, pues inicio, sola con la experiencia que adquirió en una empresa de la zona franca ya que cuando comenzó estuvo en las maquinas de coser, ya que era una fabrica de hacer ropa. También aprovechaba y vendía cosméticos a sus compañeras de trabajo lo cual vendía al crédito y al contado. Con la solicitud del préstamo quiere comprar ropa nueva, cosméticos y tela para hacer encargo de costura, pues ha logrado tener clientela y espera crecer más.  A largo plazo es poder tener un taller de costura con muchos trabajadores, tener un hijo ya que he tenido problemas para quedar embarazada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Basilia lives in the neighborhood called Olor Palme, in the capital city of Managua. She is 31 years old and her husband works for a private company as a sound technician. Mrs. Basilia has a dressmaking business, and also sells clothing and cosmetic products. She has been doing this this for two years and started her business on her own using the experience that she acquired working for a clothing factory in the duty free zone, where she worked using sewing machines. She also would sell cosmetics, on credit or for cash, to her co-workers. With the proceeds of this loan she wants to buy new clothing. cosmetics and cloth to fulfill her sewing orders, since she has obtained customers and hopes to further grow. In the long term, she would like to have a dressmaking shop with many workers, and she would also like to have a child, since she has not been able to get pregnant.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothing for adults and children and cloth to make dresses.

loans.name: Ulukberdi

texts.en:
Ulukberdi is 34 years of age and lives with his wife and two children. He is a livestock breeder who has sheep that he breeds and grazes every morning. He has been doing this for the past seven years and considers it very profitable. He takes his livestock to the pastures every morning for nourishment. After caring for them for several months, he then takes them to be sold. This phase is complicated due to transportation issues. Because he does not own his own vehicle, he must adjust to the schedules and prices that are offered to him. He also sporadically ventures into agriculture, but he does not do this full-time because he believes that times have changed considerably for it to be a satisfactory occupation.

Ulukberdi’s two children are his reason for continuing his efforts as a livestock breeder and farmer. Today, he wishes to invest in the improvement of sheep, which is more profitable in the markets.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Cette dame de cinquante cinq (55) exerce dans le commerce de boissons.  Elle réside dans le quartier de Djidjolé et s’approvisionne aux points de dépôts de la brasserie du Bénin. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour répondre favorablement à la demande élevée surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année. Avec ce crédit elle va acheter set (07) casiers de bière et sept dame jeanne (boisson locale).
Elle est mariée à BALENG qui est employé à air Zaïre, ils ont ensemble cinq enfants (05) à charge.
texts.en:
This 55-year-old lady has a business selling drinks. She lives in the Djidjolé neighborhood and buys her inventory at the Benin Brewery depots. She is requesting this first loan from WAGES so that she will be able to meet the higher demand during the end-of-year festivities. With this loan she will buy 7 crates of beer and 7 demi-johns of a local drink.

She is married to Baleng, who is an employee of Air Zaire, and they are raising 5 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Ith

texts.en: Mrs. Ith H. is a 41-year-old widow who lives in Tadork Pong village in Takeo province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase a cow for breeding and for plowing the field for cultivation. Mrs. Ith H. is the mother of three children, two of whom are construction workers while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding and for plowing her field for cultivation.

loans.name: Caroline's Group

texts.en:
Caroline B. is one of the executive members of her lending group in Mityana. She is a married lady and trained to run a clinic, which is her business. She treats people and sells medicine to her patients. Her clients like this type of health service because there is a personal touch attached when you visit a private clinic as compared to the big Government hospitals. This is why trained clinicians like Caroline are in business. She offers over the counter health services as well as providing first aid and minor surgeries. Caroline treats her patients well. 

Caroline is requesting a loan to help stock her clinic with medicines like tablets, syrups, cotton wool, syringes, needles, so that she can earn a reasonable profit from her business.

loans.use: To buy medicines like tablets, syrups, cotton wool, syringes,and needles .

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel sells ice cream retail to his customers. He has a bicycle that he uses to hawk his ice cream within his community in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He hopes for the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more ice cream to sell. He is 40 years old and married with a child. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice cream to sell

loans.name: Santos Marivel

texts.es:
La señora Santos Marivel C. García tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Santos empezó con Manuela Ramos, en la venta de cerveza y así con el capital que se generaba poco a poco fue surtiendo su tienda de abarrotes, el negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco “Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes para poder competir con los demás negocios ubicados a su alrededor.
Con el crédito de 500 soles , que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de una vitrina y abarrotes al por mayor para equipar su negocio.
Santos tiene como sueño, viajar con su familia disfrutar del bienestar de su familia y la prosperidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos Marivel C. García is 34 years old and lives in the Salaverry district, province of Trujillo, in La Libertad. She completed her secondary school studies, and has 2 children who depend on her financially. Santos started with Manuela Ramos in the sale of beer; with the capital from this endeavor she slowly was able to supply her grocery store, which she runs out of her home. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, she invested in the purchase of groceries so she could compete with the other businesses around her. With the loan of 500.00 soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of a display case and groceries at wholesale for her store. Santos’ dreams include traveling with her family, and enjoying the family’s well-being and the prosperity of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a display case and groceries at wholesale for her store.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Mrs. Meryn R. is 32 years old, married and lives at Poblacion, Oroquieta City. She has 2 children. Her husband is a government employee but receives only a minimum wage rate. All her children are sent to private schools. In this case, she has to have an extra income for the coming school year. She decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last August 2008 to avail its loan facilities. They started a business buying and selling firewood after their wedding day. The initial capital was a gift from their parents. Today, she applies for PHP 7,000 to buy additional firewood, goods and electronic load for “sari-sari” (general) store. She’s hopeful that she will be able to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional goods/utilities for a general store

loans.name: Ekuwa

texts.en:
Ekuwa T. is married with 6 dependents and has received no formal education. Since 2001 she has worked as a trader, selling foodstuffs in Ankwanda near Elmina. While Ekuwa works as a trader, her husband is employed as a fisherman. Ekuwa uses her income to pay for her family’s school fees and light bill.

She will use the loan to purchase maize, gari and fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekuwa plans to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale

loans.name: Umarboy

texts.ru: Усмонов Умарбой 1951 года рождения , женат имеет 3 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Сотрудничает с Микроинвест 2005 года. Торгует рисом на рынке. Частично также работает в государственном предприятии водного хозяйства. Но изза низкого оклада занялся бизнесом в 5 лет назад. Узнал о кредите Микроинвест от друзей и родственников и решил получть также кредит и сейчас благодаря кредиту от КИВА улучшил свое положение и рад этому.
texts.en:
Umarboy U. was born in 1951, married, and has 3 children. He has a high school education. Umarboy has been working with MicroInvest since 2005. He sells rice at a local market. Umarboy U. also works at a state water supply management organization, but his pay there is low. To supplement his income, Umarboy started his rice selling business 5 years ago. Umarboy learned about MicroInvest and Kiva loan programs from his friends and relatives. The previous loans helped Umarboy improve his life quality and expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa León de 55 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene cinco hijos tres mayores de edad y dos estudian, es soltera y su negocio es la venta de fritanga y una pequeña pulpería que administra desde hace seis años, este negocio lo inicio con ahorros y es su sexto crédito en Afodenic y lo va invertir en la compra de granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz, productos lácteos, para incrementar su inventario y elevar las ventas. Los planes para su familia es poder hacer mejoras a su vivienda ya que es sencilla e insegura por que parte de la vivienda esta forrada de zinc y desea dejar a sus hijos una casa digna.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa L. is 55 years old, single and lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliacion. She has five children three of them are adults and two are students. Her business is the sale of fried meals and a grocery shop that she has managed for six years, which she started with her savings.

This is her sixth loan with Afodenic. She is asking for a loan to buy basic grains such as beans, rice and dairy products, to increase her inventory and sales. She hopes to be able to make improvements in her house because it is basic and unsafe since part of it is lined with zinc. She wants to give a decent home to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Муллажонов Сайфулло -молодой человек 31-го года ,женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Сайфулло- старший сын в семье и поэтому, чтобы помочь своим родителям решил заняться откормом и купля-продажей скота.Он имеет опыт в сфере животновдства, так  как помогал своему отцу откармливать крупно-рогатый скот. На полученный кредит он расчитывает купить дойную корову, чтобы иметь дополнительный доход для своей семьи. В этом ему будет помогать его жена Салимова Мухайё.Кроме того он работает  маляром в автотехстанции
texts.en:
Saifullo M. is a young, 31-year-old man. He is married and has a child. Saifullo is the oldest son in his family and decided to become involved in livestock feeding and sales in order to help his parents. He has experience in the animal husbandry field because he used to help his father feed cattle. He wants to use this loan to buy a dairy cow and have an additional source of income for his family. His wife, Muhaiyo Salimova, will be helping him with the business. Saifullo also works as a painter at an auto shop.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Petrona De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Petrona de Los Angeles Q. Torres.  Tiene la edad de 42 años el negocio de la señora consiste en una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que es una mujer muy responsable y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. Tiene un varón de 7 años su compañero de vida está fuera del país, por lo que la crianza de su hijo, solamente le corresponde a ella. El negocio de ella consiste en una pulpería que está ubicada en su casa de habitación tiene además de mantener este negocio, Petrona imparte clases en colegio muy humilde de su comunidad. En la actualidad ella ya ha realizado 2 financiamientos en fundación LEON 2000 para la pulpería. La señora Petrona aspira mantener su negocio y lograr tener más recursos para mantener con varios productos en su negocio y de esta manera ayudarse para la crianza de su hijo ya que ella es madre soltera y su pareja no la ayuda económicamente a su hijo.
texts.en:
Petrona de Los Angeles Q. Torres is 42 years old, and she runs a small grocery store. She has dedicated herself to this business for over 5 years; she is a very responsible woman and enjoys her work very much. She has a 7-year-old son, and her life partner is currently outside the country, because of this she is solely responsible for raising her son. Her small grocery store is located in her house and in addition to maintaining this business she also gives classes in a humble school in her community. Currently she has had 2 loans through the LEON 2000 Foundation, which she invested in her grocery store. Petrona hopes to maintain her business and to be able to have more resources available to her to be able to carry various products in her business; in this way she will be able to help herself in raising he son given that she is a single mother and her partner does not help financially with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Witnes is a member of the Kichangani borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 30-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of two children aged 7 years and 1 year old. She also cares for two other dependents.

Three years ago, Witnes started her own business selling food. She works six hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Witnes’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice and wheat. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, she hopes to save money and expand her business. 

Aisha, Ashura, Mwajabu and Rehema are the other members of the Kichangani borrower group. They requested 150,000 Tsh each in order to support their own businesses.

loans.use: To buy more rice and wheat

loans.name: Chimène

texts.fr: Chimène est née le 21/11/1980 à Adjohoun au Sud du Bénin. Chimène est mariée à ZINSOU Armand ; ils ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Chimène et sa famille vivent à Cotonou depuis huit ans. C’est Chimène et son mari qui supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Chimène vend chez elle à la maison dans une boutique qu’elle a ouverte à cet effet, des poissons, poulets, saucisses et ailerons congelés. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Chimène s’approvisionne en tous ces produits. Chimène a un an d’expérience dans cette activité. Chimène est à son quatrième crédit avec ALIDé. Chimène est un bon client qui rembourse bien ses prêts. Chimène sollicite ce prêt-ci pour diversifier son activité à la vente des œufs et huile végétale.

loans.use: Achat de cartons de poissons congelés, des œufs et de bidons d’huile végétale.

loans.name: Karen Lisseh

texts.es: Karen Lisseh G. C.  reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Karen tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo Ernesto de 3 años de edad. Karen posee un pequeño negocio de venta de comida típica desde su casa, donde todos los días monta sus mesas con variedad de productos, a la vista de las personas. Karen tiene una buena clientela, no posee competencia en la zona; ahora solita un crédito para la compra de materia prima que le permita aumentar la producción de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Karen Lisseh G. C. lives in Arce City in the district of La Libertad. She is 26 years old, married, and has a 3 year old son named Ernesto.

Karen has a small business selling traditional foods from her home, where she sets up tables with a variety of dishes in view of people who pass through her neighborhood. She has a good client base and does not have any competitors in her area. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients so that she can increase her production and offer more dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients used in her dishes

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is married with four children. His wife doesn't work and so his bookstore is the only source of income for the family.

Mohammad started this bookstore with 500 USD capital eight years ago as a small kiosk at the entrance to a school.  Now he has a good bookstore where he sells books, copy books, office tools, and also gifts and accessories.

Mohammad requested the loan to meet the demand of schools that request a lot of photocopying of documents. He wants to buy a photocopier with the loan.

Mohammad appears in the photo at the entrance to his bookstore and, in the small inset photos, inside his shop.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Anthony A Nkalubo Harriet Group

texts.en: N. Harriet is a hard working business woman of forty years old, married with three children of whom two are going to school and she has six dependents schooling too. She owns rental houses since the year 2003. She is requesting for the loan to purchase paint, cement for renovating her rental houses. This rental houses are playing a big role in helping her family mostly in educating the children, feeding the family and so forth. In addition to that, she is selling water to community members helping her as side business too. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase paint, cement for renovating her rental houses.

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru: Хайруллоев Зариф проживает в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Зариф более 10 лет работает по специальности "механиком". Вот более 4 лет начал заниматся животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для покупки крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Zarif H. lives in the Abdurahmon-Jomi region. He is 39 years old. He is married and has six children. Zarif has worked as a mechanic for more than ten years. As of four years ago he started doing animal husbandry. He feeds and sells cattle. He is asking for a loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena O. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has three adult children. Nena owns and operates a business providing tricycle transport in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,500 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase an additional tricycle. Nena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used purchase an additional tricycle. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional tricycle again

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.en:
Zafarjon S. is 37 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a secondary education and has an animal husbandry business. He has a small cow house where he breeds calves.

Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. Zafarjon buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food.

Zafarjon wants to buy more cattle and needs money so he decided to apply for a loan of 1500 USD.

Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur, and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan.

Your support will really help him. Zafarjon is counting on your help.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Unurjargal

texts.en:
B. Unurjargal is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". Both his young son and daughter attend kindergarten. Unurjargal has operated a taxi service in his town since 2004. He transports people around his town as well as to different areas throughout Hovd province. He has gained much experience over the years and is a trusted driver for his many customers. Unurjargal is a very hardworking person and is known for his good character. He is working hard to maintain his success and has much hope for the future. He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan to purchase parts for his taxi. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase parts for his taxi

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie T., 51, is a rice farmer. She has four adult children. She is seeking additional capital for her business so that she will be able to have an abundant harvest to buy her family an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of 10,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her crops well.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en: Mrs. Sokun K. lives in Chambok village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who earns a small income to help support her family. She now wants to expand her business so she decided to request a loan to buy more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sey Cheam, is an electrician. Mrs. Sokun K. is a mother of three children who are all students.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. S., 38, is married to Dara, age 49. They both are parents who are blessed with two children who are going to school and dependent on them. Presently S. and her husband depend on income from their annual business whose the main activity is to cultivate various vegetable and fruit crops, which she will harvest and sell to buyers when they are matured. Recently S. doesn’t have enough capital to perform in her crop-planting business, so she decided to look a loan of US $500, and she will buy fertilizers and watermelon seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and watermelon seeds to grow.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Mrs. Lon U. lives in Phngeas village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field where she cultivates rice. She now has a problem because the soil in her field is infertile. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to improve the field. She will use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides to kill insects. Her husband, Mr. Non Chhaem, breeds cows. Mrs. Lon U. is the mother of five children, one of whom works in a garment factory. The other three are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve her land and to buy pesticides

loans.name: Icyubahiro Group

texts.en:
Assia is 32 years old and she is single.  Assia is the president of a group called 'Icyubahiro'.  This group consists of 3 people who operate businesses selling clothes in Rwamagana, a region of Kibungo situated in the eastern province of Rwanda.  This is their 6th successful year in this business and the hours of their business are from 8 AM until 6PM every day.

Assia and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their businesses through purchasing a variety of clothing styles (for babies and children, men and women).  With this business expansion, this group hopes to attract more customers as well as increase sales.  If this is successful, Assia and her team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to reinvest in their business in order to keep the progress of their business as well as building a secure future for each member's family.

loans.use: Additional clothes for sale

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La Señora Reyna Isabel tiene 44 años, Tiene 3 hijos y estudian para ser muy buenos profesionales. La actividad económica de Reyna es brindar el servicio de Gimnasio, hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio por sus hijos que le ayudaron y poyaron con esta idea, pues no tiene mucha competencia y ella se preocupa por proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. Es por eso que solicito ayuda a Fundación León 2000 con el fin de comprar ciertas maquinas y reparar ciertos equipos. Sus deseos son de ampliar su establecimiento para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel is 44 years old. Her three children study at school so they will have good professions. For more than 3 years now, Reyna has run a small gym. She started this business with the help of her children. They don't have a lot of competition, and Reyna worries about managing all of the clients who come to her. She is requesting a loan to purchase new machines and repair equipment. She would like to grow her establishment and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her small gym and grow her income by purchasing new machines and making repairs

loans.name: Sourou Monique

texts.fr: G. Sourou Monique est née vers 1955 et vit depuis huit ans au quartier Missessin à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à KATADJO Cyprien, Sourou Monique est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Sourou Monique n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Il y a trois ans, en vue de contribuer à assurer les dépenses familiales, Sourou Monique a commencé la vente de nourriture (riz, accompagnée de sauce de tomate) à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sourou Monique vend de l'huile d'arachide. Sourou Monique s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Face à la demande un peu plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Sourou Monique souhaite augmenter sa production alimentaire et son stock d'huile, afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenu. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un quatrième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sourou Monique G. was born around 1955 and has lived for the past eight years in the Missessin district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Cyprien KATADJO, Sourou Monique is mother to one child who is at school. The couple covers the family expenses together. Sourou Monique attended primary school only. In order to contribute towards family expenses, Sourou Monique began three years ago to sell food (rice accompanied by tomato sauce) from her home. At the same time, she sells peanut oil. Sourou Monique gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. She is an old customer of ALIDé who repays her loans correctly. Faced with modestly increasing demand from her customers, Sourou Monique would like to increase her production of food and her stock of oil, in order satisfy better her customers' needs and to make more money. For this reason she is applying for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cans of oil and bags of rice
