loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal U. and her husband, Mr. Leang Seak, have been married since 1990 and have one daughter who is in school. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophal has been selling food and rice for more than two years. Her husband has been driving a taxi for more than ten years as well, but his taxi breaks down and does not work well.

Hence, Sophal is asking for her second loan of $1,000 to repair her husband’s taxi. She will also use a part of her loan to put an addition on her house.

loans.use: To repair her husband’s taxi and put an addition on her house

loans.name: Malou

texts.en:
Malou R. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. She is 25 years old, married and has 2 infants. Malou owns & operates a business selling clothes to the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2009, Malou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Malou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to increase her working capital. Malou is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Malou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en: Katerina, a married mother of three grown children, owns a greenhouse business that grows cucumbers, tomatoes and other vegetables. Not afraid of hard work, she has been in this business all of her adult life, her large family requiring lots of provision.  Katerina now needs to borrow 7,000 UAH to purchase fertilizers and film for the green houses. This will allow her to grow abundant crops on time and sell them at a better price.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and film for green house

loans.name: Mbula

texts.en:
Mbula is a married woman with four children, 3 girls and 1 boy. They all attend school. Her spouse sells spare parts. Sarah operates a grocery and also sells paraffin fuel. She hopes to buy more vegetables for her grocery and also buy five-20 litre containers of paraffin. She has been in the business for 5 years and previously was unemployed. She sells her products to her neighbors. She obtains other income from farming.

Her greatest business challenges are seasonality as she experiences low customer turn up during rainy seasons. She hopes to open a shop in the future. 
		
She decided to join Yehu after she saw other women benefiting from loans. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and  five-20 litre containers of paraffin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Plowing and buying manure and seeds

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan T. N. was born in 1977 and lives in Khu5 village. She has three children (two sons and one daughter).

Nhan T. N. and her husband sell building materials. They have a truck and her husband is a truck driver. They have a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND).

This is the first time Nhan T. N. has participated in SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her building materials shop.

loans.use: To expand her building materials shop

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: Agueda tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en su casa, que gracias a mucho esfuerzo lograron adquirir. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de ropa, siendo estas adquiridas en el mercado central de su ciudad y a un menor precio. Su forma de trabajo consiste en visitar a sus amistades y vecinos a ofrecer estos productos. El buen gusto que tiene Agueda para conseguir las prendas le ha dado mucha ventaja ante sus clientes, de esa manera logra vender con rapidez toda su mercadería. Ella se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, pues le es rentable, ya que el acceso a la zona en la que vive es complicado, es por ello que sus vecinas no pueden ir por sus propios medios a comprar ropa. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete de a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprar mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Agueda is 28 years old. She lives together with her husband and son in her house that they were able to acquire thanks to much effort. The business in which she works is clothing sales, which she acquires in the central market of her city and at a lower price. Her method of work consists of visiting her friends and neighbors to sell these products. Agueda’s good taste for getting clothing has given her a great advantage with her customers and she is able to sell all of her merchandise quickly. She feels very pleased with the work that she does and it is profitable since the access that the area in which she lives has is complex. As a result, her neighbors cannot go by their own means to purchase clothing. This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more clothing to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more items of clothing.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto D. S., aged 43, and his wife Hernani, are blessed in their marriage with a happy family. They live in Sabutan, Silang, Cavite. Modesto and his wife run a small fruit stand that sells pineapple, bananas and corn among other items, and which generates 18,000 PHP per month in earnings.
Modesto would like to expand his business with a loan of 10,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase additional varieties of fruit to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes that the additional variety will allow him to generate more revenue and increase the family's savings. Modesto hopes that eventually the business will generate enough revenue to allow him and his wife to have and support children.
Modesto has been a member of Kiva partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT), since 2005 and has consistently paid his weekly dues during fellowship meetings* . He is currently on his 12th loan with CCT. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. They gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is from the city of Prenza, Tangub City. She is 48 years old. Virginia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business selling a variety of different products like toothpaste and drinks in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Virginia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria Y. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is 56 years old, married, and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, she grows and sells rice. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $113 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Eleuteria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Eleuteria is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a parcel of land. This will be her 14th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a parcel of land

loans.name: Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es: La señora Olga tiene 49 años y es la secretaria del grupo “Shalom” que significa Dios con nosotros, los 8 miembros del grupo viven en Huaycan. Olga venD. ropa junto a su pareja, por este trabajo y los ahorros que ah acumulado ha enviado a sus dos hijas a la Argentina para que puedan prosperar por su parte, por su lado ella desea poner una galería D. venta D. ropas y para esto desea que Edaprospo aumente su capacidad D. Credito.
texts.en:
Olga, age 49, is secretary of the “Shalom” group. "Shalom" means God. The eight members of the group live in Huaycan. Olga and her life partner sell clothes together. With this work and the savings they gathered they have sent their two daughters to Argentina so that they are able to prosper. Olga wishes to establish a gallery selling clothes. In order to do so she wants Edaprospo to increase her loan limit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is 49 years old and is married; her husband is a tailor. She has seven children, four of whom go to school.

Rose currently sells clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more inventory to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Candida Azucena

texts.es:
Candida Azucena tiene  2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años es una mujer muy activa que disfruta de su actividad.
Realizar este tipo de actividad de manera ambulante ha sido muy satisfactorio es la mejor manera para conseguir clientes nuevos. Ella se encarga de preparar su bolso para mostrar a sus clientes la variedad de cosméticos que ofrece  Candida solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, los cuales son la materia prima para su negocio. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de poder mejorar sus ventas y de esta manera contribuir con los gastos del hogar, y brindarle todo lo que sus hijos necesitan como alimentación ropa y hogar.
texts.en: Candida Azucena has 2 children and she sells cosmetics. For more than 3 years she has been a very active woman who enjoys her business. This type of activity as a street vender has been very successful and it is the best way to acquire new customers. She is responsible for preparing her bag to show customers the variety of cosmetics she offers. Candida is requesting a loan so that she can buy more products, which are the raw material for her business.  All of this is done with the desire to improve her sales and contribute to the household expenses and provide everything her children need such as clothing and a home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mary Obaa Yaa

texts.en: Mary Obaa Yaa A. cooks several varieties of food for sale at Abura. Mary has received junior high education. She is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to cook to meet the request of her customers. She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs to cook

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 32 años, es una hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su hija Karol de 2 años y lo que más desea es brindarle un mejor futuro y por ellos esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro. Cuando era niño, sus padres le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres, ya que sus hermanos mayores decidieron dedicarse a otras actividades. Ahora tiene extensas tierras para sembrar cacao y hojas de coca, que luego de ser cosechados son vendidos en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar, pues sabes que gracias a esta actividad puede sustentar a su familia. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus productos de la plaga de insectos. Ahora su propósito es comprarse nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y hojas de coca, así también comprará fertilizantes para asegurar la productividad de sus frutos.
texts.en: Edgar is 32 years old and a simple and hard-working man.  He lives at his parents' house, along with his daughter, Karol, of 2 years old.  Above all, he wishes to offer her a better future and for that he is willing to working very hard.  When he was a child, his parents taught him everything he needed to know about their small farm and little by little with the passing of time, he began to become in charge of his parents' land, since his older siblings decided to dedicate themselves to other professions.  Nowadays, he has an extensive amount of land to plant cacao and coco leaves.  After they are harvested, they are sold in the city of San Francisco.  What he enjoys most about his job is the cultivation because he knows that, luckily, with this activity he can support his family.  He has spent the past 15 years working in agriculture and the most challenging part of it has been protecting his plants from pesticides.  His objective is to purchase new land to increase his cultivations.  This is his first credit with MFP and plans to be very punctual with his payments.  In his communal bank, he is a very supportive member of the rest of his group.  With the 1,000 Soles that he is applying for, he will purchase cacao seeds and coco leaves, in addition to fertilizers in order to assure the results of his hard work.

loans.use: Purchase cacao seeds, coco leaves, and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a father of four, aged between twelve and four.  He has been doing mixed  farming for over five years in his hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya.  He produces tomatoes, vegetables, and milk.

He requested this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He is optimistic the dairy product will give his family better living standards and educate his children.  He says he is focusing on expanding his farm to make the dairy business his source of livelihood.

He reiterates the fact that animal diseases are the greatest challenges.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow
